story:
Short Summary

Section 16 is about a teenage girl who gets victimized by the human trafficking industry. The book chronicles the thoughts, experiences, and emotions that go through her mind as her life gets upended by a series of unexpected turns.

My name is Sneha Nadella and I am the author of Section 16. I wrote this book because human trafficking is becoming increasingly prevalent and it’s important to realize how close to home it can hit for many of us.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the web-based nature of human trafficking and how its targeting tactics work. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to stop being just a passive listener, and instead take action and stimulate societal change.

Estelle is a 16-year-old girl leading a complicated home life in a tiny suburb at the west edge of New York State. As a fairly introverted girl who strays away from socializing, Estelle finds herself sticking next to her sister and sole confidante, Hazel. Running away from home and leaving Hazel is a huge deal for Estelle - that decision continues to follow her throughout the rest of her journey - but she feels that it is the right thing to do. Upon arriving at her family friend’s home, she has a great feeling as she immediately begins school and makes friends, but just as she's getting comfortable, she finds herself a victim of human trafficking. She's forced to push out of her comfort zone and build confidence that, unknowingly, resided in Hazel ever since her childhood. Facing that inner turmoil along with the trauma she experiences at the trafficking site are simultaneously Estelle's largest obstacles and strongest growth opportunities.

You will love this book if you strive to see social change and would like to gain an insider’s view to one of the many ways trafficking occurs.

Section 16 speaks to those who have reached the stage where they need to become more aware of some of society’s harsh realities, and to those who want to view courage and decision-making in a new light.

Ultimately, I hope that Section 16 inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can I make sure I am aware and safe, as well as others? How can I help more people understand when they are at risk of being trafficked?
  • How has human trafficking become the billion-dollar industry that it is?
  • What can I do to help end human trafficking?

As well as personal questions such as:

  • How do I know if I am trusting the right people or person?
  • What’s the worst possible thing that could happen the next time I take a chance on something? Will it really be that bad, or will it force me to pick myself up with thicker skin next time?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing the steps we can take towards making a change and why this change is so important will benefit not only current and potential victims, but society as a whole.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall.
When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About The Author

Sneha Nadella is a high school student who has been a human trafficking activist for the past three years. She founded an anti-trafficking club at her school, and is the co-host of the Let’s Talk Trafficking podcast where she speaks with survivors of human trafficking.

Sneha wrote this book after reflecting upon the stories she heard from talking to survivors. She was captivated by the widespread nature of trafficking. It was mostly just how easily anyone can fall prey to the system that drove Sneha to write Section 16, and represent just one of the many ways trafficking can happen.

Apart from her advocating interests, Sneha is an Indian classical Kuchipudi dancer, a competitive swimmer of 11 years, and an avid movie lover. She would rather be outdoors 90% of the time, and loves spending time with her friends and family. She wouldn’t turn down a good hike, movie night, or road trip.

For more information, you can connect with Sneha Nadella at snadella4@gmail.com and at @snehanadella on LinkedIn and @snehanadella_author on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Section16 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Sneha Nadella

story:
The Story of My Book

I began this journey intending to lash out against the oppression, hypocrisy and all that’s wrong with the West. However, I realized that Islam, misunderstood and maligned in public discourse, has a powerful message to offer in the free marketplace of ideas. Now I see my book as a bridge leading to a bigger, much needed discussion 

I’m Ashraf Nubani. My book New Kid on the Block: Islam’s Challenge for America draws attention to Islam and the West, two very powerful ways of life impacting the world today. It familiarizes Islam in America and provides some humble solutions to today’s problems.

Through interviews, research, and storytelling, you will meet:
 

Women who don’t fit the stereotype of the oppressed female 

Palestinians who struggle for the just cause of Palestine

Christians whose views on society, religion, feminism, and masculinity often mirror Islamic views


I hope this book will provide a tool to help show that faith--specifically the Muslim faith--is natural to human beings and indigenous to America. 

You don’t have to embrace Islam to benefit from its one thousand four hundred years of impactful tradition. You will love this book if you are willing to challenge your preconceived notions about Islam and Muslims. This book is for young people of all faiths and those who don’t identify with any faith at all. It is a wake up call to influencers, leaders, and decision- and policy-makers in government.

 

The Book - NEW KID ON THE BLOCK: ISLAM’S CHALLENGE FOR AMERICA

We are all slaves to something. To be truly liberated, I choose to be a servant of the Unseen, All-Powerful, and All-Knowing God, rather than being a slave to someone or something on earth. The reader will be introduced to Islam in a new way, and will be guided on how to read a book that discusses faith in a predominantly secular society. 

New Kid on the Block: Islam's Challenge for America is a nonfiction book, written to challenge your notions about Islam. It will challenge and empower you to live up to your own ideal of what it means to be human, free and American.

Secular and Profane. You, the reader, will be challenged to question secularism’s relationship with religion, and how faith and Islam do not necessarily equate with a theocracy.

Justice is not relative. The reader will learn that Muslims accused of terrorism are not “terrorists hell-bent on destroying America.” Justice means that the Palestinian issue is a just one demanding American support for the underdog.

Food is medicine. You will learn that the optimum human condition pays attention to and feeds mind, body, and soul. Find out what to eat, how to eat, and when to eat. It’s not the length of the life but the quality of life that’s most important.  


 

What I Need & What You'll Get

New Kid on the Block: Islam’s Challenge for America will be published with New Degree Press. To help cover the costs for publishing my book, I’ve set up pre-order tiers. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor who’ll help me revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.

The cover designer who’ll replace this mock placeholder with a professional, custom cover design. 

The layout editor who’ll put together the interior of my book and create my ebook.

The copy editor and proof reader who’ll polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts when I publish this summer.

When I reach 120 campaign backers, I will publish my book in paperback and ebook formats. When 150 people back my campaign, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When my campaign reaches 200 backers, I will bring these stories to life in an audiobook.

As a campaign backer, you’re not buying a copy of a book. You're investing in an opportunity to ride shotgun on my path to publishing. Pre-order my book now to receive an exclusive VIP experience, including:
 

You’ll receive a signed copy of my book when I publish this summer.

You’ll see your name in the Acknowledgments section of my book (Optional).

You’ll be invited to join my Author Community for early access to excerpts from my book.

You’ll have an opportunity to share your insight in the selection of my book cover. 

You'll get a rare glimpse behind the curtain of the publishing process to see what it takes to go from first draft to print.

And much more!

 

About the Author



Author Ashraf W. Nubani bridges a gap by drawing upon his many years of experience as an attorney, Muslim sermon giver, and Palestinian immigrant to the US.

An attorney known for representing the most vulnerable among us, Ashraf has a passion for beating the odds and presenting Islam in the free market place of ideas. He boldly demonstrates the goodness, relavance and staying power of Islam.

Ashraf, a Muslim, an American, a Palestinian immigrant, is a dedicated servant of humanity.  

To learn more about this project, connect with Ashraf W. Nubani at awnubani@gmail.com or at https://www.linkedin.com/in/awnubani/, @awnpotlaw https://twitter.com/awnpointlaw?lang=entwitter&... 

International Preorders

For international pre-orders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers apprised of my anticipated publishing date. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people simply cannot contribute to my campaign. If you find yourself in that position, I hope you’ll show your support in other ways. At the top of this page, you’ll find the option to Share my Indiegogo pre-sale campaign. Please copy the link and share it widely. 

Share it with your friends, family, and network on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn. If you’ll use #IslamsAmericanChallenge and tag me (@awnubani) as well as my publisher (@NewDegreePress), we’ll help amplify your efforts.

Share it with five friends, neighbors, colleagues, or classmates who might enjoy my book or the opportunity to join my publishing journey.

Share it via text message. Share it through direct messaging or email. Share it on social media. Share it and know that you’re making a difference.

Thanks for your support!

Sincerely,
Ashraf W. Nubani

story:
Fake Geek Girls Like Us aims to create a community space in which people who are made to feel unwelcome in geek culture because of their gender feel safe expressing themselves and sharing their artwork, thoughts, and ideas.

Fake Geek Girls Like Us presents Googie Girls a 20-page full-color zine exploring science fiction! Googie Girls features art, stories, and essays that share ideas on aliens, the future, and your favourite sci fi characters. 

(In case you didn't know, Fake Geek Girls Like Us is put on by one gal, Caitlynn Fairbarns, and I could really use your help!)

Artists and Writers featured in the zine:

Anna Campbell
Caitlynn Fairbarns
Carly Whitmore
Craestor
el Fury
Emily Fay Fin
Erika Victor
Julia Brown
Kathleen Aragon
Kimberly Genest
Lavinia Roberts
M. Natsin
Matthew Tribe
Mick Rose
Stela Starchild
Sophie Paas-Lang
Trixie Taeng

There are amazing perks available by Toronto artists, writers, burlesque stars, and activists. If you donate, you get things, and who doesn't like getting things? You also get to feel awesome because you helped out a small business.  Help support local artists by donating.

Where is the money going?

$600 - Printing & Shipping Costs

$1000 - Artist Honorariums

$200 - Promotional Needs (flyers, posters, videos etc)

$200 - Indiegogo Fees

Any additional earnings that we get will go straight to the artists and organizers.

In the video and in the paragraph above, we feature illustrations by Sophie Paas-Lang.

When you share, please tag Fake Geek Girls Like Us on social media:

facebook: www.facebook.com/fakegeekgirlslikeus

instagram: www.instagram.com/fakegeekgirlslikeus

tumblr: www.fakegeekgirlslikeus.tumblr.com

story:
Inner Compass cards point out a new way of self-reflection and personal growth.
The 49 cards guide you on a daily basis or whenever you need a question to be answered on a specific situation in your life. Anyone can use them, easily and effortlessly.

How?

Most people go through life distracted, having lost touch with what they really, really want out of life. Over time, confused by the constant demands and expectations around them, they have forgotten their potential.

The Inner Compass cards ask you questions to wake you up to the opportunities you’ve been missing out while you were sleepwalking through life.

What amazing person can you meet tomorrow if only you open your eyes and look up?

How would others respond differently when you speak from a place of compassion?

What unique choices would your authentic self make?

How would your life change when you start following your inner compass?


What are these Inner Compass cards?

The cards share profound universal wisdom and symbolism on a daily basis to guide your personal growth and awakening. The cards guide your perception, and by exploring the different themes you will discover the world as your playground. 

The deck consist of 49 carefully designed cards and an accompanying booklet to guide you on your journey of self-discovery. 

Each card is printed on high quality, sustainable paper and contains a single, focused word and image with many layers of symbolism and meaning for your subconscious to unpack. 

To go deeper into yourself you can learn more about each card in the booklet we have provided for you. The booklet also contains an introduction and a clear user manual so there’s no confusion whatsoever.

Like much of modern life, this entire project is eclectic in nature. Inspiration was found in sources ranging from philosophy, science, psychology and the natural world, to ancient wisdom from all ages, such as the Mayan culture, Taoism, Buddhism, and the I Ching.

By arranging and categorizing these sources along a specific algorithm, one card contains many levels of depth and interconnectedness. All for you to explore during many years to come!


How to use the deck

Some people like to use the deck every morning for a specific card to guide their day. Others might pick a card periodically, to shed light on an urgent issue or a question they might have. 

Sometimes you just want to know if you are heading the right way. At other times, you might need help to find a way out. Maybe you just want to leave it open, letting any associations come freely upon drawing a card.

Whatever the motive, after shuffling the deck with your focus and intention, just blindly pick one or more cards. Your intuition will guide you to find new patterns of meaning. It is impossible to choose the wrong card: the right one will always present itself!


The cards offer a precious way out of our scattered monkey minds. This is not the territory of any rational, logical, analytical brain. Rather, the ability to think intuitively and associatively takes over. And there is so much needed clarity in that!

By letting these archetypical motives prime your subconsciousness you will learn the potential your inner compass can have.

In time, should you want more information about a card and what it represents, you can read its accompanying text in the booklet. Here you will unravel the deeper layers of every card, all to guide your next steps on your personal journey.

As you understand now, anyone can do this. Easily. Effortlessly. Insightful. And fun!


Why I started this

I proudly share that I have found the right track, my yellow brick road, and I would like you to find it too! Or be reminded to stay on it, when you already found it…

Besides, I strongly believe in a proactive start of the day, instead of waking up and directly reacting on things that do not belong to you essentially.

Most of our known inspiring leaders, sages and thinkers choose consciously to start every day with awareness from within, without being distracted by messages from the outside world.


The process so far

The idea of creating this transformational tool came the moment I realized how the daily use of spiritual 'oracle cards' had managed to change my life fundamentally and positively. By drawing a card every morning after (or instead of) meditation, I kept my attention on my own life, and became aware of the parts that were serving me and those that were holding me back. Soon, I wanted to share this with all my friends, but the decks available were so... let's say esoteric. It felt like the time had come for a deck with a completely new design, style, images and another tone of voice. So I started gathering themes and before I even noticed, I was categorizing the material and writing texts about each card. And getting very, very inspired and enthusiastic!

From then the project grew like a seed grows into a tree: organically. 

The topics and the writing came by themselves. Only when I felt the moment was right did I act to follow my guts, and one day I connected with the perfect designer. Together we did a huge research project to come to the best look, feel, and depth for the deck. It started off with many ideas and collages. After a while it was like she could hop into my head and just knew what needed to be done in terms of visuals. 

Furthermore, we explored deeply what would and would not work in terms of material, print and themes. And we came to many, many layers for each card, making sure that the Inner Compass Cards always grow with you. Even after using them for the next ten years, you will still find new levels, insights and interconnectedness.


The team

As this product grew organically, the team did as well. It all started with myself, gathering an abundance of insights along my journey, when I finally found a way to incorporate into a concept and then condense into 49 cards!

After I reached the point of getting ready for visual support for the themes, I met Anneliek. She is an experienced (>20 yrs) graphic designer, extremely talented in translating my visions into a complete new and particular style. Our creative minds think alike!

Larissa is the editor. She is one of those people who seem to be talented in whatever they do – which usually is a lot. A matter of enjoyment, perseverance and perfectionism, as she calls it herself. The moment I found out that she writes beautifully, as well as being the chief editor of an international magazine, I knew she was the one for this job. She is also deeply connected to the conscious themes of the cards.

Next to being a philosopher and entrepreneur, Martijn is an interdisciplinary scientist and highly intelligent in fields like algorithms and probabilities. He conjoins layers and makes the deck reflecting the profound depth of our psyches.

For more about Neel, click the 'profile' button, top left.


Why we need your help

We spent the last eight months on making this idea become physical. Now we only need new friends, those who choose to walk their own paths too!

We are not a fancy pancy company with large resources. Just a lady with a mission who asked a designer, an editor and a number cruncher to hop on board to form a super dedicated team. And an amazing one at that!

What we will use your help for

  • Hiring the best as our final editor (meet Buffi: a well known English teacher and writer) 
  • Finalizing the deck designs and texts 
  • Printing the deck 
  • Publishing it so you and others who you are ready to follow their inner compass can have access

+ If the success of this campaign becomes as big as we think it deserves, we have ideas to develop an IOS and Android app, making it possible to carry the deck with you on your phone.


Other details

Dimensions of the box: approx. 7.5 x 5.5 x 1.1 inches or 19 x 14 x 2.8 cm Dimensions of a card: approx. 5 x 3.5 inches or 12.7 x 8.9 cm

Retail price will be 40 euros, but will cost as low as 25 for early backers up to 35 for late backers

Available languages for the first edition: English and Dutch

 

Thanks a million to my dear friends you who made this campaign possible: Dennis Lubbers for directing en filming. Fabio, Jimmy, Chiel, Ruby, Marlou, Emily, Siebe, Marline, Raafje en Denise for playing your beautiful selfs in the movie. Anneliek for the amazing work you did so far. Larissa and Martijn for the wise words and limitless advice. And Marleen Visser for the great pictures!

How?
Most people go through life distracted, having lost touch with what they really, really want out of life. Over time, confused by the constant demands and expectations around them, they have forgotten their potential.
The Inner Compass cards ask you questions to wake you up to the opportunities you’ve been missing out while you were sleepwalking through life.
What amazing person can you meet tomorrow if only you open your eyes and look up?
How would others respond differently when you speak from a place of compassion?
What unique choices would your authentic self make?
How would your life change when you start following your inner compass?

What are these Inner Compass cards?
The cards share profound universal wisdom and symbolism on a daily basis to guide your personal growth and awakening. The cards guide your perception, and by exploring the different themes you will discover the world as your playground. The deck consist of 49 carefully designed cards and an accompanying booklet to guide you on your journey of self-discovery. 
Each card is printed on high quality, sustainable paper and contains a single, focused word and image with many layers of symbolism and meaning for your subconscious to unpack. 
To go deeper into yourself you can learn more about each card in the booklet we have provided for you. The booklet also contains an introduction and a clear user manual so there’s no confusion whatsoever.
Like much of modern life, this entire project is eclectic in nature. Inspiration was found in sources ranging from philosophy, science, psychology and the natural world, to ancient wisdom from all ages, such as the Mayan culture, Taoism, Buddhism, and the I Ching. By arranging and categorizing these sources along a specific algorithm, one card contains many levels of depth and interconnectedness. All for you to explore during many years to come!

Some people like to use the deck every morning for a specific card to guide their day. Others might pick a card periodically, to shed light on an urgent issue or a question they might have.

story:
Hello,

 My name is Marco Lienhard. I have been playing  the Fue and other Japanese instruments for over 35 years. I was a member of Ondekoza for over 18 years, where I first learned and played the Fue. I speak Japanese and so I  was able to find some instruction books about the Fue to further my study, but a lot of people who want to play Fue do not speak Japanese. This book will finally give people a chance to study the Fue.

Update:

Thank you for helping me make this a successful campaign. We are definately printing the books to send very soon. We need help for our second goal  as many people have emailed me to see if we could record all 60 songs from the book to people with their study.

We will need to go into a studio and get the songs recorded,  there will be limited editing going into the recording as it will be mostly solo songs. We are thus setting our second  goal at $3500, for recording and editing the music and make it accessible online for a minimal fee. 

Indiegogo allows us to keep the project open after its deadline- so that more people can contribute to the campaign.

While teaching  the Shinobue around the world, I often get asked about books on Fue. Most of the books that exist are in Japanese. I thought, that it would be a good thing to finally get a book in English to help the growing  Japanese music  aficionado community to learn how to play the Fue. Over the years, I have put together a few pages of simple songs for use by my students and in workshops that I have taught. I have worked on this particular collection of music for several years and now it has the chance to finally become a book and get published. There are 55 songs that will be included and there are instructions on how to play the Fue as well and a fingering chart. Folk songs and original pieces arranged and composed by Marco Lienhard.  I have written several songs for my group Taikoza and here are the book will include simple versions them. There will be a short history of the Fue as well as instruction on how to create a sound and on how to create a better sound if you are already a Fue player. The exercises can be adapted to the different levels of your playing ability.  These songs can be played as solos or with Taiko accompaniment and the Etudes pieces will help you work on technique and to enrich your sound. This book will give you insight on playing the Fue and joy in practicing the Fue.

 Because I come across students who read Western music as well as those who read only Japanese notations, both Western and Japanese notations will be utilized in this book. By combining the two notational types, it is my hope that most people using this book will be pleased and learn to become familiar with both. I hope you will have fun and enjoy playing the songs.

I have worked for many years on the book and so it is ready to get published with your help. Your support will make it easier to actually go to press and make it available for people around the world as making it also available online.

Thank you for your support in making this possible!

Note: As rewards we have added wooden tags and  I have some plastic and bamboo Fue available. The bamboo Fue are the ones are recommend and use for my classes- they are tuned very precisely and will make you playing easier.

Also CD will be available as rewards- the music has been recorded on Taikoza 's new CDs.

story:
Short Summary

Last November, I self-published my first devotional book, Nobody Left Out: Jesus Meets the Messes. I learned a ton about the self-publishing business! (Including the financial costs associated with it.) This year, I have a goal to self-publish two more books, and I'd like to get the first one out by Easter. The content is already written. Now I just need some help getting it in book form!

Nobody Left Out: Jesus & the Way of Sorrows is a brief journey through the Stations of the Cross. The Stations of the Cross is a devotional exercise practiced across many Christian traditions. It follows Jesus' journey to the cross, beginning with Jesus praying in the Garden of Gethsemane and ending with his body being placed in the tomb. There are 14 stops, or stations, along this "Way of Sorrows." (There are two versions of the Stations of the Cross—Traditional and Scriptural. My book follows the Scriptural version, which means all 14 stations are rooted in events found in scripture.) The book also explains some of the significance behind this practice and why reflecting on suffering can be helpful.

The goal of all my books is to help people spend time with Jesus and get to know him a little better. With this book, I want to give readers the space to reflect on the sorrowful journey Jesus made to the cross. It's not pretty to read about suffering, but I believe each station is marked with hope. We know that the Way of Sorrows ends with the celebration of Easter morning and the empty tomb. And when we spend time with Jesus on this sorrowful road, we get a deeper understanding that he really doesn't want anyone left out! 

The other important thing to mention about this book is that it will be a "permafree" book. This means the digital/Kindle version will be free. The paperback version will be priced as low as Amazon will allow me to go based on printing costs (probably $5.99 or less). I want this book to introduce people to my writing and the Nobody Left Out series. If they enjoy it, they can opt-in to my email list or pick up the other books in the series.

 

What I Need & What You Get

Self-publishing provides me with an incredible opportunity to get my ideas out to other people. But there are costs associated with producing a professional-looking book. I am seeking to raise $2,000 to cover these costs. 100% of these funds will go towards the book. With these funds, I'll be able to get:

  • A professionally designed cover.
  • A professionally-designed interior for the paperback version.
  • Clean, easy-to-read formatting for the Kindle version that can be downloaded on an iPhone, iPad, or Kindle device.
  • An "interactive" PDF file of the book (meaning all links are active). Every now and then I come across someone on Facebook who wants my book but doesn't have the money to purchase it. I happily send them the PDF version for free.
  • .MOBI, and .EPUB files ready to upload to Amazon and other places.
  • Graphic images to use on social media.
  • Editing services. ​

 

If you contribute to this project, you will get my never-ending thanks. Okay, I can hear you...

"But come on, Michael, that's no fun!"

True, true!

If you contribute $25, I will send you a signed copy of the paperback as soon as it is released. If you contribute $35, I will send you a signed paperback of this book AND a copy of my first book, Nobody Left Out: Jesus Meets the Messes. (If you already have that book, then I'll put you on a list to get a free copy of my third book, which I'm hoping to write this summer.)

All contributors will also receive a special "Thank You" inside the book.

    The Impact

    My passion is to help people know they matter to Jesus. I believe this is something both non-Christians and Christians need to know. I want non-Christians to get a glimpse of who Jesus is firsthand—the things he did and the words he spoke. I want them to see his love for the messy, the broken, the weak, and the vulnerable. And for those of us who are Jesus followers, it can be easy to get discouraged and forget how loved we are. We need that same message of grace. We need it for ourselves and for the people God has called us to love. People who may look a lot different from us. People we might not even like! :) We need to be reminded that Jesus came so that nobody would get left out. 

    One day Jesus was eating dinner with a bunch of messy people. The religious elite got annoyed with Jesus and asked why he was dining with such "scum." Jesus responded by saying, "Healthy people don’t need a doctor—sick people do" (Matthew 9:12, NLT). This has become a guiding verse for my books. I'm a mess! I need Jesus. This is why I started the Nobody Left Out series, and I have ideas for lots of books!

    I've committed to always making my books affordable so they can get into as many hands as possible. If someone wants a book and can't pay for it, I give them a free copy. My long-term goal is to write these books full-time, but I'm not there yet. Your contribution will help me release this latest book in a cost-neutral way. It will also help me attract new readers so I can begin expanding my audience.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    I realize there are a million other worthy causes you can give your money to. If you're unable to contribute, I totally understand! I still hope you'll download the free digital version of the book once it's out. Here are a few other ways you can help:

    • Pray! I know, I know—I have to say that. But I mean it! Pray for wisdom as I make the final edits to the book. Pray that the book would be an encouragement for people experiencing suffering. This book is all about how Jesus walks down the road of suffering with us. Pray that people who need to hear that message would find this book.
    • Spread the word about this campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out.
    • When the book is released, tell people about it! The more free downloads I can get on Amazon, the more other people will find out about it.

     

    I appreciate all the encouragement I have received since launching my first book. Thank you so much!

story:
Help fund issue 5 of the first print magazine exploring global issues through a third culture kids, global nomad lens!

Aidez à financer le cinquième numéro du premier magazine papier explorant le monde à travers les yeux des Global Nomads!

The campaign will help raise funds for our next issue on performing arts, a tribute to the late Souleymane Koly, extraordinary thinker, author, playwright, choreographer and founder of l'Ensemble Koteba d'Abidjan. 

La campagne aidera à recueillir des fonds pour notre prochain numéro sur les arts de la scène, avec des pages spéciales d'archives exclusives en hommage à Souleymane Koly metteur en scene, auteur, chorégraphe, penseur extraordinaire et fondateur de l'Ensemble Kotéba d'Abidjan.
 


FIELDS MAG is a multilingual quarterly print magazine and multimedia platform about the world, its citizens, do-gooders, change-makers and the context they evolve in. We are a nomadic publication. FIELDS MAG is currently based in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso working remotely with over 50 contributors spread across the world.

FIELDS MAG est un magazine trimestriel et une plate-forme multimédia multilingue sur le monde, ses citoyens, ceux qui font bouger les lignes et le contexte dans lequel ils évoluent. Nous sommes une publication nomade. FIELDS MAG est actuellement basé à Ouagadougou, au Burkina Faso et nous travaillons avec plus de 50 collaborateurs à travers le monde.

Through storytelling, we want to place our readers, in the midst of pacific revolutions, reinvention of solidarity and flamboyant creativity. We want to ask itchy questions and provide solutions to bring our world back on its feet.

A travers nos histoires, nous voulons placer les lecteurs, au coeur des révolutions pacifiques, réinventer la solidarité et célébrer la créativité. Nous voulons poser des questions qui dérangent et essayer ensemble de trouver des solutions pour remettre notre monde sur pieds.

We are passionate about our content. We advocate for slow journalism, curated photography, well-documented articles, handpicked themes and a strong visual identity. FIELDS MAG is as smart as it is beautiful.

Nous sommes passionnés par notre contenu. Nous défendons un journalisme lent qui respecte la dignité de ceux qui nous confient leurs histoires. Nous avons une identité visuelle forte. FIELDS MAG est aussi intelligent que beau.

WHERE THE FUNDS RAISED FROM THIS CAMPAIGN WILL GO:

CONTENT PRODUCTION - 6000$ 

PRODUCTION DU CONTENU - 6000$ 

 It is important to us that each and every person who contributes to FIELDS MAG receives a fair compensation for doing so. 

Il est important pour nous que chaque personne qui contribue à FIELDS MAG reçoive une juste compensation.

PRINTING + SHIPPING - 5000$

IMPRESSION + FRAIS D'ENVOI - 5000$

FIELDS MAG is proving print is not dead but printing is anything but cheap. We want to deliver you a magazine with the best quality, as smart as it is beautiful remember?  

FIELDS MAG prouve que le papier n'est pas mort mais les impressions coûtent chères. Nous voulons produire pour vous un magazine de la meilleure qualité possible, aussi intelligent que beau vous souvenez-vous?

REWARD PRODUCTION + SHIPPING - 2000$

PRODUCTION DES CONTREPARTIES + FRAIS D'ENVOI - 2000$

We've put together some amazing rewards for your generous pledges. (The pledge rewards are in the column to the right. They are named after Ouagadougou's neighborhoods). This cost covers the fees attached to creating them with artisans and creatives based in Burkina Faso and getting them to you, all over the world.

Nous avons conçu des contreparties incroyables pour vos  généreuses contributions. (Les contreparties se trouvent dans la colonne de droite, et portent les noms des quartiers de Ouagadougou). Ce montant couvre les frais liés à leur création avec des artisans et des créatifs basés au Burkina Faso et leur livraison, partout dans le monde.

EVENT PRODUCTION - 6000$

PRODUCTION D'EVENEMENTS - 6000$

We want to meet you, you and you! We are planning a couple of really cool thought-provoking events throughout Africa, Europe and the Americas. Let's celebrate being different together! 

Nous voulons vous rencontrer, vous et vous! Nous prévoyons quelques événements à travers l'Afrique, l'Europe et les Amériques. Ensemble, célébrons notre singularité!

INDIEGOGO'S SLICE - 1000$

LA PORTION INDIEGOGO - 1000$

We've added in the 5% fee and payment processing fees (between 3% and 5%) that go to this great platform when we are successfully funded.

Nous avons ajouté 5% de frais et de frais de traitement des paiements (entre 3% et 5%) qui iront à Indiegogo si nous réussissons cette campagne. Avec vous,, nous savons que nous allons y arriver!

Other Ways You Can Help

D'autres façons de nous aider

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Certains d'entre vous ne peuvent tout simplement pas contribuer, mais cela ne signifie pas que vous ne pouvez pas aider:

Faites passer le mot et faites du bruit à propos de notre campagne.

story:
In 1995 while I was living in Israel and working as a journalist, I wrote a story about the Israel Guide Dog Centre for the Blind, which was then in its infancy.

I met Noach Braun (and his amazing wife Orna) who taught me about the amazing work he was doing to provide guide dogs for blind Israelis. He is truly one of a kind. When I visited the centre it was just a series of caravans on a tiny property. Today through the amazing work of Noach and his team, the centre is a truly phenomenal place and a testament to his work.

As a result of the article I wrote and how impressed I was by his work, I decided to become a ‘puppy walker’ – I would raise a puppy for 12 months and return it to the centre to be trained to work with a blind person.

Bridget was born on Jan 30 1997 and came to my home in March that year. She was an amazing puppy. At the end of the year when I returned her to the centre, she “flunked out” of the training programme (it happens!), and I was asked if I wanted to keep her. Of course!

She stayed with me until she passed away on August 30, 2010 from inoperable bone cancer in her pelvis. She was 13 and a half – and had lived on two continents (I moved to Los Angeles with her in 2005). She loved people, food, swimming in the ocean and was known and loved by many. She even appeared in a production of the musical “Annie.”

Even though Bridget flunked out I’ve always considered her a roving ambassador for the Israel Guide Dog Centre and she was loved and adored by so many. I contacted Noach when she passed away this week and he remembered her and me well.

I will be back in Israel in two weeks, where I will return to visit Noach at the centre and where I plan on making a donation in Bridget’s honour. It takes $500 to sponsor a puppy for its first year. As a puppy walker, all Bridget’s needs were met by the centre for that year. Her vet bills were paid, her food, bowls, leash etc. provided. When I was able to keep her, the centre spayed her at no cost to me.

I want to raise $500 in Bridget’s honour so that the centre can provide all the dog’s needs for another “puppy walker” family.

You can learn more about the centre and what the puppy sponsor money goes towards here: http://israelguidedog.org/sponsor-a-puppy/

Please donate whatever you can, even if it’s just a few dollars. Your contributions will truly change a person’s life.

Please spread the word to your friends and family by using the share tools listed.

I know that Bridget would appreciate this tribute in her name and that she left this earth knowing she was helping other dogs to fulfill their destiny through The Israel Guide Dog Centre for the Blind.

When Bridget was taken to the orthopedic surgeon where she was diagnosed with cancer, the vet said she had never seen (apart from the cancer) such a healthy, mobile Golden Retriever at such an advanced age. She credited the truly responsible breeding at the Guide Dog Centre for Bridget’s overall health and longevity. Bridget truly was a testament to Noach and the Centre’s commitment to raise the best service dogs possible for Israel’s blind population.

story:
Since I was a kid, I've been thinking up stories. That's nothing special. Like many others, I've never thought of turning storytelling into a career. That's nothing special either. But now I want to change that. I've got stories to tell, I've got people to entertain!


My first serious project is a funny story. To be precise, a comedy fantasy book. That is, a fantasy tale that doesn't take itself too seriously and has you (hopefully) laughing out loud more than once. Enter Struglend Tales. For reference, if you aren't familiar with the comedy fantasy genre, think Discworld. If you enjoy that universe, chances are you'll like Struglend Tales (though I'm by no means comparing myself to Sir Terry Pratchett).


It's the story of Edward, who becomes king of Struglend in a quite roundabout and unexpected way. Shortly thereafter, he manages to lose his kingdom to an evil knight (don't you just hate it when that happens?), and together with his trusty herald Fred, he goes on an epic journey to reclaim his kingdom, and hey, maybe there's some self-discovery sprinkled in here and there as well. You can read more about the book, including a sample chapter, at its website.


Now, why am I asking for money? Simple, why do we all need money? To live, right. And like all good writers, I don't have a lot of it. Look, I'll be frank. This book will happen, no matter what. But with just a bit more money, I can spend more energy on actually thinking up and writing the story instead of worrying about paying the bills. And with more money come more marketing opportunities, so I can get the word out to people like you - who have exceptional taste when it comes to books. Otherwise you wouldn't be here reading this, right?


Oh, what's that? What's in it for you? Well, first of all, even a gift of just one dollar will get you listed on the site, and for four dollars more, your name will be in the book! How cool is that! But the best thing is that warm, fuzzy feeling you get, knowing you helped someone realize their dream. No, my dream is not just publishing a book. My dream is that people will love the book, that while reading it and perhaps even after, they will feel happy.


So where will the money go to?


Basically, it'll go into making the book as professional as possible. Things like getting an ISBN number, setting up an indie publishing company, marketing, they all cost money. If you contribute, know that you will have helped launch an author's career - this is not a one-off, there will be more Struglend (and other) books. And if you really can't give any money, at least ask your (wealthy) friends to help! Thanks so much, you're awesome!

story:
Über das Warrior Magazin

Hier geht es um Kämpfer und Krieger, um Männer und Frauen, die Herz, Disziplin, Ausdauer und Willen haben. Kurz gesagt um die Menschen, die in der Welt der Kampfkunst leben, weil es ihr Weg, ihr Traum und ihre Bestimmung ist.

Das Warrior Magazin ist ein Magazin für – ihr werdet es erraten haben – Menschen mit dem Herzen eines Kriegers. Es war schon lange unser Wunsch so ein Magazin zu machen und dies aus vielerlei Gründen. In unserer Vorstellung steht bei einem solchen Magazin der Mensch im Mittelpunkt und genau deshalb findet ihr hier auch gleich das erste herausstechende Merkmal unseres Warrior-Magazins: Wir schreiben nicht nur ab, was man uns schickt, sondern wir versuchen immer so viele Artikel wie möglich durch Selbsttests „zu erleben“. Dann könnt ihr nämlich auch ganz sicher sein, dass wir genau wissen, wovon wir schreiben.

Die Idee hinter dem Magazin ist also: Wenn jemand ernsthaft trainiert, dann soll er auch die Möglichkeit haben seine Ideen und Erfahrungen mit anderen zu teilen. Dabei ist es völlig egal, ob er eine europäische oder eine asiatische Kampfart betreibt, ob sie klassisch, traditionell oder modern ist, ob er ein 10. Dan Meister eines angesehenen Systems, ein Türsteher, ein Soldat oder ein Vollkontaktkämpfer ist oder vielleicht auch jemand, der von seinen Erfahrungen auf der Straße im Krieg oder im Polizeieinsatz berichten möchte. Denn es geht hier nur um Kämpfer und Menschen, die das Herz eines Kämpfers besitzen. Der Punkt ist, jeder, der ernsthaft trainiert, besiegt sich jeden Tag selbst, besiegt sein Phlegma, seine Trägheit, seine Angst, und dafür verdient er Respekt! Dabei ist es völlig egal, ob er eine Ritterrüstung, einen frisch gebügelten Gi, eine Thaiboxshort oder eine Uniform trägt.

Für all jene gibt es dieses Magazin. Und jetzt kommt das Beste: Wir recherchieren all diese faszinierenden Geschichten über Stile, Schulen und Erfahrungen, besuchen diese mutigen Menschen und schreiben über sie, um unser Heft Nummer 1 letztendlich völlig kostenfrei an jeden abzugeben, der sich dafür interessiert. Ja, ihr lest richtig! Unser Wunsch ist es möglichst viele Leser an unserem Magazin teilhaben zu lassen, deswegen könnt ihr es gratis downloaden und damit die Welt der Krieger betreten. Damit das Ganze eine Zukunft hat: Empfehlt das Heft weiter, schickt eine Kopie an eure Freunde und redet ganz einfach darüber. Schreibt uns, welche Artikel euch am besten gefallen haben, worüber ihr mehr lesen wollt oder was ihr schon immer wissen wolltet und wir sehen was wir für euch tun können. Erlebt die ganze Welt der Krieger – genau hier und jetzt! 

Warum wir euch brauchen!

Natürlich stecken in so einem Heft jede Menge Arbeit und es sind auch einige Menschen inolviert. Für die Ausarbeitung der Idee und der Ausgabe Nummer eins haben wir bis jetzt etwa 14 Monate gebraucht. Die redaktion umfasst 4 Personen und 4 Freiwillige. Alle arbeiten bis dato auf eigene Kosten und  auf eigenes Risiko. Um all diesen Leuten wenigstens eine kleine Aufwandsentschädigung bezahlen zu können für all ihre großartige Arbeit brauchen wir euch! 

Falls ihr denkt - die haben doch Werbeieinnahmen, dann irrt ihr euch, denn bei einer Erstausgabe ist es leider fast unmöglich Werbepartner zu finden für uns. Das heißt, wir zählen auf euch!

Also ob 1 Euro oder 100 Euro, wir sagen schon mal Danke und werden euch ein ganz fantastisches Magazin dafür geben!

Unsere Geschenke!

Natürlich wollen wir euren Willen zu spenden auch honorieren. Deswegen haben wir uns einige wirklich ganz fantastische Prämien ausgedacht, mit denen wir euren Willen uns zu helfen honorieren möchten. Check out our Perks (Sonderzulagen)! Vergesst nicht - wir brauchen Eure Adressen für die Zusendung von Prämien.

story:
Story of My Book

The Future of Governance in Space is an examination of the past, present, and future of space law.

My name is Lauren Peterson and I am the author of The Future of Governance in Space. I’ve always looked up into the night sky with awe and wonder, ever curious about what exists in the depths of our universe. As a future attorney, I wrote this book to develop a better understanding of what and who actually governs our activities in space, how the governing is currently done, what great challenges need to be overcome, and where we’re going to go from here.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that space law involves all of us. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for space law as it relates to the exploration of outer space, the exploitation of extraterrestrial natural resources, and the invention of novel technology either in space or for use in space. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the greater forces at play surrounding humanity’s activities in outer space.

In this book, you'll learn about exciting examples of international collaboration and the parallels in the development of aviation and maritime law. You'll hear stories such as...
  • The mission that almost didn't happen, Apollo 8
  • What legal gymnastics it took to establish and still takes to maintain the International Space Station
  • How space mining and planetary protection are vital to our success in space
You will love this book if you have any interest in space, are passionate about cutting-edge international policy, or are interested in novel ideas of how our world might function in the future.

The Future of Governance in Space is a nonfiction book that speaks to space law buffs and casual space fans alike who want to understand public and private international space law in a new way.
 

 

The Book - The Future of Governance in Space

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-3. This part examines the history of space exploration and space law, a type of law that was brought into creation by the launching of Sputnik, the first orbiting satellite, into space in 1957. It examines the tense negotiations that took place during the Cold War that resulted in the five seminal space treaties. Once the groundwork has been laid, we move on to Part 2.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-9. This dives into the development and mechanics of modern day space law and policy, while highlighting current challenges to the existing framework, such as intellectual property rights and other nonsensical regulations that create arbitrary barriers to collaboration.

Part 3 contains chapters 10-13. This last part examines parallels in legal development in aviation and maritime law, our long-awaited return to the Moon and beyond through the Artemis Program, and discusses how space governance should be executed.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder).
  • The layout design (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts when I ultimately publish this coming Spring!

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts†, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author


Lauren Peterson is finishing up her JD at Northwestern Pritzker School of Law and will soon be studying to pass the California Bar Exam. She plans on joining the law firm of Goodwin Procter LLP at their San Francisco office this upcoming fall.

Prior to law school, Lauren worked at a technology startup in San Francisco, focusing on operations. She credits her scrappiness and intense work ethic to her time there.

As a longtime history enthusiast, Lauren found the development of culture and, eventually, international cooperation, fascinating. Since deciding to pursue a career in law, she turned that same enthusiasm to the study of the development of space law. This book, an altogether digestible account of space law, acts as her debut into the world of international space law. It also serves as the introduction to her ideology that space should be governed through the participation of all countries, since it inevitably involves all of us.

Lauren is an insatiable reader, fitness aficionado, and world traveler.

For more information, you can connect with Lauren Peterson at lauren_peterson@me.com and @lp_inspace on Instagram and Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically mailing the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people aren't able to participate in the presale, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network! Please use #spacelaw and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my campaign with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Lauren Peterson

story:
Message in a Bottle began almost two years ago. The story is already complete, and can be read here. Almost the second the story ended, I've been getting requests to see a print version of this book. The time for this book has finally arrived, and I'm pleased to announce the publication of Volume One.

The Details

With this project, we're setting out to get a deluxe hardcover print run of the science fiction story Message in a Bottle. Thanks to the prohibitive length of the source material (over five hundred thousand words!) this project will be Volume One Only. This includes the entire first story as I first imagined it, and nothing marked as "Part 2" in the original story.

The funds raised from this campaign will cover a few things:

  • Cover the cost of "proof" books to verify the quality of the print.
  • Original front and rear cover.
  • Actual print run, obviously.

The book will contain minor corrections to the text made since the original publication, as well as an original short story taking place before "Part 2" of the original story that will never be published anywhere else.

Those who want to support the author a little could spring for an autographed copy, or support at the higher "custom chapter" tier. Those who support the project at this level will receive a brand new addition to the Message universe, ~2000 words in length, expanding on any aspect of the story of their choosing.

Risks & Challenges

The largest risk in publishing a story like Message is its enormous length. "Part One" of Message in a Bottle is nearly 270,000 words, which approaches the limits of most self-publishing methods. This means that at this time I cannot guarantee a softcover edition, and so will not be listing it as a reward on this campaign. 

Because of the volume-oriented nature of book publishing, this project cannot proceed if it is not fully funded. We have thus selected the fixed funding goal, so that interested people can pledge with no risk that you won't get your book. If we don't meet our goal, all funds will be refunded.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's fine! Obviously I'm not printing this story for the money--it's all about getting something awesome out in print. I don't expect anyone who isn't interested in hardcover books to order. If you'd rather just read the story, great! You can do it for free right now. If you'd like to help but you aren't interested in the book, feel free to share this campaign with anyone you think might be interested. Like anything in publication, this project gets easier the larger the volume of books we're printing.

story:
Story of My Book

Innovation Central: Why university-centric makerspaces empower students to change the world.

My name is Emi Makino and I am the author of Innovation Central. I wrote this book because I wanted to share the extraordinary accomplishments of students in Japan and the US, who are using campus makerspaces to literally change the world. Students are proving they are more capable of innovating than most of us imagine.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how students are revolutionizing the world of research and development, thanks to new digital manufacturing technologies. I hope this book will instill in you, the passion and excitement I have for the young entrepreneurs who are driving social change, empowered by campus makerspaces and high-impact educational programming. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to show how you too can apply the theories and practices of entrepreneurship to make a difference in your own lives.

Innovation Central is a non-fiction book that speaks to educators and entrepreneurs who are looking at makerspaces and how to successfully deploy them as innovation and entrepreneurship hubs at universities, for the first time.

In this book, you will learn about student inventions like Mako’s breakfast machine, Masaki’s man-made larynx, and Joshua’s wind tunnel system. In fact, these students’ R&D efforts, may be more productive than a typical university lab. This is a hard pill to swallow for research faculty who assume students cannot be their equals.

You will gain access to some of the secrets behind the most successful makerspace in Japan: Hongo Tech Garage at the University of Tokyo. In just a few years, it has become a hyper-productive innovation hub that is easily outperforming commercial makerspaces. We will dive into the theory and practice of what the best entrepreneurship programs have in common and are amplified when combined with digital making technologies.

The Book - Innovation Central

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + 3 additional chapters. In this section, you will learn how we got to where we are today. It will explore why the so-called maker movement has not lived up to its promises. China invested millions into commercial makerspaces nationwide, with very little to show after several years of operation. What went wrong? Clearly, it’s not just about the space. You will get a glimpse of how universities and their students, may hold the answer.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-8. In this section, you will be introduced to students from Japan and the US who are deploying innovative products and services with astonishing speed. Campus makerspaces can become powerful R&D catalysts when embedded in an entrepreneurship ecosystem that values learning and experimentation. You will learn about the science behind entrepreneurship and innovation, which is essential for programs to be effective.

Part 3 contains Chapters 9-10. This section will give more details about designing and delivering successful innovation programs and makerspaces. One best practice: never break the cardinal rule of keeping outsiders and “grown-ups” off the premises. This section concludes with reflections about the implications of campus makerspaces and the coming paradigm shift that has the potential of revolutionizing how universities do research, and make a positive impact on society.

What I Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter
  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten, digitally cut, thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Emi Makino is an associate professor at Hiroshima University in Japan. She has been teaching management and entrepreneurship in Japan since she earned a PhD in 2013. She trained as a journalist at Columbia University Graduate School of Journalism. Her passion for entrepreneurship was ignited when she wrote for Japan’s largest business daily, Nikkei. She covered US startups and internet commerce out of the paper’s New York bureau, interviewing internet pioneers such as Jeff Bezos and Eric Schmidt. Shortly after delivering baby No. 3, she relocated from Tokyo to Los Angeles so that she could go back to school to study Peter Drucker’s body of work on management and entrepreneurship.

This book is a culmination of my personal journey in pursuit of my holy grail: understanding how can we develop the next generation of entrepreneurs who can change the world for the better. I am passionate about the intersections of technology, entrepreneurship and education.

I was born a procrastinator, putting off important work until the last possible moment. Deadlines are my saving grace, and hopefully, will see me through the challenge of getting this book published.

For more information you can connect with Emi at emimakinojp+us@gmail.com and Twitter @emimakinojp or LinkedIn.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #InnovationCentral and tag Emi Makino as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Emi Makino

story:
I'm raising money to help me create a collection of interactive short stories for queer women with mental illness as I navigate my own mental health crisis.

Recently I lost my job because I have been having such acute anxiety that leaving the house often causes me to panic. I'm pretty embarrassed about it. I'm working with a therapist and a psychiatrist, both of whom are tremendously helpful, but who I need to be able to pay. I'm living in a loving, caring home, where I am supported and held, but I need to pay my rent.

I recently applied for a Philadelphia based arts grant. I just need to make it through June, and should I get that funding, I will have enough money to be able to create art and get by while I am healing and well enough to work again. Hopefully I will be better before then, and able to work, but it is hard to see so far right now.

Part of my healing process is making shrines and writing short stories. I would love to share that work with you and I need your help to be able to do it.

More About My Project:

I am writing a collection of interactive short stories for people, specifically queer women, to read when they are experiencing high levels of anxiety.

I write science fiction stories about lesbians set inside the moon, and about homes that provide for it’s occupants, and tired women who dive into the ocean and become sea children, because these stories help me to imagine a world where there is safety and calm for people who often feel unsafe both in the external world and in our own minds.

I want to make a zine that contains those stories, and provides space for readers to create their own art or stories. The zine would also provide distractions and ideas for making it through acutely anxious times, based on my own experiences.

It is crucial that queer women do not disregard or disbelieve, their own true lived experiences of mental illness. It is a matter of life or death.

I hope that through storytelling, I can help facilitate a temporary relief in people who have learned that in order to be safe, respected and valued, they must be locked down at all times.

Mental illness makes basic self care and survival, especially as a queer person, deeply complicated and hard. The stigma and shame surrounding having atypical and sometimes drastic reactions to feeling overwhelmed has at times made me feel terrified of myself, suicidal, and paralyzed.

I want people to be able to find themselves reflected in each other, and ultimately to help chip away at oppressive, sexist, ableist cultural narratives that intensify the shame and horror of feeling crazy.

Anything helps.

I'm pretty embarrassed about it. I'm working with a therapist and a psychiatrist, both of whom are tremendously helpful, but who I need to be able to pay. I'm living in a loving, caring home, where I am supported and held, but I need to pay my rent. I recently applied for a Philadelphia based arts grant. I just need to make it through June, and should I get that funding, I will have enough money to be able to create art and get by while I am healing and well enough to work again. Hopefully I will be better before then, and able to work, but it is hard to see so far right now.Part of my healing process is making shrines and writing short stories. I would love to share that work with you and I need your help to be able to do it.More About My Project:I am writing a collection of interactive short stories for people, specifically queer women, to read when they are experiencing high levels of anxiety. I write science fiction stories about lesbians set inside the moon, and about homes that provide for it’s occupants, and tired women who dive into the ocean and become sea children, because these stories help me to imagine a world where there is safety and calm for people who often feel unsafe both in the external world and in our own minds. I want to make a zine that contains those stories, and provides space for readers to create their own art or stories. The zine would also provide distractions and ideas for making it through acutely anxious times, based on my own experiences.It is crucial that queer women do not disregard or disbelieve, their own true lived experiences of mental illness. It is a matter of life or death. I hope that through storytelling, I can help facilitate a temporary relief in people who have learned that in order to be safe, respected and valued, they must be locked down at all times. Mental illness makes basic self care and survival, especially as a queer person, deeply complicated and hard. The stigma and shame surrounding having atypical and sometimes drastic reactions to feeling overwhelmed has at times made me feel terrified of myself, suicidal, and paralyzed. I want people to be able to find themselves reflected in each other, and ultimately to help chip away at oppressive, sexist, ableist cultural narratives that intensify the shame and horror of feeling crazy.Anything helps.

story:
Short Summary

From Auckland-based author/illustrator V. L. Dreyer comes a new story, a story of survival, love and heartbreak set against the backdrop of a world gone wild.

Ten years after a killer virus devastated the world, a small handful of survivors must band together to rebuild what is left of human society.  But can they overcome the trauma of their past, and forgive the horrible things that humanity is capable of in the name of the greater good?

Synopsis

The virus came from deep in Africa.

 By the time they had a name for the disease it had wiped out half the continent. Within a year, it had decimated our world. Our species is on the verge of extinction. Only a few of us have survived; those of us lucky enough to be born with a natural immunity to the plague. We scavenge amongst the ruins of our old civilizations, picking out a living from the devastation.

Ten years ago, I watched my family die one by one. Now, I am alone. The year is 2024; it has been a decade since the virus reduced humanity to a scattering of survivors strewn out across the world.

The rules that governed our society are gone.

Without laws to protect the innocent, I have seen the worst of humanity throughout the years. Now, I have found a new family who are determined to show me the best. But a fresh mutation of the virus has started turning the harmless, pathetic infected into monstrous predatory creatures bent on our destruction; even the wildlife is turning against us.

We are forced to leave our home and flee for our lives. It is only through unity that we stand any chance of survival. Enemies wait around every turn. For the sake of our children and our children’s children, we must find some way to survive and flourish again. If we fail, then the human species will cease to exist.

My name is Sandy McDermott, and I am a survivor. This is my story.

 There is also a sample chapter available by clicking here.

What We Need & What You Get

The manuscript is already done, and it's just going through the final cut and polish before it's ready to hit the shelves.  This is where you come in, contributors!

What I need funds for:

  • Editing costs,
  • Print & Distribution costs,
  • The costs of the cover artist and the artists involved in the campaign bonuses.

I am self-publishing, so to date every cent has been coming out of my wages as I try to get this project out.  I'm almost there, but I need help with the final step! 

What you get in return for your generosity:

  • ALL contributors will get an e-book copy of the book before it's released to the public.
  • ALL contributors will get the privilege of being named in the back of the book (unless you don't want that, of course).
  • ALL contributors will be thanked publically on the author's website (again, unless you don't want that).
  • ...Plus the higher-end bonuses as detailed in the perks, over yonder!  -->

The Impact

The Survivors Book I: Summer is a very different take on the Ye Olde Faithful zombie horror genre.  This is not about destruction, it's about construction.  It's about rebuilding after the worst has happened, and about finding the hope to achieve the impossible.

This book has received amazing feedback from the lucky few that have been allowed to see it so far - and I don't just mean my mother!  This is your chance to be part of helping the world see the Next Big Thing.

If this book has one theme, it's that teamwork can make anything happen.  I need you to make this happen. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially support us, that is no reason to assume that you can't help.  Even if you can't contribute cash, please, please, please help to get the word out by other means.  Tell your friends, tell your family, tell your mum. Every little bit helps!

 Incentives

- eBook

On completion of the final draft, all contributors will receive a .pdf eBook of The Survivors Book I: Summer emailed to them.  If necessary, I can provide instructions on how to transfer this to your Kindle.

- Bookmarks

The Survivors Book I collectible bookmarks have been created just for this campaign.  At the present moment, they are planned to be 50mm wide and 200mm tall, and will feature a slice of Alais Legrand's magnificent cover art on both the front and the back.  They are matt laminated and can be autographed by the author on request.

- Paperbacks

Fairly self-explanatory.  At the moment, I plan to have them printed through lulu.com and shipped directly to me, where they will be signed and posted back out to contributors.  They will be printed in the pocketbook size.

- Hardbacks

These will be printed through lulu.com and shipped to the author as well, where they will not only be signed, but numbered and dated as well.  Only 20 will be created during the initial print run, so these are collectibles. 

- 8" x 10" Semi-Gloss Prints

If your chosen perk includes a print, you may choose from one of the following.  Please be advised that this list is NOT final.  I will be adding to this list often throughout the campaign, and I will update the list whenever I finish a piece or receive one back from its artist.

  • "The Survivors Book I Cover Art", Alais Legrand 
  • "Sandrine McDermott" Cheesecake Pinup, V. L. Dreyer (Coming Soon)
  • "Anahera Parata" Cheesecake Pinup, V. L. Dreyer 
  • "Michael Chan" Cheesecake Pinup, Farlow Studios/V. L. Dreyer (Work In Progress)

 

Shipping

If signed by the author, please add the following for shipping:

  • New Zealand - N/A - Shipping Included.

  • Australia - $6.50 AUD

  • United States/Canada - $12.00 USD/CAD

  • Europe - $11.00 EUR

 

If shipped from Zazzle:

  • New Zealand - $8.61 NZD

  • Australia - $6.54 AUD

  • United States/Canada - $6.99

  • Europe - $4.95 EUR

 

Please allow time for shipping.  New Zealand is a very small country and very far away from the rest of the world.

 

The Heroic Rules of Engagement

- The character may be based off yourself, an original character that is your intellectual property, or it can be a tribute to a friend or family member so long as they provide their written permission to do so.

- The character may NOT be based off a copyrighted character that you do not own the rights to, a person or persons who do not wish to have the character based off them, and it may not be used in a malicious way against any person.

- The writer (V. L. Dreyer) reserves the right to veto any names or traits that are deemed to be overtly insulting, rude or inappropriate to any group or person.  That's not to say your character can't be a rude, horrible pig, so long as it's within the bounds of realism.

- The writer (V. L. Dreyer) will retain the rights to use the character as she sees fit within the bounds of the Survivors universe.  This is limited not only to the books, but also to any future Survivors projects, merchandising, or events.

- If you are using an existing character from your own world/universe (e.g., a cross-over), then you retain rights to that character in your own world.  Events that take place within the Survivors universe will be considered non-canonical within your world, and vice versa.  If you wish to establish a canon crossover, this must be discussed before and a mutually satisfying agreement reached in advance.

 

Terms & Conditions

- The Survivors Book I: Summer contains adult situations including death, violence, sexual situations and bad language.  If you are offended by or not legally allowed to view any of the above, please consider yourself warned.  I take no responsibility for any of the above.  You have been warned.

- As this is a fundraiser, the printing and publishing process will not begin until after the campaign is over.  As such, please allow 4-6 weeks for delivery, maybe more if there are hitches along the way.  However, I will endeavour to keep you up to date all the way through.

Last but not least, THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING ME!
