story:
ADVENTURA

FRA - DXB - SIN - BNE - AKL - PPT - LAX - PYT - LIS - FRA

Gerade bin ich 25 Jahre alt geworden und habe dafür 87 Gratulationen auf Facebook erhalten. Unterstützt von vielen Freunden, ohne die dieses Vorhaben nie möglichgewesen wäre, habe ich ein Jahr unterwegs verbracht und die Dinge aufgeschrieben, die man normalerweise auf Instagram veröffentlichen würde. Dazu habe ich Texte verfasst, voller Vorfreude jeder Farbfotoentwicklung entgegengefiebert und mich gefragt, wo eigentlich zu Hause liegt? Dort, wo man die Hand voll guter Freundschaft mindestens einmal im Jahr zur kostenlosen Maniküre bringt? Oder dort, wo man diese deutschsprachige Projektbeschreibung eh nicht versteht? Wo liegen die Gründe, die eine kleinstadtgroße Zahnlücke dazu bringen, nicht genau dort an seinen Falten zu arbeiten, wo der Zufall der Geburt ihn hingeworfen hat?

Deswegen lieben wir Literatur. Präzise aufgereiht in einem schweren Holzregal erzählt sie von der Vielzahl des Repertoires. Von Gegensätzlichkeit und fehlenden Stereotypen. Von langen Nächten in kurzen Geschichten. Über Los Angeles und Neuseeland nach Australien und Mittelamerika. Durch Wälder ohne Wanderwege mit kaumG und kaum Guthaben, auf denen ich versucht habe meine Haare noch einmal so lange wachsen zu lassen,  bis ich doch nochmal aussehe, wie der Australier, der ich eigentlich nicht bin.

Deswegen  31 Geschichten und Bilder, für die mir die Worte fehlen. Fotografiert auf 35 mm Negativfilm und durch die Linsen zweier analoger Kameras, für die ich weniger zahlen musste, als für eine akzeptable Farbfotoentwicklung. Vielleicht ist das Gras deswegen nicht so grün, wie es aus industrieller Idealvorstellung eigentlich auszusehen hat? Vielleicht geht es darum, wie Dinge sind und nicht wie sie sein sollten? Weil man Erfahrungen letzten Endes jedem zuspricht, der sich für unbelesenes Erleben begeistern kann,

Technische Daten:

Auflage: 500 Exemplare
Format: 21 cm x 29,7  cm
Grammatur: Naturpapier 120 g/m²
Sprache: Deutsch                                                                                                                       Umschlag: 250 g/m² Soft Cover mit Klappen (Doppelumschlag)
Seiten: 256
Bindung: Fadenbindung (offener Rücken)
Verlag: Buchhaltung Verlag, Lichtstraße 43d, 50825 Köln                                                   In Kooperation mit: WACHS, BYND und JOSEK DESIGN

Wer sind wir? 

Theoretisch sind wir nur ich. Praktisch ist das jedoch völliger Blödsinn (Smiley). Wegen Luke und dem Layout. Thomas und der väterlichen Führsorge. Meiner Mama und den Wurzeln. Steffi, Sabine und Erik für die Kommas. Der wirklich wilden Wachs - Posse aus Neuseeland. Und (Komma?) um dem dankbaren Nagel auf den Kopf zu hauen: Danke denen, die diese Geschichten mit Inhalt gefüllt haben! All jenen, die mich ausgehalten und ermutigt haben, das Wort Weltenbummler in seine unerträglichen Einzelteile zu zerlegen und schlussendlich der Erfahrung, dass es im Leben um die Menschen geht und nicht nur ums Essen.

Was wir brauchen und was du bekommst:

Um drucken zu können und haptisch etwas in der Hand zu halten, beläuft sich das Minimum der Teilfinanzierung auf 2000 €. Wir müssen diesen Betrag erreichen, um endlich in Druck gehen zu können. Jeder weitere Cent wird für die Deckung der Druckkosten verwendet. Texte und Bilder sind bereits layoutet und warten nur noch darauf, gedruckt zu werden. 

Bestellt euer Exemplar zum reduzierten Pre-Order Preis hier und erhaltet neben einer persönlichen Signatur zusätzlich einen Kunstfotoabzug in Eleganz oder kölschen Partyspaß (09.12.2015 im SABOR ERMOSO, Köln) und Freibier. Jedes Buch ist somit ein Unikat aus Leidenschaft. Aufgrund des hochwertigen Designs sollte sich das Geschriebene auch optisch gut neben den wirklichen Literaturansammlungen machen, die euer Regal zu verbuchen hat.

Die Geschichten kommen druckfrisch auf postalischem Weg zu euch. Die nationalen, sowie internationalen Versandkosten und Verpackungsgebühren sind bereits im Preis enthalten. Auch wenn du uns finanziell nicht unterstützen kannst, hilft jedes Teilen und weitererzählen dieses Projekts bei Freunden oder auf Social Media Plattformen.

Ich glaube an dieses Buch und hoffe ihr tut das auch.

Konstantin & Freunde

KUNSTDRUCK AUSWAHL:

1.Indicators, Raglan Neuseeland

2. Shaping Bay MS Surfboards, Calundra Australien

3. Matakana Island, Neuseeland

4. Rock It Cafè, Raglan Neuseeland

Deswegen lieben wir Literatur. Präzise aufgereiht in einem
schweren Holzregal erzählt sie von der Vielzahl des Repertoires. Von
Gegensätzlichkeit und fehlenden Stereotypen. Von langen Nächten in kurzen
Geschichten. Über Los Angeles und Neuseeland nach Australien und Mittelamerika.
Durch Wälder ohne Wanderwege mit kaumG und kaum Guthaben, auf denen ich
versucht habe meine Haare noch einmal so lange wachsen zu lassen,  bis ich doch nochmal aussehe, wie der
Australier, der ich eigentlich nicht bin. 
Deswegen  31
Geschichten und Bilder, für die mir die Worte fehlen. Fotografiert auf 35 mm
Negativfilm und durch die Linsen zweier analoger Kameras, für die ich weniger
zahlen musste, als für eine akzeptable Farbfotoentwicklung. Vielleicht ist das
Gras deswegen nicht so grün, wie es aus industrieller Idealvorstellung eigentlich
auszusehen hat? Vielleicht geht es darum, wie Dinge sind und nicht wie sie sein sollten? Weil man Erfahrungen
letzten Endes jedem zuspricht, der sich für unbelesenes Erleben begeistern
kann, 
Technische
Daten:
Auflage: 500 Exemplare
Format: 21 cm x 29,7  cm 
Grammatur: Naturpapier 120 g/m²
Sprache: Deutsch                                                                                                                       Umschlag: 250 g/m² Soft Cover mit Klappen
(Doppelumschlag)
Seiten: 256 
Bindung: Fadenbindung (offener Rücken)Verlag: Buchhaltung Verlag, Lichtstraße 43d, 50825 Köln                                                   In
Kooperation mit: WACHS, BYND und JOSEK DESIGN



Wer sind
wir? 
Theoretisch
sind wir nur ich. Praktisch ist das jedoch völliger Blödsinn (Smiley). Wegen
Luke und dem Layout. Thomas und der väterlichen Führsorge. Meiner Mama und den
Wurzeln. Steffi, Sabine und Erik für die Kommas. Der wirklich wilden Wachs - Posse
aus Neuseeland. Und (Komma?) um dem dankbaren Nagel auf den Kopf zu hauen: Danke denen, die diese Geschichten mit Inhalt
gefüllt haben! All jenen, die mich ausgehalten und ermutigt haben, das Wort
Weltenbummler in seine unerträglichen Einzelteile zu zerlegen und
schlussendlich der Erfahrung, dass es im Leben um die Menschen geht und nicht
nur ums Essen.
Was wir
brauchen und was du bekommst:
Um drucken zu können und haptisch etwas in der
Hand zu halten, beläuft sich das Minimum der Teilfinanzierung auf 2000 €. Wir
müssen diesen Betrag erreichen, um endlich in Druck gehen zu können. Jeder
weitere Cent wird für die Deckung der Druckkosten verwendet. Texte und Bilder sind
bereits layoutet und warten nur noch darauf, gedruckt zu
werden. 

Bestellt euer Exemplar zum reduzierten Pre-Order Preis hier und erhaltet neben einer
persönlichen Signatur zusätzlich einen Kunstfotoabzug in Eleganz oder kölschen
Partyspaß (09.12.2015 im SABOR ERMOSO, Köln) und Freibier. Jedes Buch ist somit ein Unikat aus Leidenschaft. Aufgrund des hochwertigen Designs sollte sich das Geschriebene auch optisch gut neben den wirklichen
Literaturansammlungen machen, die euer Regal zu verbuchen hat. 
Die Geschichten kommen druckfrisch auf postalischem
Weg zu euch. Die nationalen, sowie internationalen Versandkosten und
Verpackungsgebühren sind bereits im Preis enthalten. Auch wenn du uns finanziell nicht unterstützen kannst,
hilft jedes Teilen und weitererzählen dieses Projekts bei Freunden oder auf
Social Media Plattformen. Ich glaube an dieses Buch und hoffe ihr tut das auch.Konstantin & FreundeADVENTURA PREVIEW:KUNSTDRUCK AUSWAHL:1.Indicators, Raglan Neuseeland2. Shaping Bay MS Surfboards, Calundra Australien3. Matakana Island, Neuseeland4. Rock It Cafè, Raglan Neuseeland

story:
Hi.

I'm Holli Bushnell, and, among many other things, I'm a writer.  I've spent my whole life dreaming of being a published author, and I'm asking for help to make that dream come true.  
Last Christmas no one gave me their heart (haha)...instead, after entering a sweepstakes, I was given the opportunity to visit the When Words Count writers retreat (http://whenwordscountretreat.com), ironically situated in my old home town of Rochester, VT.  It's the only time I've ever won anything in my life, and it changed everything.  
Although I entered the retreat with absolutely no expectations I came out of my four day stay with the opportunity to participate in Pitch Week (http://whenwordscountretreat.com/pitch-week/).  After another visit to When Words Count about a week ago I now know what it's going to take to move forward, emotionally, intellectually, and financially. 
When it comes to self-publishing most novels are a significant investment.  The beauty of the Pitch Week model is that while the costs are relatively low the benefits in support, editing, and marketing, are astronomical.  Should I win Pitch Week I will have a literary agent, a traditional, independent publisher, and a national marketing campaign.  Obviously, this opportunity is more than any first time author could hope for, and miles beyond what I could accomplish by self-publishing.  
Regrettably, my finances are extremely tight and there is a possibility that I won't be able to afford to move forward.  Through your support I will be able to take that next step.  My novel will be edited by some of the best in the business, my story scrutinized and crafted into the best possible shape, and I will develop a marketing plan to bring my book to the masses.  So, can you help?


What I Need & What You Get

To make my dream come true I need $4,000.  I know that sounds like a lot, but when you consider that a full line edit for a novel of 70,000 words can cost upwards of $5,000 you'll see what an amazing opportunity this is for me.  IMPORTANT: Should I not be selected as a finalist (or even if I am and I don't win) I will still find a way to at least get my novel out to everyone who supported me in this endeavor. 

I will happily accept any amount of money in support, but I do have some incentives for people who can give a little more. This is everything from $20 for a signed copy of my book to $500 to have a character named after you in a future novel (along with a bunch of other goodies). I'm also offering an ultimate "Choose Your Own Adventure" option where you let me know what goodies you want and I'll try to find a way to make it happen.  

If I am unable to reach my funding goals I will use what funds I do raise to move forward.  It may take me a little longer to distribute the perks, but I'll find a way to make it happen.  


The Impact

You might ask why the world needs another fantasy novel.  I can promise you that a story like mine, with an unconventional heroine, omnipresent nerdiness, and a body-positive, feminist message, is unlike anything you'll ever read.  It is the first book in a trilogy as well, so there will be more entertainment to come!  I'm not looking to change the world (yet).  I just want a chance to put my ideas out into the world and show people something different.  


Risks & Challenges

I am only at the beginning of my journey.  My next step forward is a massive one.  My work will be critiqued and evaluated by multiple people in the publishing industry.  Depending on their opinions (and my scores) I will move into heavy editing, developing a cover and marketing plan, and preparing myself to publicly present my novel.  It's a lot of hard work, but I'm not only ready for it, I'm eager to get started.  


Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that a financial commitment is not feasible for many people.  Here are some other options if you can't give but you still want to help:
Let me read to you.  I need LOTS of practice reading my elevator pitch and a 5 minute sample (apparently I have developed stage fright).  If you are far away but still want to give this a go we can always skype.  
Artwork!  Please contact me.  I'll tell you a bit more about my book, and, if you're still interested, make me something cool.  I'll be working on a website and I'd love to put your book-inspired art up!
TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Share this page with others so that people I may not know can also help make my dream come true.  
And if I've missed anything, if you think you have a unique skill that may help me in my endeavor, PLEASE LET ME KNOW!  I'm looking for all the help I can get, and I never know where I'm going to find the thing that gives me the edge I need.  

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!

story:
We Want to Tell You a Story….

It’s a story about a family starting a new life, a life full of possibilities, a life of security and togetherness. It’s a story about striving to make dreams come true, to make ends meet, to make a home. It’s a story about what happens when those illusions are torn away by things we are told don’t exist.

Harvesting Shadows is a novel based on the true events that plagued one family in Salt Lake City, Utah, a family victimized by unseen forces and malevolent entities. This book is a narrative dramatization of the story of these people, the Victorian house they lived in, and the ominous discoveries they made about the true nature of the phenomenon that assaulted them.

Originally documented in the Discovery Channel’s A Haunting: The Forgotten, Harvesting Shadows delves into the aspects of violent hauntings and discarnate intelligences that prime time reality television and pop-culture ghost hunters ignore or refuse to discuss. There are clues in this story, but the reader must decide upon the answers for themselves.

If you believe in the phenomena, are you sure it’s everything that you’ve been told it is? If you don’t believe, where do the explanations lie? The goal of Harvesting Shadows isn’t to sway you to either side, but to ask you to reconsider your position, explore the options, step outside the box, and take a nightmare journey into the unknown with an unsuspecting family.

Who Are We?

Douglas Burchill is the author of the novel Harvesting Shadows. His previous publications include various short stories, articles, and video game scripts. April and Matt are the mother and father of the family that occupied the Victorian house in the Aves during the events depicted in the story. Together, we’ve been working extremely hard for the last year to track down others who had experiences in the house and put this book together through interviews and research, all while maintaining our day-to-day lives and jobs. It hasn’t been easy, but it has definitely been worth it! Part of the goal of the project is closure for April and Matt, as the events they experienced were profoundly traumatic and their effects are felt to this day, nearly a decade later. In addition, this is Douglas’s first novel, but beyond that, this project has opened his eyes to the realization that reality may not be exactly as we’ve been lead to believe.

What Are We Doing?

Why are we here on Indiegogo? Well, we are in the final stages of the book project. The rough draft is complete an. The book jacket has been designed. However, we need funding to cover the cost of publication, printing, website, editing, illustrations, ISBN number,  shipping,  travel and other expenses accrued during research, and further promotion. Help us make this Book come to life!

There is a sneak peak sample this week only of Chapter 1 on our Facebook page,. We will be posting more next week . You will have to have the drop box app to view this .Anxious to get your copy ? Early release is only available for contributors to our Indiegogo campaign! The Gallery section will show one page a day, and also in the Extras you can follow the link to the drop box sample. Thank you!

New Perks at the $25 and $50 level! Get a book or a broadside at $25!

The Background

Alarming reports about the death of publishing are a dime a dozen lately – huge mergers continue to flatten and homogenize the industry, while million-dollar publishing empires wobble at the edge of collapse on the brink of the e-book revolution. We know. We publish poetry, of all things.

This campaign is our first step in becoming a not-for-profit publisher. We hope to incorporate as a 501(c)3 in the next 6 months, but for now we're testing the waters of community fundraising to see it can can benefit us and our authors.

 

Poetic Matrix Press

Poetic Matrix Press was founded as a periodic poetry newsletter in 1997 in Yosemite Valley, and since 2003 has published over 40 books of poetry, along with a few memoirs and special projects.

As a small press (a very small press) we don't have a lot of capital to throw around, but we do have the ability to try new things. That's why we started using digital printing in order to have a more flexible print run. Now we're trying to make this Fully Funded model work. If we can raise the money to produce a book up front, we can focus more on the quality of the manuscript and the community who will enjoy it, rather than whether or not to send it to a distributor or how we can sell it, or whether it's worth publishing from a sales standpoint. Because really, we want to publish some poetry.

 

The Books

Spangling Darkness, by Raphael Block

Raphael Block has lived on three continents, and now observes and responds to nature, including human nature, around his home in Northern California. In the words of J. Glenn Evans, his “poems ignite the imagination for a new vision that allows the earth to mend. This is the gift of Raphael Block as a poet whose spirit resonates in our common humanity and binds us together.” The book also features eight very fine drawings by British artist Clare Allen.

Spangling Darkness will include an album of all the poems recorded by the author, available for download from our website or mailed to you.

 

Malala, by Lyn Lifshin

Lyn Lifshin is a veteran of small-press poetry, known for her bare, direct style and quick poetic responses to events in the world. Poetic Matrix published her book Katrina in 2010, 5 years after the disastrous hurricane in Louisiana. Her new manuscript, Malala, was inspired by the story of Malala Yousafzai, who was shot by the Pakistani Taliban for her work promoting girl's education, and who has since recovered at a hospital in Britain.

A portion of the proceeds from Malala will be donated to a foundation supporting Malala's cause. We're currently researching which foundation to choose.

 

Landscape of Hummingbird and Woman, by Joseph Milosch

Joe Milosch received an MFA in 1995, and also spent a career as a road contractor and inspector. Poetic Matrix published his book The Lost Pilgrimage Poems in 2005. His manuscript Landscape of Hummingbird and Woman reflects on the building of a life through work and human intimacy, using the flowing language of a trained and skilled poet.

 

The Campaign

We're raising $12,000 to publish these books, which will cover all of the costs of design and editing, an initial print run of 200 books, and advertising and prize submission. Work on the books will begin when the funding goal is reached, and the books will be complete and ready to ship 2-3 months after the campaign is complete.

We've also teamed up with Arizona-based artist Patrick Fisher to produce a limited-run hand-printed broadside for each of the books. We've worked with Patrick before – he designed the cover image for Joel Netsky's 2007 book The Uniquivocality of a Rose, and he also designed the promotional images for this campaign. We love Patrick's work – we're excited to see what he designs.

We're referring to this as our Summer 2013 Season of Poetry. We're planning on doing 2 or 3 Seasonal campaigns per year, in order to continue publishing new and thoughtful works.

 

The Result

As we mentioned, the books will be ready a few months after the end of the campaign – so we can expect to see them on our website and in your hands by October or November. The broadsides will be done much sooner than that, but the exact timeframe won't be set for another few weeks. Everything will be available on our (forthcoming) website store, and the books will be listed with our distributor, Small Press Distribution.

And what if we don't make our goal? Well, we're pretty sure we can, but even if we fall short we still want to publish – we'll be working with our authors to put together other fundraising possibilities  until everything is financed and the books go forward. We love publishing poetry.

 

What Can You Do?

First, donate! We have great thank-you gifts, and the chance to support really exciting contemporary poetry. Secondly, like us on Facebook, and let your friends on there and elsewhere know about the campaign. We're trying to build a broad community of poetry lovers. Third, check back in – we'll be uploading audio of the poets reading their work, as well as updates on the designs of the broadsides, and selections from the three books. Finally, check out our recently-redesigned website. We've got a blog for new poetry – feel free to submit – as well as one focused on discussion of the poetic experience and the role of poets in the social, political, and cultural arena. Come join in.

 

And thanks.

 

 

Old and Delved

from Raphael Block's Spangling Darkness

Dappling, flaking, silvery brown,
cracked, pecked, holy, cleft trunk,
limbs hanging by a thread.

Thicket of an old, unpruned apple tree,
rich, leafy mold stewing
in your mossy base—
home to thousands.

One hundred years
of hollowing
to bear everything—
sweet fruit.

One hundred years
of hollowing
to bear everything—
sweet fruit!

 

 

In Her Dream

from Lyn Lifshin's Malala

the blue black
mountains explode with
date palms and ephedra.
There are freeze frames
before the killer when
she floated among water
hyacinths. Red fox and
wild boar skittered thru
tamarisk and reeds,
camels, deer, gazelles
slithered thru those wet
lands with pelicans and
gull and
no one, nothing to make
her feel no one was
supposed to hear what
she was singing

 

 

Great Grandfather and the Compost Pile

from Joe Milosch's Landscape of Hummingbird and Woman

Light clouds appeared along the upper edge
of that photo of winter wheat and snow.
Shadows hid below shadows as he worked
the compost with a pitchfork.

Standing out of range of the lens, I became
mesmerized by his unhurried strokes.
Lifting his fork, he turned it so that
the mulch fell like feed from a scoop.

Frozen in mid flap, his shirt-tail exposed his rump
where crickets, moths, and ants were attached
by a web. After taking the picture, grandma laughed
and promised to show it during the holidays.

In those days he sat at the head of the table and chewed
the end of his cigar. I sat on his lap as he mumbled
what could have been lyrics to a peasant song, and
unintelligible as they were, I knew them as the words

a man passes to his offspring. He wanted me to know
how to hand-milk cows, or how to mend harnesses,
or shoe a horse. This was his gift, as unknowable
as the pastures and barns of his homeland.

Above the pile his pitchfork swept through egg shells
and corn husks. As I watched him, we shared our breath
with the incoming blizzard.

As we mentioned, the books will be ready a few months after the end of the campaign – so we can expect to see them on our website and in your hands by October or November. The broadsides will be done much sooner than that, but the exact timeframe won't be set for another few weeks. Everything will be available on our (forthcoming) website store, and the books will be listed with our distributor, Small Press Distribution.
And what if we don't make our goal? Well, we're pretty sure we can, but even if we fall short we still want to publish – we'll be working with our authors to put together other fundraising possibilities  until everything is financed and the books go forward. We love publishing poetry.
 
What Can You Do?
First, donate! We have great thank-you gifts, and the chance to support really exciting contemporary poetry. Secondly, like us on Facebook, and let your friends on there and elsewhere know about the campaign. We're trying to build a broad community of poetry lovers. Third, check back in – we'll be uploading audio of the poets reading their work, as well as updates on the designs of the broadsides, and selections from the three books. Finally, check out our recently-redesigned website. We've got a blog for new poetry – feel free to submit – as well as one focused on discussion of the poetic experience and the role of poets in the social, political, and cultural arena. Come join in.
 
And thanks.
 

 
Old and Delved
from Raphael Block's Spangling Darkness
Dappling, flaking, silvery brown, cracked, pecked, holy, cleft trunk,limbs hanging by a thread. Thicket of an old, unpruned apple tree,rich, leafy mold stewing in your mossy base—home to thousands.One hundred years of hollowingto bear everything—sweet fruit.One hundred yearsof hollowing to bear everything—sweet fruit!
 
 
In Her Dream
from Lyn Lifshin's Malala
the blue black mountains explode with date palms and ephedra. There are freeze framesbefore the killer when she floated among water hyacinths. Red fox and wild boar skittered thru tamarisk and reeds, camels, deer, gazelles slithered thru those wet lands with pelicans and gull andno one, nothing to makeher feel no one was supposed to hear what she was singing
 
 
Great Grandfather and the Compost Pile
from Joe Milosch's Landscape of Hummingbird and Woman
Light clouds appeared along the upper edgeof that photo of winter wheat and snow.Shadows hid below shadows as he workedthe compost with a pitchfork.Standing out of range of the lens, I becamemesmerized by his unhurried strokes.Lifting his fork, he turned it so thatthe mulch fell like feed from a scoop.Frozen in mid flap, his shirt-tail exposed his rumpwhere crickets, moths, and ants were attachedby a web. After taking the picture, grandma laughedand promised to show it during the holidays.In those days he sat at the head of the table and chewedthe end of his cigar. I sat on his lap as he mumbledwhat could have been lyrics to a peasant song, andunintelligible as they were, I knew them as the wordsa man passes to his offspring. He wanted me to knowhow to hand-milk cows, or how to mend harnesses,or shoe a horse. This was his gift, as unknowableas the pastures and barns of his homeland.Above the pile his pitchfork swept through egg shellsand corn husks. As I watched him, we shared our breathwith the incoming blizzard.

story:
Short Summary

After publishing the four book Sci Fi series Socialite 1 last year I began writing two books simultaneously, a mystery called Good Gladys and a science fiction novel called Followers. When people ask me what I am writing and I tell them, they usually say either "I would love to read the mystery" or "tell me when the scifi is done." 

People know what they like! So I am giving readers a chance to decide which book I complete and publish first.

Choose between:

Good Gladys: 

A traditional mystery with murder, sexual tension, two main suspects, and a reluctant private investigator. The world famous mystic Good Gladys is missing after her business manager is murdered, and the police have their suspect in custody. Gladys's daughter asks an old boyfriend, the PI Byrne Aase (aka Sauce) to find the real murderer: she claims the man on trial for the murder is her mother having been transformed into a man during a seance that went awry.

Followers:

Science fiction with continuous action, vivid characters and an alien threat to the planet. Alien technology crash lands on Earth and races through a suburban neighbourhood. All humans and animals who cross its path are turned into zombies, intent on following the craft. A teenage girl, in an act of desperation to save her now zombie mother, manages to stop the craft, but in the process becomes the new target of the "Followers." 

How the winner will be chosen?

When you contribute, tell me which book you prefer. The book that received the most money by the end of the campaign will be the first to be completed. It's that simple. If more money is raised from people who prefer scifi, then Followers will be the first to be completed and published. If people contribute more money for "mystery" then Good Gladys will be first.

The funds will help with the writing, editing, publishing and marketing. If enough funds are contributed to support the production of both novels, the first one will still be the book that raised the most money.

The Impact

When I was looking for agents to represent the Socialite series I was shocked at how many rejected it because it wasn't another teen vampire series. "How many of these do we need?" I wondered. "And do people really want more of them?" 

This campaign lets you decide what you DO want more of: Mystery or Science Fiction. 

Every dollar amount that is contributed to one book or the other will be included in the tally for each genre. To contribute, you can choose the perks that I have listed on the right of this page and get the finished project as soon as it is ready. Indiegogo also allows you to contribute any dollar amount that you want on the payment page, so even if you only want to give $1 or $5 you can!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but they can still help the campaign:

Tell your friends about the campaign. Most of us know someone who is really into mystery novels, or science fiction. Let them know that they can decide which one gets developed first.

Use the share tools provided at Indiegogo, or post the link to this campaign on Twitter and Facebook.

 

Thanks to everyone who helps

I am grateful for all of the help in getting one or both of these projects completed.

story:
Dandy Day

A free-spirited roller-skating Venice Boardwalk waitress, Dandy Day, can’t understand why she’s unlucky in love. After her therapist dumps her, right when they were on the verge of figuring it all out, Dandy decides to track down her exes, along with her reluctant best buddy, Simon, to get to the bottom of her “relationship challenged” life.

Dandy Day is about love, friendship courage and growing up (sort of).

Sometimes you already know,

it’s just that you don’t know that you know.

Until you do.  

 

Your Help

Your help will allow me to hire all the peeps I need to hire in order to make the novel all pretty and pro and get it out there for you all to enjoy!

 

Giving Back

A portion of all raised funds will go to the organization Reach Out and Read!  I have great memories of my dad reading to me from the moment I was born. I was an early reader and I feel that these things go hand in hand and contribute to my love of words and stories today. This is why I support "Reach Out and Read" an organization that promotes early literacy. 

More Ways To Help

Tweet, baby, tweet!

story:
Invest In Colombia

Colombia, a country we know for its sunny coastal cities, rolling coffee fields and hospitality, but - let's be honest - many associate it with its troubled past.

You and I know that Colombia is being recognized for more – something completely different. Colombia is not only one of the most beautiful countries on earth, it is also a country with massive untapped potential that demands development. To develop and meet its potential Colombia needs foreign investment.

We want to build confidence in Colombia

Experts have already begun calling Colombia “Latin America’s Hidden Gem,” “One of the main Latin American Hotspots,” and the “Comeback Country.”

However, for the majority of investors Colombia is still unknown territory with a bad reputation, not only in regards to its violent past, but ongoing corruption and tough crime rates, all things that make investors nervous.

For Colombia to move forward, and for investors to gain the necessary confidence and take the final step to invest, it is important there exist accurate information investors can look to in order to increase their chances for a high return.

This is why we are proud to announce that Colombia Reports, South America’s largest English-language news publication, will be releasing its first book, “Invest in Colombia,” to cover these growing investment opportunities and risks.

This e-book will be retailing in September 2014 for $59.99, however today it can be pre-purchased for $14. 

With your support, Invest in Colombia will explain how to mitigate risks and challenges that cripple other foreign investors in Colombia.

Invest in Colombia will be a book about the next generation of Colombia, an invitation to explore investment opportunities, a how-to to overcome real challenges that investors face every day. Invest in Colombia will be your ticket into this flourishing market. 

This in-depth book will cover topics including real estate, franchises, technology startups, mining, fashion, textiles and more in a detailed and concise way that will make you keep Invest in Colombia in hand at all times. Example chapters include:

- Expert analysis into the real estate markets of Bogota, Medellin, Cartagena, and an overview of metropolitan markets

- Examination into the Colombian peso currency exchange rate, its advantages and risks

- Interviews with thought leaders on what to watch out for in investments into Colombian real estate, franchises, textiles, and more

- Examination into Colombia's legal system and its implications for investment opportunities 

- & much more

Our team of international and local journalists will be spending hundreds of hours interviewing leaders in Colombia and abroad, to provide you with the most objective, accurate, and useful information possible. 

If you want to know exactly how to navigate one of the most promising emerging markets in the world today, you will want Colombia Reports’ book, Invest in Colombia.

In 2011, JP Morgan said Colombia “is and will be” the second most promising country for investment in Latin America. Three years later, and Colombia has nothing but growth in its crosshairs. With an estimated GDP growth of 4% in 2014 and a two-year-old United States Free Trade Agreement resulting in a 10% increase in US imports, the “Comeback Country” is ripe for foreign investment.

Even if you had forgotten about Colombia up until this point, to be sure, now is the time to take a closer look at the possibility of real returns from South America’s most promising country. 

But you already know that your next move should be Colombia. What don’t you know? 

Here’s the hard reality: There are a number of risks facing investors in Colombia that could seriously jeopardize any business endeavor. Fraud, cultural differences, a complex legal system, security concerns – these are all issues that stand between an investor and positive returns. 

Getting hit by any one of these challenges can often mean the difference between soaring in the black, and drowning in the red. 

Precious time, money, resources, manpower, and energy are at stake, and it’s nearly impossible to enter into this primed economy if you don’t have someone showing you these risks. 

But here’s the best reality

Colombia Reports wants to help you capitalize on one of the six most promising emerging “tiger markets” in the world today. 

With your support, Colombia Reports’ book Invest in Colombia will explain how to mitigate the risks and challenges that cripple other foreign investors in Colombia, keeping you and your venture in the black. 

Since 2008, Colombia Reports has been helping English speakers across the globe understand Colombia in a direct, thorough and unbiased way. Colombia is one of the most interesting, dynamic, and important countries in the world today. We want to share that with you. 

In order to create this book to the best of our ability we are asking for the support of our dedicated readers and those interested in Colombia for this funding campaign. These funds will support travel, the editorial for the book, and photography that will prove invaluable to our readers. 

For too long, Colombia has been defined by violence and one-dimensional stereotypes. With Invest in Colombia, you can help influence and shape what is already becoming the new reality of Colombia today.

**Legal Disclosure: This book is only for the purpose of giving general information and is not intended to offer personal financial advice. Nothing in this book shall be construed as offering or disseminating specific financial, retirement, estate, asset protection, tax, or legal advice. Nothing in this entire website or book shall be construed as an offer to sell, or a solicitation to buy regulated securities.

story:
Hi! Hola! Salut! Aloha! Ciao!

Vox Populi is a Latin term meaning ‘voice of the people’. We chose this as our name, because that is our vision: to get the voice of the people heard.

My name is Krys Walker, and I'm a stay at home mom. My real passion is political science and economics. I've previously worked for presidential campaigns, given educational presentations, and helped to organize week long workshops for young people. I've also held leadership roles in more than one political party. This experience has helped me realize that I am not a party person. We are all Americans, and we all deserve to be happy; not just the "winners".

I decided that I wanted to do something that would be a service, and allow myself to follow my passions, without playing into the two party political game. One day my husband came home with an idea. We are hoping to grow that idea into a national network, with boots on the ground in every precinct, to help Americans have their voices heard. 

Here's what it is!

VOX POP, ASC.

Today’s polling practices seem unfair. Big dollar companies and 

politicians pay for the results they are looking for. What we saw that we 

didn’t like:

-  Relatively small cross sections within a limited geographic space 

which are meant to represent the opinions of such a diverse 

nation.

-  Results that contradict the desired result are tossed out.

-  Put on the spot, participants answer a question they have no 

knowledge or opinion; or give the answer they think is socially 

acceptable, even if it is not their actual opinion (this is called 

social acceptability bias), or even the answer they think the 

pollster is looking for (approval bias).

-  Pollsters word a question in such a way to receive the desired 

response.

Our goal is to provide non-biased, non-partisan polling. Our agenda is 

not in the answers we want to see. In fact, we don’t care what the 

answers are. Our goal is simply to get the true vox populi heard.

Additionally, unlike many polls and surveys, we are not interested in 

demographics. Our view on demographic information is that it serves 

only those interested in pandering. We are all Americans! 

We plan to: 

1. Register and verify users by voting precinct. We will need to start one 

precinct at a time and grow our service so that we get a large cross 

section of each precinct. We hope to ultimately serve all 50 states.

2. Educate participants about factors we want to discourage such as

approval bias and social desirability bias. 

3.Then we will send out 5 question short polls each month by mail, 

email, and telephone based on participant preference. We will gather 

the results and send them to corresponding local, state, and federal law

makers for their consideration, as well as to media outlets.

We hope that by helping people have their voices heard, they will 

become more engaged in our political process.

We feel the best way to run such a program is as a non-profit 

organization. But we need your help! The I.R.S. currently charges a fee 

of $400 just to file for 501(C) 3 status. 

We will also need to collect donations for operation, but getting that tax exempt status is our first objective. ** Any donations we collect right now are not tax deductible.** 

Later on we will be building a website, a phone app, and printing forms for those who prefer to respond via snail mail. We have a logo in the works (someone is making one as a donation :) ). We also need boots on the ground to find, register, and verify participants. We will need to have headquarters to serve our volunteers.

If we raise more than we need we can move on to other objectives more quickly. If we don't raise enough it will be used to open a bank account, and we will just keep on with the fundraising and saving our own money until we have what we need for filing.

 In addition to donations, we need a lot of volunteers. If you don't have resources or time to donate, even just folks willing to share our story with their friends and family would be a real help.

Thanks for taking the time to read our story! Liberty and Peace!

Vox Pop Associates

story:
UPDATE!!

It is with great joy that I report our goal successfully met! To everyone out there that helped me reach this goal, thank you so very very much!

Now, as promised, I have recorded a video of the first chapter of the Twelve Cataclysms for your pleasure. Sadly, it appears I can only upload one video to this site, so below, there is a link. Take 20 minutes and listen in on what happens next.

If we are able to reach and extra $1000 in the next day, I will do yet another video, of the second chapter!

Enjoy.

https://vimeo.com/94746232


The 12 Cataclysms

When the cat burglar, Vie, sneaks into the Apocryptein she gets far more than she bargained for when the 12 Cataclysms are released.

The first in a series of Fantasy novels, 12 Cataclysms is the debut novel of Rob Queen and will be published via Amazon’s CreateSpace in June 2014.

Who is Rob Queen, anyway?

He is a male human currently residing in Boston, MA. There is a video above that shows what he looks like and how goofy he sounds on video.

Oh, that is not enough? Ok. He spent altogether too much time in his youth reading comic books, watching cartoons, and riding horses. The best thing to come from all that was a love of communication in all its forms, and more specifically, a passion for all manner of story-telling. If you like to have vivid images within the excitement of story-telling, his stories are a good choice for you. Graduating from Skidmore College with a BA in Creative Writing, he has long wanted to write a novel or thirty. While not his first written, this will be the first one published.

The Goal

The reason Rob is posting this project is to seek out aid in completing certain aspects of this publishing process that he cannot do by himself. Just about everything book related has or will be done already – three drafts have been completed and are currently being tested by Beta Readers, then the manuscript will be edited, the type will be finalized, the layout will be done with help from his meticulous eye, an eye-catching cover will be commissioned, and then the book will be done.

So why does Mr. Queen need money? Who doesn’t? Ha!

I jest. Your contribution will be used in one of five ways.

·  To finance the aforementioned commissioned cover art and design

·  Fees from Amazon, obtaining the ISBN number, registration and copyrighting fees.

·  For hard copies of the book that he will then use to distribute either to local bookstores or at conventions and other events where he will sell the 12 Cataclysms.

·  To get your perks to you.

·  The lion’s share will then be queued for marketing. While I have learned about grassroots word-of-mouth from a certain Vermont-hailing band that I have been following for the past too long, I would like to get in as many avenues of marketing out there. In other words, while I would love you to pass around the 12 Cataclysms to all your friends, neighbors, family, pets, and familiars, I would like to make this viral. To do that, I cannot put all my eggs in one advertising/ marketing basket.

Grassroots

How are we usually convinced to try something new? By a flashy advertisement? By some ogre beating you over the head with it? Or by having a really good friend grab you by the shoulders and scream in your face that “OMG!!! You have to try this!” While my friends and family are far more subtle than the latter, that is basically how I choose to try new things. Sure, you get the occasional situation where you just want to try something new, but you have to be in the right place at the right time for that, and let us be honest, who has such patience?

That is why I am appealing to you to contribute in as important a manner as that of financial donation. Tell your friends and family about this project. Tell them that you have been sucked in by the opening line (repeated in the video and in the lines below) and you desperately need to hear what happens next. Go to your dog and bark at her to tell all her chums. Give a carrot to your horse and have them stay awake all night neighing this message across the show grounds. Call your mothers, father, uncles, and aunts and tell them that you want this to succeed.

However you want to help, I am thanking you from the bottom of my heart.

A Reward

The Apocryptein had a visitor.

That is the opening line of The 12 Cataclysms. I hope it is enough of a tease to get people interested in hearing more. As mentioned in the above video, if we are able to reach my goal, I will post a video recording of the entirety of Chapter One in this webpage.

Heck, let us enter a world of total fantasy and take it one step further. For each time we hit a multiple of the goal, $2000, $3000, etc., I will post another video reading of another chapter. Consider this a sneaky-peeky way to thank you contributors for all your aid.

Who knows, if we get enough contribution, we may even get the whole book uploaded onto a video reading. Once this project’s time runs out, any video reading posted here will be accessible via my website, robqueen.com .

Take 20 minutes and listen in on what happens next. If we are able to reach and extra $1000 in the next day, I will do yet another video, of the second chapter!Enjoy.https://vimeo.com/94746232The 12

the debut novel of Rob Queen and will be published via Amazon’s CreateSpace in
June 2014.
Who is Rob
Queen, anyway?
He is a male human currently residing in Boston, MA. There
is a video above that shows what he looks like and how goofy he sounds on video.

Oh, that is not enough? Ok. He spent altogether too much
time in his youth reading comic books, watching cartoons, and riding horses.

forms, and more specifically, a passion for all manner of story-telling. If you

story:
One... Two... Three! Four Kicks: a new type of magazine! This fresh and innovative addition to the magazine industry is an idea that we've been working on for more than 3 years, and we are finally ready to go for it. Everything is in place and all our systems are ready to start running, we just need a little help from our friends.
 
My name is Ronald Doyle, and this is my idea:

Four Kicks: a magazine

Four Kicks will be a casual, informative and well-written magazine. We will not compete directly with any other magazines as our approach is completely different.

A strong personal network will be established between our readers and us. We are getting rid of publishers and distributors, so the only ones involved will be THE READERS and THE FOUR KICKS TEAM. 

We will deliver the magazine directly to you and it will be available at the places you already visit.. for FREE. Your favourite bars, coffee shops, clothing shops and restaurants will be where you can get your hands on a copy.

The personal network created between our readers and us will be the essence of this magazine.

Content

For now our content will focus on music, travelling, photography and our community.

Music

The South African Music Industry has been void of the recognition it deserves. The live music scene is alive and well, and our aim is to document these events.

We will focus on South African music that has not been featured, music that was never heard of but is some of the best music out there.

We will also use the magazine as a platform for unknown artists and musicians to showcase their talents. On our website we will have a feature called 'Unknown Artists' where anyone can upload their music. The best will be chosen and compiled onto a 6-10 track CD, which will be included with the monthly edition of the magazine. 

We will also feature pieces on the most creative local bands on the scene right now.

Music is what it is about... 

Travelling

Our travelling features will be detailed pieces, covering all the aspects of these adventures. We will inform you on where to go, what to do, what to pack and which road to take. We want to motivate our readers to get out there and explore this beautiful country to its fullest!

Cities - Every issue will feature a piece on one of the 8 major cities in South Africa. We will focus on the current vibe and feel of that specific city. 

Towns - Every issue will also feature a small town that you just simply have to check out. Detailed info about this town will be available.

Road Trips - We will take you from point A to B. A detailed road trip plan will be provided, including the amount of kilometers you will cover, the gas you'll use, where to stop and what to look out for. A detailed road trip plan will be available in every issue.

Break-Away - If you want to get away for the weekend, or spend 2 weeks where no one can reach you, we will give you the best break-away destinations in South Africa.  

Photography

A picture tells a thousand words.

We will have world class photographers filling our pages with spreads of pictures, giving them a chance to tell a story with their photos.

We will also feature photo essays and  have a data base where SA photographers can upload photos onto. We want to give them an opportunity to get their photos out there, who knows who will see them.... 

Community

If we have the privilege to run our own magazine, we really do want to give something back to the community. That's why we have the "Unknown Artists" feature at our music section.

We will also give struggling SA photographers and journalists a chance to get into the industry.

Also, we will be printing our magazine on recycled paper. This will lower our printing costs, give an unique look and feel to the magazine, and maybe help save a few trees!!

Our biggest project will be helping an under-privileged scholar, giving him or her the opportunity to obtain a degree. We will co-operate with a top South African University and every year grant a under-privileged Grade 12 learner a full bursary at this top South African University.

 

Money

Our goal is $ 25 000!! This money will be spent on the following expences:

Printing

70% of this $ 25 000 will be spent on printing. We know online magazines are pretty big right now, but the feel of the magazine in our hands is priceless. We want our readers to take the mag with them wherever they go. This will also create a stronger personal connection with our readers, and that is what it is all about.

Distribution

We will be distributing our magazine ourselves, staying connected with the network we will create. We want to be part of every single step in the process.

Website

Websites are where it is at these days. We want to spend a few bucks on this to make sure we get the coolest possible website ready for everyone to use. We will also ensure that it is the most user friendly website out there.

Launch Tour

We want to kick off our campaign in the best possible way, so... a jam packed launch tour will take place. 8 Cities, 8 shows, 3 bands per show and the only place where you can get your hands on the first issue. A successful launch tour will go a long way to help us establish a connection with our readers. 

Fresh Approaches

Like you already know, we want to do a few things differently! We will distribute our magazine ourselves, it will be available at the places our customers already go to, and it will be absolutely free..

FREE?

Yes, this magazine is completely free, and it will always be available for free. Research has shown that companies advertize 30% more in a free product. 

It's important to realize that it is a different approach than handing out flyers at a traffic light. The type of free we are talking about still carry a lot of value and to get our hands on one of these free copies, will create an exclusive feeling!! 

Be sure to go through all the perks, I know there's one just for you...

 

It was a lot of fun making this video, and please watch it again, but know this: We have never been more serious and ready for anything in our lives. This is what we are here to do, please give us the opportunity to go for it

 

Thank You

story:
Short Summary

Originally born in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, I was raised in San Diego, California where I attended Lemon Grove Middle School and graduated from Mount Miguel High School. I am a graduate of Spelman College where I received my Bachelor’s Degree in Child Development. While at Spelman, I joined a community service organization called Sister’s Keeping It Real Through Service, Incorporated where I directed a mentoring program for girls in elementary and middle school. My time with these girls affirmed what I already recognized as a need for positive images of brown women in and around our communities. Since graduating from Spelman in 2009, I have worked as an elementary school teacher in Georgia's both public and charter school sectors. During my time in the classroom, my love for reading and acting out stories for my students sparked a light in me to begin developing my own children's book series. There is a great need for diversity in children’s literature and in children’s entertainment, which inspired me to create Ebony Pearl’s World. As a child, when I found the perfect book series, I would let my imagination run wild. I was most intrigued by books that had characters who looked like me. Ebony Pearl is a character that brown girls can relate to because when they look at her, they see a reflection of themselves.

What We Need & What You Get'

We need your help raising money to self-publish the book, Ebony Pearl's Friends: Beautifully Brown. The book will be illustrated by a fellow Spelman Alumna, Courtney Anderson, who will bring this story to life with her creative and vibrant drawing talents. Another Spelman Alumna, Latriecia Brown is also a major part of bringing this vision to life. We have come together to have a positive impact on young girls in our community. The self-publishing option will allow me the freedom to keep my own team of Spelman sisters during the development of this book. It will also allow me to continuously develop Ebony Pearl's character while still maintaining it's authenticity. In self publishing, the creator of the book is responsible for 100% of the printing and distribution costs. The creator is also repsonsible for purchasing an ISBN number as well as for any taxes and fees associated with the creation of the book. With your support, we can raise enough funds to cover all of  these costs. I would also like to use a portion of the funds to transform the Ebony Pearl's World website into an interactive website where Ebony Pearl fans can learn and have fun. 

Now here's the fun part! Let's talk perks! While, there is truly no way to fully express the magnitude of my gratitude for your support, I would still like to to recognize you with sincere appreciation. There are a variety of contribution options and what you get in return are some very cool perks! They range from a heartfelt thank you directly from Ebony Pearl, to your name being highlighted on the Ebony Pearl's World facebook fan page, or to you receiving a printed copy of the actual book! We want to recognize you in a special way for supporting our campaign!

The Impact

With so many campaigns out there, here's why Ebony Pearl's World really needs your support. The mission of Ebony Pearl’s World is to empower young girls of color to feel confident, beautiful, and to truly love and embrace their beautiful shades of brown skin. In many of our families, when looking at our mothers, sisters and daughters, we see many different shades of brown represented. Sometimes the conversation about skin is not so easy. The book relays this message in a fun and unique way that young girls can enjoy. We seek to make the conversation among families a little easier. Along with empowering girls of color comes the thought of love and acceptance of all girls globally. In the well known poem, "Our Greatest Fear" by Marianne Williamson, she wrote “And as we let our own light shine,  we subconsciously give other people  permission to do the same.” While this series fosters the empowerment of brown girls throughout the world, in teaching young girls of color to love themselves, we teach them not to be defined by standards of beauty that do not reflect them, but rather to create their own standards of beauty. In allowing brown girls to let their light shine, they subconsciously find acceptance of cultural diversity. The Ebony Pearl series not only teaches young African-American girls to love their own brown beauty, but also the beauty that can be found in multicultural sisterhood. As each story in this series continues to develop, characters from a variety of backgrounds are connected through the experiences they share with their friend Ebony Pearl. The goal is to inspire every girl who picks up an Ebony Pearl book to feel beautiful!

You can be apart of this journey! Just think about one little brown girl you know and picture her being inspired to love her skin. The impact your contribution will have on the mission to of empowering girls of color will not only promote self love, but it will also promote the love and acceptance of others.The thought of one girl being inspired by the Ebony Pearl character is all it takes to fuel my ambition for this initiative. With your support, you will have played a significant role in a cause that will inspire girls all over. Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

So you love this campaign and wish you could give financially, but you are unable to at this time? You can still help out in a major way! Make some noise about Ebony Pearl's World and the book by clicking "like", "share", and "send" on all of your social media outlets including email. You can also utilize the indiegogo share tools found on this website. Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Agent Smith cleared his throat and began:
     “Throughout history, there have been stories and reports of strange animals, evil creatures and unexplained phenomena. While most people believe these are just tales, we have found out that the tales have at least some basis in fact. As best we can tell, there are certain spots where the boundary between our reality and another reality, another plane of existence, or another place grows thin and weak. Sometimes, this boundary is thin enough that something from the other side can get through the barrier. At other times, the barrier thins, and the fears and dreams of the people nearby allow their deepest fears to manifest in our reality. We call these crossings ‘Incursions’. "
- Excerpt from Incursion: Knightmare by Bryan Donihue

My name is Bryan Donihue, and I'm an author, speaker, trainer, artist, and entrepreneur. I am the founder of a company called Sheepdog Development, dedicated to teaching churches and parents how to keep kids safe. I am also a founding partner in a company that offers training and consulting for small and mid-sized business, called Business Success Enterprises.

I am an avid reader and long-time writer. Before 2014, I had never really thought about publishing any of my work. Last year, I decided to self-publish my first book, a non-fiction book called What They Don't Tell You About Church Safety. Earlier this year, I co-wrote a second non-fiction book called Ready, Set, Connect!  for professional photographers.

I am also a long-time gamer and game designer. Years ago, some friends and I started working on designing a roleplaying game. For years, we worked on various games and systems, wanting to build a unique system and storyline, with the eventual goal of publishing. Although that never came to fruition, the lessons learned helped us start a new chapter, closing that door and beginning a new, tighter game, which we are internally testing right now.

This modern-day horror game spawned an idea for a novel - this novel. Incursion: Knightmare is about a secret government team that hunts monsters. From vampires to zombies, and even other-dimensional beings, this new team was formed from military, law enforcement, and religious personnel, and includes a freelance hunter with a family history. This novel is the first in a planned series about this team and Section 28, the governmental department that they work for. 

*** NEW COVER RENDER 4/15/2015 ***

Different Cover Render - 04/21/2015:


What I'm Looking For

So what am I looking for in this campaign? I'm looking for $500 to help with a few of the costs associated with self-publishing this novel. While self-publishing is a fairly inexpensive way of getting a novel out there, there are a few costs associated with providing a QUALITY end-product. 

EDITING:
I'm fortunate that I have a friend who is a fantastic professional editor. She was the editor who worked on my first work, and made my words actually work. For my last book, she really took care of me. While I can't pay her what she's worth, I want to make sure she doesn't regret editing this book. Every Supporter at Veteran Hunter ($25) or above, will receive a backer-only custom printed bookmark for their book (s) - Design To Be Announced. Novice Hunters ($15) will receive a printable PDF of the bookmark.

Every Supporter at Veteran Hunter ($25) or above will receive a backer-only print of the front cover of the book, signed by the artist. Novice Hunters ($15) will receive the printable PDF version of the print.

story_txt:
Agent Smith cleared his throat and began:     “Throughout history, there have been stories and reports of strange animals, evil creatures and unexplained phenomena. While most people believe these are just tales, we have found out that the tales have at least some basis in fact. As best we can tell, there are certain spots where the boundary between our reality and another reality, another plane of existence, or another place grows thin and weak. Sometimes, this boundary is thin enough that something from the other side can get through the barrier. At other times, the barrier thins, and the fears and dreams of the people nearby allow their deepest fears to manifest in our reality. We call these crossings ‘Incursions’. "- Excerpt from Incursion: Knightmare by Bryan Donihue
My name is Bryan Donihue, and I'm an author, speaker, trainer, artist, and entrepreneur. I am the founder of a company called Sheepdog Development, dedicated to teaching churches and parents how to keep kids safe. I am also a founding partner in a company that offers training and consulting for small and mid-sized business, called Business Success Enterprises.
I am an avid reader and long-time writer. Before 2014, I had never really thought about publishing any of my work. Last year, I decided to self-publish my first book, a non-fiction book called What They Don't Tell You About Church Safety. Earlier this year, I co-wrote a second non-fiction book called Ready, Set, Connect!  for professional photographers.
I am also a long-time gamer and game designer. Years ago, some friends and I started working on designing a roleplaying game. For years, we worked on various games and systems, wanting to build a unique system and storyline, with the eventual goal of publishing. Although that never came to fruition, the lessons learned helped us start a new chapter, closing that door and beginning a new, tighter game, which we are internally testing right now.
This modern-day horror game spawned an idea for a novel - this novel. Incursion: Knightmare is about a secret government team that hunts monsters. From vampires to zombies, and even other-dimensional beings, this new team was formed from military, law enforcement, and religious personnel, and includes a freelance hunter with a family history. This novel is the first in a planned series about this team and Section 28, the governmental department that they work for.    *** NEW COVER RENDER 4/15/2015 ***

story:
It’s hard being a teen girl. They have intense pressure to succeed and limited opportunities to affect legislation. People are always talking about them or at them. And rarely are they asked for their thoughts. That’s all changing with Teen Voices at Women’s eNews. As a global girl news site we give young women the opportunity to be involved in creating news about their lives and influencing international news coverage, cultivating the next generation of social activist journalists.


Help change the media landscape by donating to our end of the year campaign. 

Formerly a print publication and mentoring program that began in Boston in 1988, Teen Voices is now an online source for international news on girls’ opinions, innovations and barriers to success. 

During our pilot year we gave 46 teens from all over the world, mentoring, training and publishing opportunities through our Virtual Newsroom and our partner content.

Each of the 50 articles we've published has added dimension to how the world sees teen girls. From understanding why there are few girls in baseball to the role of texting in teen dating, Teen Voices amplifies the hidden voices of girls. 

If you think girls have something to say give to Teen Voices. 

Show girls you want to hear what they have to say. Teen Voices #BeHeard. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $5,000 to meet our goals for the year and ensure a healthy start in 2015. With your help we can continue to deliver news like this:


Happily, Teen Lifeguards Say It's Not 'Baywatch' 
By Karly Matthews

Babysitters Find Gender Gap at Starting Gate
by Alexea Hankin


Baseball Champ Mo'ne Davis Is Tough Act to Follow            By Angela Roberts


Teens Say School Sex Harassment Goes Unpunished             By Nicole Deniflee and Tatyana Bellamy-Walker 

Teen Voices is a journalism training program. We amplify the voices of young women around the world and provide a platform for teens to share news about their lives through these three initiatives:

  • Teen Voices Virtual Newsroom: Teen journalists are paid to report on news assigned by Teen Voices at Women’s eNews editors.

  • Global Partnerships: Collaborations with global organizations and schools permit girls from all over the world to receive training on how to effectively communicate their messages while we also provide them with an international stage to spotlight their work.

  • A Seat at the Table: This series partners women and teens for a self-moderated, recorded intergenerational conversation on leadership and feminism. Segments are shot and edited by paid teen videographers.  

To put it simply, we are helping young women around the world to #BeHeard!


The Impact

Our teen journalists get paid for the work they do and learn valuable life and work skills while they are at it. Listen to what they have to say:

“Teenagers don’t think their voices matter anywhere, so when you call them up and start telling them their every-day experiences matter enough to be written about, I think a change happens.”
“Any of the issues that I am looking forward to writing about for Teen Voices stem from problems I’ve faced and seen in my own community, and Teen Voices has allowed me to speak about them.”
“I’ve started to realize that being a journalist could be a reality for me.” 

On top of this, our partnerships with girl-serving organizations allow us to showcase the authentic voices and experiences of girls from such places as Kenya, Afghanistan, Chicago, L.A., Detroit, and Toronto.

Check out these stories:

Help! My Reading List Has Been Whitewashed
By Joneka Percentie, SPARK Movement
Hidden Truths: Why Some Women Wear Hijab, Others Don't
By Adamajan Bah, Hibo Abdullahi & Miriam Bah, Teen Voices Rising
Campaign Guides Teens to Embrace Their Tone
By Cheyenne Tobias, SPARK Movement
Family Planning: More Than Free Condoms in Kenya
By Joan Cherop, Daraja Academy

Donate to make sure these voices and the millions more like them are heard.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate today? There are many more ways that you can help Teen Voices succeed!

  • #BeHeard! Make some noise! Share this page: tell your friends -- tell the world -- to join in and support our cause!

  • Get in touch! If you’re a teen girl or work with a teen girl program and want to partner on this initiative, let us know! Email teenvoices@womensenews.org today.

  • Connect with us! Like us on Facebook http://www.facebook.com/teenvoices  Follow us on Twitter @teenvoices & Find us on Tumblr  http://teenvoiceswenews.tumblr.com/ 


More Information

To learn more about Teen Voices at Women’s eNews, visit our website:  http://womensenews.org/about-womens-enews-teen-voices

To find out more about Women’s eNews click the link below:  http://womensenews.org/about-womens-enews-mission#.VHNelzTF81I

story:
My name is Alain Miguelez. I'm an urban planner and an amateur historian. I love my city, and I love researching its history. I've written a book titled Transforming Ottawa: Canada's Capital in the Eyes of Jacques Gréber. This book was inspired by the rediscovery, at the National Archives, of a large collection of hauntingly beautiful street scenes of Ottawa in 1937-39, commissioned by Jacques Gréber, the French urban planner hired by the Prime Minister of the day (W.L. Mackenzie King) to prepare a master plan for our city. The book looks at the city as Gréber saw it in 1937, when he first set foot in Ottawa, describes his famous 1950 plan, and discusses its outcomes and effects on our city.

If you live in Ottawa, chances are you’ve heard of the Gréber Plan. Now 65 years old, this blueprint for our city was almost entirely implemented over the decades and, in many ways, has defined the city as we know it today. But what did Ottawa look like before the Gréber Plan? What did that Plan see as the city’s burning problems, and how did it propose to resolve them? In hindsight, how did the solutions play out?

The book contains about 300 of these incredibly sharp and crisp black-and-white Ottawa street scenes from the late 1930's, in high resolution. You will see photos of streets and corners that are now unrecognizable, and some that have stayed amazingly identical to how they looked 75 years ago.

This crowd-funding campaign is to allow me to publish this book professionally, have it designed to be a beautiful work of art, and price it for as wide a readership as possible. The book itself is intended as a contribution to the ongoing conversation about our growing city, its planning history, and its present-day challenges. I feel that it's important to know where we've been in order to better map out the future. Especially these days, with all the exciting projects that are taking place in Ottawa, the much stronger sense of civic identity emerging in our city, and the genuine interest in the stories and legends of our past, this book is intended to become a reference about the pivotal 1950 master plan by Jacques Gréber that changed the face of our city in a number of ways.

I intend to publish this book by the end of 2015 (it will be available in time for Christmas and will make a great gift for all those who are interested in our city's history!).

This is my second book - in 2004, I published "A Theatre Near You: 150 years of going to the show in Ottawa-Gatineau", a history of Ottawa-Gatineau theatres.

I am grateful for all contributions, and also very thankful to those who post, share, tweet or tell their friends and family about this crowd-funding.

Alain Miguelez

story:
Who Are We?

Hey there, and thanks for checking out my Indiegogo campaign!

I'm Chelsea. My sister is Kerry. We are the eponymous Rustad sisters. And we would like to create beautiful, compelling art for you to enjoy in some yet to be determined format. It could be a calendar, a booklet, or an art book, depending on the number of quality images we end up with.

I got the idea for Exiled Creatures when I was approached by OlyKaz Photography about doing a shoot this year. I pitched the idea of working with my sister to portray my concept of mythical creatures and exiles, and it was wholeheartedly embraced. Now we just need to set everything in motion to make that happen.

This is my first Indiegogo campaign, and I would like very much to believe that there are those out there who are also interested in helping us realize our vision: otherworldly, stunning, and high quality images featuring a motif of dangerous and exotic mythological creatures, portrayed by Chelsea and Kerry through fashion, professional styling, and a variety of scenic and appropriately moody locales.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to realize this vision in its full potential, we'll be incurring the following expenses for both sisters for each concept we shoot. $1500 is just a number to shoot for; I'll make the most of whatever we end up with. But the more resources we have, the higher the production values. We'll be looking to start shooting soon after the completion of this campaign, and will distribute the perks ASAP!

  • Professional hair/makeup
  • Costumes and accessories
  • OlyKAZ Photography (he's volunteering his talents for the project, but I would like to compensate him for his time if possible)
  • Travel expenses (Kerry lives in Seattle, Chelsea and the photographer live in Olympia)

To reward your generous contributions to this project, please choose your favorite from the assortment of available perks, including:

  • Contributor credits
  • Contributor credit+
  • The finished product (TBD; could be calendar, art book, or other preferred format)
  • The finished product + high quality print

You can also donate any amount you like via the "Contribute Now" button if you prefer.

Why This Project Matters

This art project has personal significance for me. Without going into excruciating detail, this year I have battled severe depression for the first time in my life as a result of facing rejection because of who I am, and because I would not change to suit others. It's been physically and emotionally taxing, and has been complicated by my planned impending hysterectomy to treat/prevent endometriosis and uterine fibroids. I felt exiled and alone because of my chronic pain and unconventional choices. My goal is to create something productive and beautiful out of my hurt, and demonstrate through this series that just because something is uncommon or misunderstood doesn't make it wrong or devoid of worth. What I hope to convey through these images would be the inherent value and beauty of variety, even if it means a person doesn't fit in with society's expectations.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a donation at this time? No worries. If you'd still like to help, please feel free to forward the campaign link on to friends and spread the word! Indiegogo provides share tools so you can "Like" the page on Facebook, Tweet it, email it, whatever works best.

Thanks so much! With your help I'll be able to realize my vision this year to its fullest. I sincerely hope you enjoy it.
