story:
The Power of Adversity - A Guide to Finding Your Greatest Gift in Life

Hello! This is Tiffany Mason and I am excited to announce the release of my first book - The Power of Adversity - A Guide to Finding Your Greatest Gift in Life.  Over the past few years, I have listened as dozens of women shared their personal struggles with me about their closest relationships, struggles for work/life balance, raising children and other important issues.  

As I began to reflect on those many conversations, the desire to share my story and work with as many women as I could kept growing.  That is why I decided to write The Power of Adversity - A Guide to Finding Your Greatest Gift in Life.

---------------------

Throughout my youth I was living a dream.  As a professional entertainer, I performed in front of large audiences, traveled to competitions and participated in beauty pageants.  I looked forward to a future full of possibilities in the entertainment world.

  

    

--------------------

My life turned upside down when I turned 18. I was sexually molested by an older man and left completely traumatized.  My outgoing personality was gone.  I lost weight and my mood grew dark.  I kept the people who used to be close to me at a distance. 

My journey of healing began with a vision - a vision of what I wanted my life to look like.  I then passionately set out to make it a reality.  For the next five years I devoured every piece of information on development and marriage I could find.  

Along the way my life's passion was born:  "What does it take to get a life truly worth living for?"  What happened to me in my late teens does not define me but has helped shaped what I have become.  It was truly a blessing in disguise.  I am now leading the life I deserve - that we all deserve - one filled with purpose, passion and love.

You know what?  Each day I wake up and choose to make it even better, by doing things I want to do, things I am truly passionate about.

I want you to have that kind of life too.  The potential is in all of us.  It was not easy, but it is worth it.

--------------------

Who better than someone who has overcome her own significant challenges to help you overcome yours?  In "The Power of Adversity - A Guide to Finding Your Greatest Gift in Life" you will learn that you have the ability to make the desires of your heart a reality.  By showing you how to use the most powerful tool at your disposal - your mind, I will walk with you as you face down and overcome your own personal adversity.  Together we will look at the importance of whom you surround yourself with, what you say to yourself and how to create your own personal philosophy. 

We all have habits we engage in, and the difference between people living a life of fulfillment and those who are not is the fulfilled ones created their own habits instead of accepting the ones life could have chosen for them.  Through choosing a series of behaviors and actions, we build the foundation for a fulfilled life.

---------------------


What your donations support?


I’ve already written a complete rough draft of the book. Now, I need support in editing and publishing the book. I deeply believe that this book is a powerful message to those that have experienced a traumatic situation. This book gives hope that no matter what kind of adversity you have experienced, there is a gift awaiting for you to unwrap.This gift will be the light that will lead you to living a life filled with joy, love and the freedom to move past your adversity. 


Because I know in my heart that this book can inspire so many women, I want this book to be handled with excellence and quality. The money received from this campaign will go into: 



If you have any questions, please use this form. I look forward to reading your message! 

Fill out my online form on my website The Power of Precedents! 


----------------------


Personal Transformation:

Now, at the age of 24, I’ve realized that my adversity has become a blessing in disguise. If it weren’t for this traumatic situation, I would not have become so passionate about life and marriage. This adversity allowed me to explore what is truly joyful in life.  I am now happily married to my loving husband John and have found my calling in life. I am a Professional Life and Relationship Coach where I work with with married women to overcome adversity, discover their greatest gift and design a life truly worth living for.

------------------------


Thank you for supporting the message of this book. 


-------------------------


**All levels of support will receive:

  • Access to an exclusive weekly newsletter for behind the scenes of  the journey of editing and publishing The Power of Adversity and I will also share with you tips, strategies and ways on how to live a more joyful life!
  • a BIG shoutout on social media where I express my gratitude for your support.

story:
Short Summary

The Correllian-Nativist Tradition has spent 6 months gathering pagan oriented books and tools which will be shipped to the Clan of Kheper Temple, Cape Town, South Africa in April, 2013.  These include books on many different religions other than the "Big Three" and spiritual disciplines for readers of all ages and expertise.  

In S.A. a book can cost as much as two days worth of food.  In many areas of Africa being named a witch is life threatening.  Our goal is to provide a safe and nurturing environment where all seekers can explore books with a wide variety of topics and get hands on experience utilizing tools which can be checked out and used in the comfort of one's home at no cost.  One book has the potential to open up a whole new realm of spirituality and a lifetime of learning.  Help us deliver this dream and house the Inter-Faith Pagan Library of South Africa.

What We Need & What You Get

The $2,000 goal for this campaign will provide two things.  First and foremost it will deliver the accumulated library to South Africa.  Secondly, it will purchase a Wendy House to function as the library facility.  This will enable a broader access to the gathered materials than being housed in someone's home.  The highest level perk is what is required to purchase the minimum size Wendy House to successfully function as the library. We put that perk out there in the hopes it would be claimed and that any additional funding received would be enough to not only ship the accumulated materials but to upgrade the Wendy House to accommodate a larger library collection.

We have perks to fit all budgets!  From our original bookmark, custom t-shirts, metaphysical stones straight from Africa including one from the personal collection of the High Priest of the Clan of Kheper Temple, Ndebele tribal dolls and commemorative plagues just select a perk that calls to you!

Should we not reach our entire goal of providing the Wendy House, the donated funds will be used to ship the library to South Africa and install bookshelves to house it at the High Priestess of the temple’s home.

The Impact

This library includes books, CDs and tools on many of the non-book religions, not just Wicca.  We have tried to vary the content in order to serve all Pagan paths and spiritual disciplines.  The content includes non-fiction books on spirituality, rituals, magick, runes, tarot, herbs, candle magic, crystals, meditation, dream analysis, numerology, astrology, omens, natural medicines and healing, scrying, reflexology, palmistry, hand writing analysis, spirit guides and totems, Feng Shui, I-Ching, Shamanism, aura reading and so much more.  There are also pagan oriented fictional works included in the library, especially for the younger generations. 

Donations of books, cd’s and tools have come in from around the world as the Correllian-Nativist Tradition has temples and shrines in 16 countries across the globe as well as a network of non-Correllians who work with our members every day to further the acceptance of the overall Pagan path.

Now the final phase of this project needs your help, the shipment to South Africa and housing of the library collection once there.  Please help at whatever level you feel called to knowing it will all make an impact on the lives of many generations of seekers in South Africa.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you are unable to donate financially to this worthy project here are a few ways to support it.  Please share the link to this Indiegogo campaign on all your social media sites and e-mail your friends who might be interested in the project about it. 

Also feel free to ship any pagan oriented books, CDs, DVDs, tarot cards, divination tools, etc. you wish to contribute to the library to be included in the April shipment to the address below.  Please DO NOT send herbs, incense, candles or perishables.  All materials must reach the below address no later than March 31st to be included in the library.  The U.S. Post Office media rate is usually the cheapest shipping alternative but it can take several weeks to arrive so ship early!

Address removed due to the deadline being passed.  Please check our Facebook page for a shipping address for late shipments of library materials.

story:
Please help a Vet fund his first novel!

Hello friends,

My name is Wind, a name given to me along the way while adventuring and soul-seeking.  Many of you may know me as the muggle formerly known as Matt.  I recently completed a trek to the jungles of South America where a lot of things happened for me, including a complete transformation of my life And spirituality. 

I've gone from a life of military service into a complete Shift of consciousness. I share my path in order to help inspire others to also reach deep within for their own transformation - it can be a very lonely and scary path at times. I offer my own failures and successes in navigating this Awakening as a way of showing that all is Divine in the process. 

In order to publish my first book out the gate I am in the position of requiring a modest amount of money by publishing standards.  The publishing company is a highly reputable source of spiritual literary works and I am very honored that they wish to help me self-publish!  The perk of utilizing them is that once each month their parent publishing company, Hay House, meets to discuss any great works that they have interest in picking up.  I am confident that what has flowed from me is going to make that cut before the end of 2013.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The cost of the publishing package which I am seeking is just above the middle of the road, where I will get full e-book, paperback, and hard-cover distribution, an ISBN assignment, a Library of Congress number, and copyright registration. 
  • The list of benefits from your donation is available via www.balboapress.com/packages if you would like to see what you are helping me achieve.  As much as I’d love to go the full distance with the $7,999 Master Package I know it’s best to shoot for the more reasonable deal at this time.  I will simply add the more extensive benefits once the book sales are rolling in…and I know they are going to! 
  • My goal is the $3,599 Inspire Package and I will cover the remaining expenses out of pocket.  If I fall short of my goal then I will still add what I obtain towards the package and simply cover the rest in payments.  If I go over the goal, then of course I am going to add further marketing benefits.  If I go really over then I will apply the funds to traveling for distant book-signings!

***The largest contributor will receive a special mention in the book cover! 

Other Ways You Can Help

I very much appreciate your time and consideration and acknowledge that you may not be in a place to contribute.  I do hope you will share this with others who may also be interested!  Your positive energy on this project means so much to me.  Thank you!  Namaste, and Blessings.

 My podcast!

<font color="#333333" size="-1"><a href="http://sorcererstorytime.podbean.com/mf/play/s5... to this episode</a></font>

story:
HEY THERE KIDS

 
My name is Gwen and I have been writing poetry for as long as I can remember. It's something I'm passionate about, something I get excited about. I've hoped someday to be published, even if it's just a small book of stories or poems. What better way to make it happen, then to self-publish? The thing is, though, I can't quite do it all on my own. That is where you come in! :)

WHAT I NEED, WHAT YOU LOVELIES GET

To my immense delight and surprise, self-publishing does not cost that much. To reach this goal, I'm looking at about $500-- that should be enough to get about 100 small books printed. With your help, I can make it happen!
 
Now, here's the fun part-- you donate, you get things!
 
If you want to recieve a book, the minimum is a $10 donation. But you don't have to give that much! Even $5 will get you something, like a hand-written poem, or a small doodle. The more you donate, the bigger the benefits for you--like getting a portrait of your beautiful self, or a special mention in the book! So really, everyone wins.

WHAT THIS MEANS

Not only would you be helping me achieve a dream, but you get to be a part of a shiny, brand-new experience, a leap into the world of being a published author. You get a little part of me, a book you can hold in your hands, that's filled with my words and thoughts and ideas and I think that's pretty cool. Plus, you might also get a handwritten poem, or a drawing, or your name published, too! Far out.

WHAT ELSE?


It's perfectly fine if you're unable to donate money. You can still be a huge help by promoting! Tell your friends and family that it's happening, share it on any number of social media websites (there's plenty to choose from). Even a small note of, like, "Hey, good for you!" feels amazing. Any sort of encouragement is appreciated. :D

story:
Hi there! My name is Leigh Spector and I am a 31 year old Mother of 6, who adores cooking healthy, Organic, Vegan recipes for my family and friends.

After being diagnosed with MS in 2011, I was faced with more than just the diagnosis...I was faced with a TON of INFORMATION too! This led me to research many things to help underline the root cause and how to keep myself as healthy as possible while healing.

With all the INFO, I ended up studying for my Nutrionist Certification and started developing recipes...Vegan Recipes That Is!

The beauty with my book is that, yes they are all Vegan, but they have so many variations even a person who loves the occasional poultry can use them!

The other beautiful piece of AWESOMENESS, is that I have the needed food allergy substitutions BUILT IN to EVERY recipe! From what I have heard, there are not very many books like that around...so please help me get this one out there!

If you have time to share some 'dough', I would very much appreciate the funds, and if you read below, you will see why!


Thank you!

Leigh Spector
Nutritionist/Writer/Mom

Thank you!Leigh SpectorNutritionist/Writer/Mom

story:
Short Summary

I want to use my extensive knowledge of the written word to create a 3-month travelogue about a very bad person being very mean. Because, well, strokes.


Less-Short Summary

Hi, I'm MCM, and I write stuff. In the last decade, I created a TV show called RollBots, wrote a whole bunch of books like The Pig and the Box, Typhoon and Fission Chips, and tried to push the publishing envelope in crazy new directions. My newest project, Shutterbugs, a preschool show I co-created, is currently in production.

For my next trick, I want to write a story about an insufferable bastard being insufferably bastardly... so I don't die.

Now I know what you're thinking: how can writing a story keep someone alive? Well, I've got insanely high blood pressure thanks to two awful years helping my wife recover from being hit by a car, and thanks to the abject failure of the insurance industry, I don't know how I'm going to keep the lights on for the next three months. Literally, even. 

And while my doctor thinks pills are the answer, I can tell you with some certainty that pills cost money, which to me sounds like a negative feedback loop in action. So I'm opting for the natural approach: I want to write something cathartic, with no regard for human decency, to help relieve the stress that's killing me.

And thus, we have Sriracha for the Soul, a travelogue about a broken-down bastard who is sent by God to savagely belittle enough people to avert the apocalypse. And no, God hasn't been drinking. Yet.

The story will be published free on the web, in chapters no more than 1,000 words, twice a week, until the end of August. There is a plot, and a purpose, and it will be viciously funny to see it unfold.

Why is this project important to me? If it gets funded, it helps me feed my family. And if it doesn't, at least I'll be happier while I starve to death. Ha ha, just kidding. Sorta.



What We Need & What You Get

How much does this cost? Here's what's needed for me to write this: $3,000. Not because it costs money for me to smack my hands against the keyboard, but because that's the shortfall in my summer budget... it's what's keeping me from reaching September in one piece. My summer budget has no frills in it, either. Sadly. I need me some Screech.

What kinds of perks will you get? Sadly, pretty much just good vibes. The goal here is to make my life LESS stressful, not more. But my good vibes, they're A1 good vibes, 100% certified by the Good Vibes Association of Canada, which may or may not exist.

What if you don't get to $3,000? Well, I'll still write it, but I'll cry a little every time I post a chapter. But probably not much, because I'll be dehydrated and stuff.


    OK, But Seriously, What?

    The premise to the story is simple: God calls upon Cal McIver to piss off the AntiChrist, thereby saving the world.

    Cal is a guy with a silver tongue that he regularly misuses, so it's a bit of a shock when he's chosen for this Very Important Mission. But desperate times call for desperate measures...

    See, the apocalypse is coming, and thanks to some legal fine print, the supreme commander of the Armies of Hell must be chosen randomly from a pool of living mortals with True Hate in their hearts. So that can either be a diabolical murderer on death row, or... a cyclist who gets chewed out about not stopping at stop signs.

    The Lord works in mysterious ways, the clever bastard.



    The Impact

    How will Sriracha for the Soul change the world? I'm fairly certain it'll kill a hefty number of brain cells in anyone who reads it, so... er... that's something. And hey, it might make you smile. If it does, you may want to see a psychiatrist.

    How can you trust that I can do this? Well, I have a pretty solid track record in terms of writing, and writing on odd schedules (see: The Archivists, written in three straight days, jet lagged in Belgium, while a large audience voted to meddle with my plot points). Next to all that, this is easy. 


    Risks & Challenges

    Risks. Well, I might die midway through. That's a risk for sure. In terms of challenges, I occasionally get migraines due to weather, and that'd definitely slow things down. But in the end, there's nothing in this that I can't handle. Except the death part. 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you have no money, that's fine. I have no money, and I still love me. But if you want to help while being broke (or even while rich!) you can do the following:

      • Tell your friends about this;
      • Tell your enemies that you hate this and would never support it;
      • Use the Indiegogo share tools;
      • Don't get hit by a car;
      • Send me a happy email at mcm@1889.ca, because I like happy.

      Thank you, and good night.

Hallo liebe Crowd,

mein Name ist Alexander Geißler, stamme aus Trier in Deutschland und bin 33 Jahre alt.

Ich möchte 2015 vor Ort ein bebildertes Buch über den Appalachian Trail schreiben.

Es soll eine Mischung aus Tagebuch mit meinen täglichen Erlebnissen, Reiseführer mit nützlichen Tipps und Bildband werden. Das Buch soll später zwischen 180 und 220 Seiten haben.

Ich möchte meine Erfahrungen auf dem Trail mit allen teilen, und so ein wenig zum Erhalt und zum Schutz dieses Naturparadieses beitragen.

Ich benötige eure Hilfe, um dieses Buch zu schreiben.

Eure Spende wird verwendet, um den Trail laufen zu können und später das Buch zu finanzieren.

Alle Gelder, die ich bekomme, aber nicht benötige, sowie 50 Prozent des Erlöses durch Buchverkäufe werden an die Appalachian Trail Conservancy gespendet!

Die Gelder werden in jedem Fall für das Projekt verwendet, auch wenn der Zielbetrag nicht erreicht wird!

Als Dankeschön bekommt ihr unter anderem eine Postkarte vom Trail oder ein persönlich Signiertes Buch.

Gruß Alexander Geißler

Dear crowd ,

my name is Alexander Geissler , originally from Trier in Germany and I am 33 years old.

I want to write a illustrated book about the Appalachian Trail on site in 2015.

It will be a mixture of diary with my daily experiences, travel guide with useful tips and photo book . The book will have 180-220 pages.

I want to share my experiences on the trail with everyone, and thus contribute a little to the preservation and protection of this natural paradise .

I need your help to write this book.

Your donation will be used to run the trail and to finance the book.

All the money I get , but do not need , as well as 50 percent of the proceeds of book sales will be donated to the Appalachian Trail Conservancy !

The funds will be used in each case for the project , even if the target amount is not reached !

As a thank you get , among others, a postcard from the trail or a personally signed book.

Greeting Alexander Geissler

story:
Security specialist Gat Burroughs died once, and he’ll be damned if he lets it happen again. Unfortunately, somebody is determined to kill his client, the washed-up star Max Prince, and isn’t afraid to go through Gat to do it.

Is it Max’s debauched granddaughter and heir Porsche? Is it the deadly Suerte y Muerte, a cult that kills to steal good luck? Is it Max’s own lawyer and manager, Jerome?

And how on earth did the would-be assassin get past Alan, Max Prince´s top-grade artificial intelligence that´s housed in an artificial body constructed to look identical to computer pioneer Alan Turing?

Gat will have to follow the clues through L.A.’s underworld, the slums of Mexico City, and his own guilty past to find the shocking and surprising answer.

Help me bring this completed sci-fi thriller novel to publication!

My name is Nas Hedron and I’ve published fiction and poetry in the U.S., Europe, and elsewhere. Now I’ve completed my new novel, Luck and Death at the Edge of the World, the first in a series about Gat Burroughs and his life after death in a very strange future.

I need your help to take this finished book to publication. The book has already been professionally edited and proofread, but I need your support to pay for typesetting and formatting, website development, graphic design, promotional materials, and promotional events.

I’m asking for a modest budget of $5,000 to cover these expenses. I’ve already begun promoting the book heavily, but it won’t succeed without your help.

These final touches make the difference between a finished manuscript sitting somewhere in a desk drawer, and a book that reaches its audience and becomes a success!

You can read the first three chapters here:

Luck and Death (3 chapters): epub | mobi | pdf

Luck and Death Audiobook (1 chapter): mp3

(Right-click and "Save As" to download the MP3 file)

You can also view the first chapter of the audiobook as a video by clicking on the “Gallery” tab at the top of this page.

Here’s some praise from Ian Watson, author of The Universal Machine: From the Dawn of Computing to Digital Consciousness:

“A great science fiction detective story featuring a classic noir detective, a fading super-star, a nymphomaniac, and an AI who channels Alan Turing, the father of computing, all set in a dystopian future that is familiar yet fascinatingly strange - what more could you want?”

One lucky funder who contributes $20 or more will be randomly chosen for an upgrade to the Taste of Immortality package, which includes naming a character in the book! Compared to a typical lottery, your chances in this draw are pretty good, and the $20 package is an excellent value already, so give it some thought.

As a second bonus, for each $1000 raised, another randomly-chosen funder will be upgraded two perk levels! Spreading the word to your friends could get you perks worth $10, $20, or even $50!

When will the perks be delivered?
The Special Edition, Expanded Special Edition, and digital art package will be delivered by May 31, 2012. The postcard will be sent by the same date. The short stories will be delivered by August 2012 and December 2012. The next novel (In the Empire of the Monkey King) will be delivered upon publication in 2013.

How close are the short stories and next novel to completion?
The first short story, Felon and the Judas Kiss, is already complete. The second short story is in the concept stage. The next novel is at the first draft.

Are there any restrictions on character naming?
I reserve the right to reject character names that would take the reader out of the story. If you want to name a character “Boogermeister Nosepicker”, I’ll sadly have to give you a refund instead. However, other than this I’m very easy-going about names, and except where the story dictates otherwise, I don’t care if the name is masculine, feminine, or other, or if you choose a name that’s Danish, Yoruba, or Hmong. Everyone is welcome in my world.

Are there any restrictions on website links?
I reserve the right to reject links to websites that contain offensive, illegal, or hateful material.

What happens if the project isn’t fully funded by the end of the campaign?
No matter what amount I receive, Luck & Death will be published and all funders will receive their perks on time. However, it will take longer for the next novel to come out, and I won’t be able to publish Luck & Death with the professional polish it deserves.

What about surplus funds?
Any surplus funds will be spent on additional promotions or on the budget for the next novel in the series (In the Empire of the Monkey King).

What else can I do to help?
Tell your friends, especially anybody who’s interested in science fiction, but people who are interested in Mexico, Alan Turing, or people who enjoy thrillers and detective stories might also enjoy the book.

If you want to spread the word on a forum, you can use this banner -- please link to www.luckanddeath.com if you do.

 

What else are you writing?
I also write three blogs that might interest you:

The Turing Centenary is devoted to Alan Turing, the father of the computer, and the Alan Turing Year, celebrating his 100th birthday in 2012 in over 20 countries.

Homo Artificialis deals with the science and culture of artificial humanity, including cybernetics, artificial intelligence, and nanomedicine.

Once and Future Mexico looks at the future of Mexico -- which is the setting for part of the book -- in reality and in science fiction.

story:
What is Dédalo?

Dédalo is a magazine created in 2006 by a group of students from the Faculty of Architecture of the University of Porto (FAUP), Portugal, established as a place for critical reflection and intervention. As an editorial platform for experimentation, Dédalo is run by a different team each year, creating new artistic paths and crossroads, allowing for the dissemination and discussion of different points of view and design methods.


Dédalo 10 - Who Lives Next Door?

Dédalo is now on the run to publish its 10th edition, and it needs your help!

As an interpretative result of all the work developed throughout last year's initiatives, it reflects upon the value and pertinence of the participatory design process experimented by us in the area of Campanhã in Porto, Portugal, gathering the results and written contributions of many of its participants and coordinators. It also compiles a selection of articles that arose from the call for papers we have launched in the beginning of 2013, under the motto - Who Lives Next Door?

As the closing of a chapter, we believe that it would be of great importance to spread the conclusions and interrogations that came out of last year’s work, reflecting the focus on a practical approach to the city, which we believe to be important to discuss and share with you.


WHO LIVES NEXT DOOR?

The concept

The idea behind this 10th edition was to transpose the bridge from theoretical production to the creation and experimentation of new methods of architectural production, taking as a starting point the area of Corujeira, Campanhã, in the city of Porto, Portugal. Considering proximity and local interaction as key elements for the collective reflection, decision and action, we encouraged and practiced a direct approach to the urban space, based on the cooperation between inhabitants and professionals, taking into consideration the necessities and desires of those who live and adapt to the city’s structure on a daily basis. Architecture, urbanism, design and sociology were, thus, approached and applied as political tools of inclusion and expression, oriented for social transformation.


  The method

Through public opinion points placed in the area of Campanhã, brief conversations with inhabitants and passers-by, activities developed with the schools and social centres, we were able to conduct an extensive survey on the opinions and considerations about Campanhã's public space and its future, information that was then analysed and passed on to the team of coordinators in charge of the work developed in the urban festival RE-ACT Campanhã.

The experience

Dédalo's urban festival RE-ACT Campanhã combined workshops and collective debates. The workshops were coordinated by Todo Por La Praxis (ES) and Pedro Bismarck (PT), Nuno Travasso (PT) and Studio Weave (UK), Bernardo Amaral (PT), Failed Architecture (NL) , Ateliermob (PT) and MakerLab (DE) and Os Espacialistas (PT) and Map-It (BE), who promoted and guided different design approaches to a common urban context, and developed 5 different projects which are, at the moment, being discussed with the city hall for further development.

Dédalo Outdoors

Dédalo’s 10th editorial team was also invited to take part in the Lisbon Architecture Triennale, through two different actions: hosting the The Civic Stage, located in Praça da Figueira, and taking part in the L.Q.F.U.B. Spacecraft, a Friendly Fire (PT) editorial project, to which we contributed with the Happiness is the New Depression manifesto. This experimental 12-steps program will also take part in Dédalo 10, as a limited edition supplement. Dédalo is also taking part in the Archizines world tour, being showcased in Sydney, Melbourne, Chicago, among others, along with other ‘fanzines, journals and magazines from around the world that provide an alternative to the established architectural press.’


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

As a non-profit editorial organization, we are launching our first crowdfunding campaign in order to finance the printing and distribution of Dédalo's 10th edition, designed by the portuguese studio Maan Design! We need to raise, at least, 3000€. 

Your contribution is fundamental! 

All the exceeding profit will be applied in the execution of the projects developed in Campanhã, or passed along to the next editorial team, in charge of Dédalo’s 11th edition. 


Your Perks:

Reader Package  

For just 5€ you get a printed copy of DÉDALO 10 - Who Lives Next Door? - before its public release! Be the first to read it! 


Fan Package  

For 10€, in addition to DÉDALO 10, you get your NAME SHOUTED OUT in the magazine THANK YOU! section.


Friend Package  

For 15€, in addition to DÉDALO 10 and your NAME SHOUTED OUT, you get: 

One of the 50 printed copies of the MANIFESTO that Dédalo produced for the Lisbon Architecture Triennale in 2013; 

+ One of the previous DÉDALO 9 - Place:less.


Lover Package  

For 20€, in addition to DÉDALO 10, DÉDALO 9, our MANIFESTO, and your name listed on our THANK YOU! section, you get:

One of the last 5 super rare and awesome DÉDALO 8 - dis:Place - magazines, released in 2011 and currently travelling around the world with Archizines!


12 Steps Poster

For 20€, you get one of the few printed POSTERs of our 12 STEPS MANIFESTO, sent to you inside one of our original, handmade RE-ACT - OPINION POINTS!

(print size: 42 x 59,4 cm / 16.54 x 23.39 inches)


Illustration Print 

For 20€, you get one printed copy of your favourite ILLUSTRATION in Dédalo 10 sent to you inside one of our original, handmade RE-ACT - OPINION POINTS! (more illustrations coming soon! stay tuned!)

A Constipação  - Jorge Alves

Sem Título  - Frederico Draw

Sr. Balão  - Gil Machado

Sem Título  - Teixeira Barbosa


(print size: 29,7 x 42 cm / 11,4 x 16.54 inches)


Screen Printed Illustration

For 100€, you get one of the 5 super rare SCREEN PRINTS of one of the ILLUSTRATIONs for Dédalo Magazine #10, sent to you inside one of our original, handmade RE-ACT - OPINION POINTS!  (more screen prints coming soon! stay tuned!)

(print size: 42 x 59,4 cm / 16.54 x 23.39 inches)


NOTE: 

Because we set our campaign in €, the contributions must be made via PayPal payment. But, in case you don't have a PayPal account, you can make a bank transfer to the following NIB or IBAN. Just make the transfer, send us an email with the transaction receipt, your name and the shipping address, and we will deposit your contribution in Indiegogo Campaign with reference to your name! 

NIB: 0035 0160 0005 8162 4305 0

IBAN: PT50003501600005816243050

Thank you in advance!

For more information, email us at revista.dedalo@gmail.com.

story:
Greetings, Alfred Howard here. I work at a record store, I write lyrics for 7 bands in San Diego, I build and break my own percussion instruments and I have an abundance of stories. I'm from New Jersey whether I want to be or not and it shaped me into what you have here today. I've been working on this book very gradually since 2006, it holds tales from the road of triumph and woe (mostly the latter), stories of the quirky to full blown crazy people who shop at a record store in the bohemian recesses of ocean beach and song lyrics. I've always struggled with the dualism of my writing, every song I've ever written (aside from a rap song titled "I'm Walking Dogs Mother Fucker") has been dead serious, and all my prose is an amalgamation of dick jokes and incoherent ramblings shouted at the sky. I think this book is the meeting ground between the two. Well, I hope it is, you'll have to read it and tell me, I'm actually nervous as all shit.

What I Need & What You Get

I need money. I've always respected these crowd sourcing campaigns. I finally worked hard enough this year at my minimum wage job that I was able to support a friend of mine's kickstarter campaign, truth is, I owed him money and that may have been an underhanded way of paying him back, but what are you gonna do. My basic intention here is to sell books and gauge if all the folks who claimed to be interested in buying one are actually interested. If I reach my goal, realistically, I'm going to get my remaining wisdom teeth pulled cause that's pricy and I'm going to keep writing because enough friends and family reassured me that my efforts are worth a damn. But this is your spot to pick up a copy of the Autobiography of No One. It's a pretty unique book. It is going to be downloadable because I am part hippie and wasting trees for some dick jokes seems selfish. Though I will physically press a couple. It has a soundtrack, all the bands I perform in were kind enough to contribute some unreleased cuts and some released ones as well. There's also some art and photography. Like any artistic endeavor I have costs to cover to make this a reality and though I work full time, perform full time and hustle with every waking breath, I chose the only two jobs that pay less than can collecting, record store clerk and full time musician. So, help me do this.......  

The Impact

At this point I'm supposed to explain why this project has value to the world. That's a perfectly valid question and though you can't tell, I've been staring into this computer screen for 11 hours trying to answer it. This book and the songs therein are my perspective on the world, as much insight as I can conjure from the thinnest sliver of earth that I inhabit. I've always thought I've had a unique vantage point, I write the lyrics for several very divergent bands, I've logged a lot of miles in america playing dive bars and the occasional classy joint, I met Ed Begley Jr. once, my friend Matt touched Paul Mccartney's hand and I ate three burritos in a day without dying. I'm assuming if you are here, you've heard one of my band's at some point and didn't hate it. If you're the slightest bit curious about my experience behind the songs, this is pretty much every remotely interesting thing that's happened to me since the Clinton Years.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this......Like an std where the symptoms are bliss and winning lottery tickets

story:
There’s a dissonance that often plays out in our collective systems involving science, religion and the rainbow community. I've written this booklet to strike an accord of understanding.

My personal drive in this challenge is enhanced by being born into a long line of entrepreneurs, artists and religious leaders.  As my own being unfolded and came to include ‘gay’, more of the story of my family ancestry quietly revealed itself to show a fabric of unresolved issues with respect to a hidden thread of ‘gay’ qualities in its members.  My need for peace within myself called me to find a place where the creative spirit, religion, faith, evolution and love, came together as one.  I found it in the rainbow connection...

‘Rainbow Connection’ harmonizes the elements by bringing light, faith, evolution and the universe together in a work of few words.  In writing the piece, I noticed myself forming small phrases that were capable of bringing together vast and varied pieces of data into simple and succinct truths.  This approach was my own way of managing the weight of the concepts involved, it helped me produce the work, it became the format for the booklet, and it’s the only way I know of expressing my understanding.  I hope that others find it serves them well, and that it allows the inherent wisdom in the reader to see the concepts from behind their own lens.

Music producer and composer, Robbie Roth, respected in London, New York, LA and Toronto, says of the work: "It's so poetic and beautifully written, with great substance and smarts underneath.  It's clear how directly it comes from the heart, and speaks to something too rarely expressed, but of such obvious weight."

My campaign goal of $2,000. is designed to print a few hundred copies of Rainbow Connection - for me to take with me as I reach out and meet with people to establish streams for sharing.

Whatever happens with the campaign beyond that financial goal becomes welcome fuel for additional activity: the printing of a greater volume of copies at a lower price per unit, the distribution of the book to more circles of influence, and the opportunity to be in touch with a wider array of people in different walks of life and different parts of the world.  We're prepared to meet any challenge!

With respect to ‘perks’, I’ve got these all laid out to be about the book, but with some other cool surprises in the mix.  You'll see in my profile that most of my working life has been about turning people into rock bands for a day, as an immersion in rainbow connection, so I'm happy to custom make a version of this experience to those who are able to contribute enough to make it financially viable.  If you have an idea for a way to help gain broader distribution, or you would like to support the project in some way that is not mentioned in the perks, please send me a note (nmoynan@gmail.com) and let's make things happen!

thanks for checking in with us here ... all the best,

Nancy   :o)

story:
Beat Poet Harold Norse Centennial Celebration

                        


Hello. I'm Todd Swindell, the editor of I Am Going to Fly through Glass: The Selected Poems of Harold Norse. I have organized several international events to celebrate the 100th birthday of Beat poet Harold Norse who was my friend and mentor.

Growing up gay in conservative Orange County in the 1980s, Harold's poetry saved my life. Since his death in 2009, I have worked passionately at preserving Harold's legacy. These poems and books relate his experience as a queer man through the 20th Century. His insight and inspiration will continue to guide a younger generation.

Born in Brooklyn July 6, 1916 to an unwedded, illiterate immigrant mother, Harold's gift for poetry gave him an incredible life of magic and hardship. In the 1940s he lived in Greenwich Village where he was friends with Allen Ginsberg, James Baldwin and Tennessee Williams. In the 1950s, he left America to live abroad for 15 years in Europe and North Africa. In Tangier he took hashish with his Moroccan boyfriend as they traveled the land sleeping on mats. In Paris he lived at the Beat Hotel cutting up words with William Burroughs. When Harold returned to America at the close of the 1960s, he settled in San Francisco where he wrote poems about gay liberation.

You only turn 100 once and I aim to make the most of this milestone. To raise funds, I am organizing an online book sale of Harold's rare, out of print works. Dedicated to his craft, Harold learned to live on simple means. Copies of his books were one thing he could offer to people. It was Harold's wish that his books be used to continue his legacy of poetry which shines light into the darkness of these times.

                  I Would Not Recommend Love
                                                my head felt stabbed
by a crown of thorns but I joked and rode the subway
and ducked into school johns and masturbated
and secretly wrote
                                    of teenage hell
because I was “different”
the first and last of my kind
smothering acute sensations
in swimming pools and locker rooms
addict of lips and genitals
mad for buttocks
                                that Whitman and Lorca
and Catullus and Marlowe
                                          and Michelangelo
and Socrates admired
and I wrote: Friends,
if you wish to survive
I would not recommend
Love
Harold Norse, San Francisco, 1973

Above is a photo of me with Harold at his last poetry reading in 2008.

What You're Funding

  • Travel and expenses to attend the European Beat Studies Network conference in Manchester, England June 27-29: $2,000. I'm presenting two talks about Harold Norse. The EBSN conference is a prime opportunity to network with scholars and students of Beat literature to make them aware of Harold's work. Additionally I'll attend and document numerous presentations with report back about the events at haroldnorse.com and other social media platforms.

  • Following Manchester, I'm organizing three Centennial events in San Francisco at the Mechanics' Institute (July 6), the Beat Museum (July 9) and at Beyond Baroque in Venice Beach (July 23). Each event features panel discussions with Harold's friends and fellow writers. There will also be a performance piece of Harold's poetry by the amazing L.A. artist Jason Jenn who has generously offered to travel north and contribute his talent and passion. Jason's work has included performances on gay writers like Paul Monette, C.P. Cavafy and poet and filmmaker James Broughton, a friend of Harold's. To offset the costs of having the events filmed and Jason's travel expenses, I'm hoping to raise $200.

  • Any remaining funds will continue the promotion of Harold's work including preparation of publishing the next book of Harold's writing: $300. In his archives there are many manuscripts never before published. Your generosity will help Harold's legacy not only continue but expand.

What You Get

  • This is a book sale, so you get to purchase extremely rare, out-of-print works by Harold Norse. The books are in mint condition and have not been previously read. Harold encouraged me to use copies of his books to raise funds to keep his legacy alive. By contributing to my campaign, you'll be helping Harold's dream live on, not only by reading his work but helping others do the same.
  • A number of perks are available for small donations including a set of bookmarks, designed specifically for the Harold Norse Centennial, for $5. A set of 5x7 photos of Harold, along with the bookmarks, is only $10.

  • When you contribute, you get more than just a book. Each Book Bundle comes with a set of Harold Norse Centennial bookmarks, photographs, a memorial collection of poetry by Harold's poet friends as well as rare Norse ephemera. (See the $30 perk for a full description.)


  • All contributions over $30 include a digital download of Harold Norse, Of Course..., a recording of Harold's 1984 poetry reading in Amsterdam. If you only want the recording, it's available for $10.


  • Over the course of the campaign, there will be exclusive Book Bundles of rare Norse publications priced from moderate to deluxe amounts including signed copies. Make sure to check back for updates about the books, video clips and  a new Harold Norse poem.

The Impact

  • Since meeting Harold in 1999, my interest in and understanding of his work has grown. After his death in 2009, I began gathering Harold's archives which are housed at UC Berkeley's Bancroft Library. The volume and significance of the material convinced me that not only was it vital the archives be preserved, but they also must be known. The sale of these Book Bundles in the year of his Centenary is another step in keeping Harold Norse's legacy and work alive in the 21st Century.

                                                    

  • I have no connection to the man who made this video below. It's shared as an example of the impact Harold Norse's poetry can have when people discover his work. This is what he had to say about his evocative video,
"Over the past few years, Harold Norse has become one of my favorite Beat poets, but it wasn't until I received his collected, In the Hub of the Fiery Force, that I knew for sure. The use of subtitles is representative of homosexuals at the time having to be secretive of their love and seek it out of the public eye, or risk damnation. I love the contrast of Norse's sexual honesty with his solemn bit of advice, stating that homosexuals can essentially only exist if they keep the truth hidden, which demonstrates the extreme difficulty of living a lie when we, as humans, are so driven to freely pursue love and sexuality. And even though the world has grown more accepting over time, it still hasn't grown enough."

Risks & Challenges

The events have all been planned and travel arrangements booked. This fundraiser is to recoup the costs, so there's no worry it won't happen. I will post regular updates about new Book Bundle perks with background about the works, along with different poems by Harold. So please check the Updates tab at the top of this page if you've just discovered this campaign.

I'd like to share with you some similar events I have done of which I'm very proud.

  • Following the 2014 publication of my selected edition of Harold's poetry, I organized numerous public readings throughout the Northern Bay Area at bookstores and arts centers.

                    


  • Last year I co-presented a talk about Harold at the Beat Museum's Conference in San Francisco and my detailed report back was posted at haroldnorse.com. Additionally I videotaped numerous presentations including a talk with Allen Ginsberg's psychiatrist from the 1950s who helped Ginsberg come out as as a gay man.

                                 

  • Please keep in mind that, in order to keep your costs low, all books will ship USPS Media Mail.

             

Other Ways You Can Help

Read poetry! Write Poetry! Learn more about Harold Norse! 

Here's a video of Harold Norse reading his poem "In The Hub of The Fiery Force" from a reading at the Beat Museum on July 15, 2007.

If you have ordered digital detox cards, they have all been sent to you, and should be with you before the beginning of December.

Finally, our 'digital detox' course is starting on the 1 January, and you will receive an invitation to it by email.

The e-version of the book should (hopefully) be ready by March, and the print one - by April. I will keep you posted.

Thanks everyone!

How many times per day do you check your phone? How about Facebook likes? Or time spent on emails? If you often feel you don't have time or energy to do things you'd have loved to, here's where it goes — on managing your tech.

We became slaves to our devices without realizing it. Instead of using them as helpful tools, we ended up mindlessly checking for updates and new likes every few minutes, and yet are always worried that we are missing out on something.  Research shows that because of being "always on", we sleep worse, are able to concentrate less; work more, but are less productive as we are constantly distracted, and don't feel as close to our friends. 

Is this really the best way we could use technology? Should we really be worried when we don't look at our smartphones for 5 minutes? Or did something go very wrong?

 

It's all engineered behaviour. Big tech companies want you to stay online as much as they can keep your attention, because this is how they make money. At the cost of your life. The biggest problem is, most of us don't realize it, up until we try to change something. I myself worked in technology and realized how much time I wasted on managing devices and how unnecessarily dependent I became on my smartphone only when I tried getting rid of it. 

Homo Distractus is a practical and scientifically-backed book about how technology is taking away our choices, freedom and identities without us realizing it, and how we can fight it, by putting tech back to the place where it belongs. The place of a tool, not a master of our lives.

In this book, you will find answers to the following questions:

  • How can I stop being afraid of missing out?
  • How much technology is too much?
  • How can I stay more focused and productive, and stop forgetting what I have just read?
  • How can I unplug, but at the same time not lose the connection with my social circle?
  • How can I balance the use of technology in my life?
  • How can I sleep better and feel more energetic?
  • Should I give devices to my kids, and how do I get them off the iPad?

Homo Distractus shows you both a practical and science-backed way to live a more meaningful and fulfilled life without giving up tech altogether. Thanks to better managing your relationships with your devices, you will have more time and energy to do things that matter to you, and form better and deeper relationships with people around you.

As seen in: 

 

What People Say

Why I wrote this book

Hi, I am Anastasia, Homo Distractus author. I used to work in the heart of digital industry in London in a director position, managing multi-million budgets for big tech clients. As an international digital marketer, my job was to convince people to use more technology on behalf of famous tech brands. I learned a lot about how tech can hook your attention, and how to make you click on yet another cat video and keep you online for longer.

 

 

I got disappointed in how the tech industry manipulates people’s attention instead of helping them accomplish what they came for. I also saw how over-reliance on tech doesn’t make people happy. I worked in an environment, where people hardly spoke to each other in person even when they set next to each other, and were burning out by being “always on”. I myself felt constantly overwhelmed, too.

So three years ago I gave up my career together with my smartphone, in an experiment to find a more balanced lifestyle. This eventually led me to launching my business, Consciously Digital, doing a TEDx talk and speaking at global conferences on tech life balance, blogging for Huffington Post, and writing this book.

In Homo Distractus, I share with you marketing and design insights from tech industry that hook your brain on your devices; explain what the latest neuroscience research says about the impact of tech on how you think and act, and show case studies of real people managing their tech. The book has 30 daily challenges, which you can try for the whole month, to have a more meaningful and fulfilled life without giving up tech altogether.

It's not a digital detox or a self-help book. It's the book about how to remain human in the increasingly digital age.

 

What We Need

 

The book draft is ready. All it needs now is a good editor and layout designer both for digital and print version. It takes at least a year to go through traditional publishing, and tech is changing so fast that we don't have this time. I want you to read this book as soon as possible, this is why I'm crowdfunding.

We need at least £5,000 to pay for these services, plus the Indiegogo platform fees (5% of the total amount raised, and extra 3% process payment fees).

 

What You Get

In exchange for your valuable support, you will get some of the following exciting perks:

We know that you'd like to get your perks as soon as possible, this is why we have introduced a special limited edition Christmas perk: a set of digital detox cards delivered to you before this Christmas!

More about the book

The book is written in a way that covers all aspects of our lives:

 

Risks & Challenges

I aim to get this book ready by March 2018, but there might be some delays either due to editing process, as well as printing. However, I will do my best to make sure that everything is ready as soon as possible.

Amazing team

Anna Radchenko created this mindblowing picture for the book cover, Chris Bolin did the most innovative website homodistractus.com, the first website that works offline, in support of this campaign, and Deniz Husnu and Berkan Ozgur filmed and patiently edited our super cool video.

Do you resonate with our message?

Then you can help, too!

Talk to your mates, use social media and Indiegogo share tools (our Twitter hashtag is #homodistractus). Know anyone who runs a popular blog or podcast and might be interested in interviewing us? Or perhaps you could mention this project to your HR or your boss, and they may want to get our workshop perk?

Anything you can think of that will help let more people know about this issue will help a lot!

Because ultimately, it's the choices that we make every day that make us human and different from computers.

Book Introduction

 

THE ARCHITECT OF LOVE

Your Road To Happiness Starts Here

 

Are you looking for the one person who you feel will make your life complete? Well, I’m happy to say that this is a dream that can come true, and I’ve written a book to help you achieve it. The secrets that I reveal in my book are not rocket science, they don’t require a Ph.D. to put into action – what I’m going to tell you is more about common-sense, about applying yourself to the task with confidence and a clear vision of exactly what it is that you want.

 

You are the architect of your own love life, and within the pages of my book, you will learn how to design and build the perfect relationship. There’s actually no magic formula that you can apply: instead, I’m going to ask you do a bit of honest self-assessment and soul-searching, so that you can learn how to trust in yourself – your gut instinct – about what it is that makes you happy. Believe me when I say that you already have within you, all the tools you’ll ever need to succeed. In just a few short chapters, you will be equipped with your new-found knowledge, and you can go out and discover a whole new world of possibilities.

 

I chose the analogy of becoming an ‘architect of love’ because it’s a solid, concrete (pun intended) way to visualise your future. The concept of love is rather abstract, and having a clear metaphor of a house gives you an easy way to understand what you need to do to allow love to enter your life. In the same way that a house can’t be built overnight, but requires careful planning and preparation concerning the structure, the layout, and the setting, so too do you need to examine your soul, your personality, your preferences and needs, in order to give you the best chance of success.

 

I invite you to imagine building the home that you’ve always wanted and then use that as a metaphorical template for the relationship you’ve always wanted. In its most basic sense, this means, for example, reflecting on how the need for good foundations in a house are essential in a relationship too. By the end of the book, you will have envisaged your perfect home, from the foundations to location, and by doing this, you’ll be primed and ready for love.

 

So, what makes me the right person to write this book? Although my experience as a life coach has taught me a great deal about relationships, and my training as a Master Practitioner in Neuro-Linguistic Programming has equipped me with the skills to teach communication and visualisation, my main inspiration has been my own life. I’ve had my own fair share of heartache (which I go into more fully in the book) before meeting Anders, the love of my life and my soulmate. My own life lessons and what I have learnt from my coaching form the basis of the book.

 

My mission is to spread more love and kindness in this world. I want to see more people happy within themselves and sharing their happiness with the people around them. What I want to achieve I know cannot be done by just little old me. I need you to help me. Join me in the best adventure of your life!

 

Ar’nie Rozah Krogh – February 2017

P.S Help me in my effort to self-publish my first book. The blueprints of which that has inspired me to find my own dream partner 18 years ago. I don't want to hide the 'secrets', I just want to share it!

UPDATE: We have hit our goal! Thank you! 

ANY ADDITIONAL CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO DIRECTLY TO MANUFACTURING OUR NEXT MAJOR TITLE... Hint: Its the Kitáb-i-Iqán! (which we just finished editing)


Who Are We?

HearTheWritings.com is a Baha'i inspired endeavor to create incredibly high quality audio books of the Sacred, Historical and Secondary texts of the Baha'i Faith. Together with our cast of amazing narrators we work to make audio books that can transform your daily routines into time to immerse yourselves into the writings.

What We Have Created?

Building on the successes of our previous audio books by Shoghi Effendi and The Universal House of Justice we set out to achieve our primary goal of converting the Sacred texts. So over the last year+ we have spent an incredible amount of energy and resources to produce an amazing audio book version of Tablets of Baha'u'lláh.  This work is considered to be one of the most weighty of Baha'u'lláh's revelation. Abdu'l-Baha had this to say regarding this incredible work:

“Direct thine attention to the holy Tablets; read thou the Ishráqát, Tajallíyyát, the Words of Paradise, the Glad Tidings, the Tarazát, the Most Holy Book. Then wilt thou see that today these heavenly Teachings are the remedy for a sick and suffering world, and a healing balm for the sores on the body of mankind. They are the spirit of life, the ark of salvation, the magnet to draw down eternal glory, the dynamic power to motivate the inner self of man. ”

Our experience creating, releasing, and marketing audio books for the Baha'i world has gotten us to this point.. and now we are ready to launch our first major title by Baha'u'lláh...  almost....

Why We Need Your Help:

The audio book production, editing and mastering is complete. The artwork and music is finished. The audio book is nearly 8 hours long and sounds glorious. Each audio book will be 7 CDs long! Now we just need your help to replicate the audio book CD sets. Help us take our final step:

  • We need to raise $4500 to cover replication and shipping costs from our manufacturer.
  • If we REACH our funding goal we will send off the masters to the manufacturer ASAP and have audio books in hand within a month! Yay!!!
  • If we SURPASS our funding goal the money you contribute will be rolled into printing our next audio book title(s). (Up-Next: Kitab-i-Iqan!.. and we have 3 more in production right now!)
  • If we DON'T reach our funding goal we will have to reassess how we can get the remaining funds or find an alternate method to manufacture the CD sets at a price people can afford without compromising quality... but they will be manufactured!

The Impact:

We are creating something beautiful and profound for so many friends around the world. Tablets of Bah'u'lláh is the first of five major titles we have been working on and the others are coming hot on the heels of this one. With your help we can create these physical copies of the audio book which help us reach more Baha'is and seekers around the world with the Sacred Word than ever before:

  • Physical CDs are a must for many developing communities around the world who don't have access to MP3 Players
  • Physical CDs are still the format of choice for most car stereos
  • Physical CDs are required so we can approach the various Baha'i distribution services around the world and have them help us get Tablets of Baha'u'lláh into the hands of more people than ever before.

Risks:

Since the production process and artwork is complete our only risks are not achieving our funding goal... in which case we will have to reassess how we can get the remaining funds and/or still manufacture the CD sets at a price people can afford without compromising quality.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Your contribution means a lot to us... but your support in sharing this with friends family and community means even more! The more people who see that we are creating such high quality audio books and step in to support us the more audio books we can make... and the more often we can release them. Here are some simple things you can do to help us get the word out:

  • Click the share buttons on this page and post it to your Facebook or Twitter accounts. 
  • Share the page multiple times... every time you share it an angel gets their wings!
  • Email the link to this page to your friends, family and community members... if they love the writings they will be thrilled to know about HearTheWritings.com.
  • Stop by our site and sign up for our email list so we can keep in touch. ( http://hearthewritings.com )
  • Comment on our blog posts or vote to help us decide which books to record next!

And that's all there is to it!

We appreciate your support and look forward to creating and releasing a flood of titles which will inspire your heart and draw you closer to Bahá'u'lláh.

Thrive in Brief: A Special Message from Arianna Huffington...



A Be A Part Of The Movement - Make Your Contribution and Get Your Bonuses Today...



Be a part of the movement and get your copy today. Here's what you should know.  Of course, you can pick up a copy of THRIVE on Amazon for a few bucks less. But if you want to be a part of the THRIVE Movement to REDEFINE Success, then get your copy here along with a collection of incredible, unique BONUSES (that Amazon can never offer!). 

This chart shows the value you'll receive at each level of contribution. For full details of each bonus, please refer to the chart above...

THRIVE in Brief

In Thrive, Arianna Huffington makes an impassioned and compelling case that we must redefine what it means to be successful.

In this deeply personal book, Arianna shares how a painful wake-up call taught her that while she might have been considered "successful" by our society’s misguided "money and power" definition, she was not living a successful life by any truly healthy, productive — and sane – definition of success.

She talks candidly about her own challenges with managing time and prioritizing the demands of a career and raising two daughters — of juggling business deadlines and family crises, a harried dance that led to her collapse and to her "aha moment."

Drawing on the latest groundbreaking research and scientific findings in the fields of psychology, sports, sleep, and physiology that show the profound and transformative effects of meditation, mindfulness, unplugging, and giving, Arianna shows us the way to a revolution in our culture, your thinking, your workplace, and your life.

In THRIVE You Will...

  • Learn to live with the feeling of total abundance.
  • Uncover the "Third Metric" of success, and rise way above mere money and power.
  • Refine your own definition of success - for a far healthier, happier, more fulfilling life.
  • Discover the joy of a much more relaxed, yet much more productive, life.
  • Learn principles for you and your team to boost productivity and lower health care costs.
  • See how small and easy changes can make a huge difference.
  • Free yourself from the false ‘badges of honor’ of overwork, burnout, lack of sleep.
  • How to sleep your way to the top!


"Anyone who reads this and takes it seriously or even semi-seriously
is going to get tremendous benefit" 

~ Joe Polish

Help spread the word! 

Watch the short video.  Then, make your contribution to drive the movement and receive your awesome perks, and the opportunity to win even more BONUSES!  But hurry, these bonuses​ won't last forever... 


THRIVE on the Ellen Show




Extended THRIVE Interview: Arianna Huffington with Joe Polish




Your Invitation to An Exclusive Closed-Door Event with Arianna


Feedback and REVIEWS 

About Arianna

Arianna Huffington is the chair, president, and editor-in-chief of the Huffington Post Media Group, a nationally syndicated columnist, and author of fourteen books.

In May 2005, she launched The Huffington Post, a news and blog site that quickly became one of the most widely-read, linked to, and frequently-cited media brands on the Internet. In 2012, the site won a Pulitzer Prize for national reporting. In 2013, she was named to the Forbes Most Powerful Women list. In 2006, and again in 2011, she was named to the Time 100,Time Magazine's list of the world’s 100 most influential people.

Originally from Greece, she moved to England when she was 16 and graduated from Cambridge University with an M.A. in economics. At 21, she became president of the famed debating society, the Cambridge Union. She serves on several boards, including EL PAÍS, PRISA, the Center for Public Integrity, and the Committee to Protect Journalists.

Her 14th book, Thrive: The Third Metric to Redefining Success and Creating a Life of Well-Being, Wisdom, and Wonder is published by Crown, available March 25, 2014.

You bet. If you want the cheapest way to get Thrive its here on Amazon.

The money goes entirely to fulfill the perks we’re offering here. This isn’t a for-profit campaign, in fact the costs will likely significantly exceed the contributions - we just love THRIVE and want to spread the message far and wide!

You'll receive information to confirm your registration and seat for any LIVE event.  Note** The attendance at an event does not include airfare or hotel accommodations. Attendance does cover your ticket or seat at the event.

chart shows the value you'll receive at each level of contribution. For full

In Thrive,
Arianna Huffington makes an impassioned and compelling case that we must
redefine what it means to be successful.In this deeply personal book, Arianna shares how a painful wake-up call
taught her that while she might have been considered "successful" by
our society’s misguided "money and power" definition, she was not
living a successful life by any truly healthy, productive — and sane – definition
of success.
She talks candidly about her own challenges with managing time and prioritizing
the demands of a career and raising two daughters — of juggling business
deadlines and family crises, a harried dance that led to her collapse and to
her "aha moment."
Drawing on the latest groundbreaking research and scientific findings in the
fields of psychology, sports, sleep, and physiology that show the profound and
transformative effects of meditation, mindfulness, unplugging, and giving,
Arianna shows us the way to a revolution in our culture, your thinking, your
workplace, and your life.In THRIVE You Will...




Learn to live with the feeling of total abundance.


Uncover the "Third Metric" of success, and rise way above mere money and power.


Refine your own definition of success - for a far healthier, happier, more fulfilling life.


Discover the joy of a much more relaxed, yet much more productive, life.


Learn principles for you and your team to boost productivity and lower health care costs.


See how small and easy changes can make a huge difference.


Free yourself from the false ‘badges of honor’ of overwork, burnout, lack of sleep.


How to sleep your way to the top!



"Anyone who reads this and takes it seriously or even semi-seriouslyis going to get tremendous benefit" ~ Joe Polish

story:
Support our team of seasoned field workers to bring out the real-life stories and tales of aid workers.  Did you ever wonder.............What is it really like to deliver aid in a war zone?  What is really like to live and work in some of the poorest, most remote areas of the world?  What is really like to fight deadly epidemics like Ebola and even the most diseases that claim millions of lives--often without modern equipment or communications?  What does living and working in these environments do to one's personal life? 

Aid Worker Stories is gathering the real-life experiences, told by the people who lived them, to compile into a book.  The book will contain short anecdotes of the real life experiences of development and aid workers around the world. It intends to be funny, witty, and reveal the real life--both good and bad--of development work around the world.  The field of international development is often portrayed as purely charitable, honorable and altruistic, and aid workers are themselves often portrayed as incredibly brave, competent angels.  We all know the reality doesn't always live up to the myth. We are seeking stories that show the hilarious, ridiculous, crazy, and often unheard of side of development work from development workers themselves.

We have come up with 12 categories that illustrate the human nature of development work. These include:

1.  Development project failures and unforeseen consequences of our work

2.  Love and relationships on the job

3.  Dealing with local officials

4.  Dealing with donors and international actors

5.  Working and living with host communities

6.  Dealing with co-workers, partner staff, and others

7.  Hotels, accommodations, and living conditions on project sites

8.  Traveling (by air, road, train, horse, donkey, or other) to project sites

9.  Visitors (HQ staff, celebrities, and others)

10.  Your medical problems and seeking medical care abroad

11.  Managing cross-cultural expectations of ethnicity, race, sexual orientation, religion

12.  Managing life and relationships at home

13.  Weekends, passing time, managing boredom

Our editorial team is comprised of three aid workers who, among them, have served in nearly every country in the developing and have a combined 50 years experience of working in this career.

Our campaign is requesting crowd-funding support from the public to help us to bring these stories into the form of a book and share them with the world.  There are thousands upon thousands who are longing to hear these tales:  other aid workers, students looking to join this career, those who have lived abroad, those who donate to development work around the world, and those who are interested to know the hidden side of life of these people who leave their countries and go to serve abroad.

We intend to use the funds from the crowd-funding campaign to self-publish this book and make it available to the public.

  Campaign request:

  $3000  Layout and design for self-publishing.

  $1000  Copy-editing and manuscript preparation

  $2000  Promotion and dissemination of the book

  If our campaign exceeds its goal, we will use the proceeds       to film and share video based postcards of aid worker     stories.

Offers:

Donations between $10 and $25  Will receive a free copy of the book (digital     version)

Donations between $26 and $100  Will receive an autographed manuscript

Donations over $101  Will receive a special mention in the book's     acknowledgements as well as an autographed   manuscript

story:
Here in the Yorkshire & Humber region we would like to give every voter the opportunity to vote for a Green Party MP. In order for us to stand candidates we need to raise a deposit1 of £500 for each one. As you can imagine, with 54 parliamentary seats in our region alone, this is quite a substantial sum for our party to raise.

You may be aware that the larger parties often take large donations from big business interests, but the Green Party are not funded in that way. Our campaigns are powered by party members and supporters like you.

Please help us support your local parliamentary candidate by giving what you can. With donations starting at just £1 we hope everyone can get involved. Please note: if you decide to donate more than £50 we will need to take some additional details2 from you before we can accept your kind offer of support.

Should we fail to raise the required £500 deposit for this constituency we would try to transfer funds from better funded areas. This will be a reciprocal arrangement so if this campaign is over funded our team will try to support as may other local candidates as possible. After funding deposits across the region, any remaining funds will be returned to the originating constituency, to support their campaigning efforts.

If you feel you are not able to contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and family, sharing our page (www.yorkshiregreen2015.com) on social media and following the campaign on Facebook and Twitter (links below) to stay up to date with progress. You can also volunteer to help the Green Party campaign by signing up here http://greenparty.org.uk/getinvolved/

Finally, of course, don’t forget that your vote counts on May 7th!

Many thanks for your helping in turning Yorkshire and Humber Green in 2015.

1Candidate deposits have been required since the 1985 general election

2For donations over £50 we are legally obligated to take a record of the donor's name and address and to also confirm the donor is on the UK electoral register.

Promoted by Bluebell Eikonoklastes on behalf of the Yorkshire and the Humber Region Green Party Parliamentary election candidate list both at Flat B, 77 Grange Avenue, Chapeltown, LEEDS, LS7 4EN.

story:
Hi,
Eric Gladstone here. If you are reading this, you might remember my name from my writing about a lot of Alternative Rock and Indie artists throughout the '90s, for magazines and sites including Alternative Press, Spin, Rolling Stone, RayGun, Grand Royal, HotWired, MTV Online, AOL, High TImes and a lot more.

Almost all of this writing, while widely seen at the time, has never been reprinted. Although the classic rock eras have been documented so many times over, the 90s, despite producing great music, still remains largely undocumented in a permanent way. So, the idea here is to collect some of the most interesting stories I wrote--about artists like the Smashing Pumpkins, Beastie Boys, Henry Rollins, Beck, Pavement, Sonic Youth, PJ Harvey, Jon Spencer Blues Explosion (the list goes on)--as well as some amazing photography by Marina Chavez.

PLEASE CHECK OUT THE VIDEO (LINK BELOW) FOR A MORE -AHEM- ENTERTAINING PITCH AND DETAILS...

This book is not just about reprinting my writing, but hopefully inspiring others to document probably the last great era of Rock music.
I've set the goal at a number I think is a reasonable estimate of what it will cost Marina and I to collect the materials necessary and afford good design production to assemble the book, as well as some funds for marketing and other typical  expenses. Once funding is in place we expect to release the book within 6 months at the latest.
I understand that everyone reading this may have different levels of ability or interest in contributing, which is why we've set up several reward categories (hopefully not too many will take me up on the offer to decide what goes in and what doesn't...although that would make it even more unique as a book)

But even if you aren't sure about contributing, it would be amazing if you hit the share buttons for Facebook, Twitter or anywhere else. With any luck, I can inspire some of my many creative friends to launch similar projects I can support!
Thanks--now and always
E
