So, the idea here is to collect some of the most interesting stories I wrote--about artists like the Smashing Pumpkins, Beastie Boys, Henry Rollins, Beck, Pavement, Sonic Youth, PJ Harvey, Jon Spencer Blues Explosion (the list goes on)--as well as some amazing photography by Marina Chavez. PLEASE CHECK OUT THE VIDEO (LINK BELOW) FOR A MORE -AHEM- ENTERTAINING PITCH AND DETAILS...This book is not just about reprinting my writing, but hopefully inspiring others to document probably the last great era of Rock music. 
 I've set the goal at a number I think is a reasonable estimate of what it will cost Marina and I to collect the materials necessary and afford good design production to assemble the book, as well as some funds for marketing and other typical  expenses. Once funding is in place we expect to release the book within 6 months at the latest.
 I understand that everyone reading this may have different levels of ability or interest in contributing, which is why we've set up several reward categories (hopefully not too many will take me up on the offer to decide what goes in and what doesn't...although that would make it even more unique as a book)But even if you aren't sure about contributing, it would be amazing if you hit the share buttons for Facebook, Twitter or anywhere else. With any luck, I can inspire some of my many creative friends to launch similar projects I can support!Thanks--now and alwaysE

story:
Join me as I spend six months based in Dakar, Senegal, launching the Fourth World Initiative--an interdisciplinary human rights think tank with a progressive pan-African approach!

 

The Who

I’m a 27 year old attorney who applied to law school in 2005 with the goal of becoming a human rights advocate and a professor. Law school was a confusing experience for me, however, as I found myself without many mentors or any guidance about how to pursue a career in human rights advocacy or academia.  Uninspired after completing my studies in 2009, I joined a large corporate law firm, where I spent two years wishing that I were living out my dreams instead. I am now establishing the Fourth World Initiative (FWI) in order to provide other pan-African oriented and human rights-focused scholars, advocates and artists like myself with the intellectual and professional space and support that is so often unavailable to people from historically underrepresented backgrounds. This winter, I will travel to Dakar, Senegal in order to launch FWI and carry out its inaugural research project. 

 

The What

I have been invited to work with major Senegalese radio and television outlets in a study, entitled Bene Jigeen (Wolof for "one woman") of emerging feminist discourse concerning polygamy and other traditional gender-based customs, which is taking place in mass and social media, against the backdrop of the passage of a Gender Parity law in Senegal and the appointment of 64 women to the nation’s National Assembly. 

In particular, I will focus on 1) emerging feminist resistance to traditional gender expectations and gender-based practices, 2) the conflicts presented by the simultaneous adoption of these practices by Western women and 3) the impact upon mass and social media upon feminist African discourse and rights-positive legal developments. I will present my work in the form of scholarly research papers, with aspirations toward a short documentary film.
 
 
Additionally, I have been invited to present guest lectures on the impact of representations of women in film upon human rights at the National Film and Television Institute in Accra, Ghana. I also hope to conduct short-term research in Burkina Faso and Cote d'Ivoire. This research project will take place from January through mid-June, 2013. 
 
 
I will be carrying out this project as an affiliated scholar of the West African Research Association (WARA).

 

The Why

Bene Jigeen is the first installation of the Fourth Wave Project--FWI's flagship women's right research initiative. While I am only seeking funding for this particular research series, it is the Fourth World Initiative's first research project, and will effectively launch the work of FWI. Successful completion of this research project will provide a strong foundation for other FWI projects. 

This project is important to me personally and professionally, but I am wholly committed to it because of its potential to: 1) open doors for others who have encountered the same professional obstacles I've faced; and 2) to encourage greater human rights awareness and engagement among African-Americans, who continue to wallow in socioeconomic inequality and suffer the cold, blunt impact of racism in a so-called postracial America with little awareness of economic, social and political progress taking place elsewhere in the world. In particular, I am keenly aware that the realization by women of their human rights is key to socioeconomic and political development in any community. The immediate goal of the Fourth Wave project is to literally advance a fourth wave feminist movement which encourages men and women in the pan-African world to advance women's rights on their own terms, realizing that the empowerment of women and girls is a proven catalyst for socioeconomic development in any society.  By supporting the establishment of FWI and its scholarship, you are making a valuable investment in our communities' intellectual, philosophical and cultural advancement.  

 

The How

I am incredibly excited about this project, but none of these opportunities are funded! Therefore, I'm dependent upon your generous support to make this research project possible. Specifically, I am hoping to raise enough to support: 1) six months' worth of basic living and research expenses (approximately $11,000 total) and 2) the estimated cost of fully launching FWI, incorporating it, and applying for 501c3 status ($1,500-2,000).

I have set the funding goal below the actual budget because I want to have a chance at attaining that goal (to avoid a penalty from Indiegogo), and also because I want to emphasize that every little bit helps--even towards a more abbreviated stay abroad. Plus, there are perks! Your donations are warmly accepted, and donors will be kept abreast of the project's progress, warmly acknowledged and given various tokens of appreciation, as described below. 

 

The YOU

Maybe you can't contribute financially--we get you! But that doesn't mean you can't help!

Get the word out! Let the world know about the Fourth Wave Project and encourage them to offer financial support. Link to this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and any other convenient social medium! Tell your friends! Tell everyone!

Most importantly, if you would like to get involved with FWI's work, please contact us at fourthworldinitiative@gmail.com and visit us at www.fourthworldinitiative.org. We are looking for papers, bloggers, scholarly and artistic work, and interns!

 

For more detailed information, please consult the Strategic Proposal, located under "files" in the Gallery section.

story:
From ArtsNash Co-Founders John Pitcher and Evans Donnell

Dear Readers,

At ArtsNash we certainly strive to inform, but we also want to educate. It’s our hope that arts lovers will continue to read about the groups and artists they love from a new generation of writers. And our nonprofit organization needs your help to do that.

Giving at this Indiegogo page will provide more training and publication opportunities for emerging writers like Vanderbilt University student Kelby Carlson. Kelby has written several music articles for us already, including a review of the Nashville Symphony’s 2012-13 season-opening concert in September. Kelby, by the way, attended that gala concert with his seeing-eye dog Elvis. Since Kelby cannot see, he was unable to take notes during the performance of Mahler’s mighty “Symphony of a Thousand.” Nevertheless, he remembered every detail and wrote a beautiful review that ran the next morning. We couldn’t be more proud of him.

Others have joined our intern program, including college students Quinton Parker, Katie Mills and Maranda Orrell. And we want to continue with them and others not just during the fall and spring semesters but into summers as well. That costs money in terms of time and resources from ArtsNash staffers, though, and we’d also like to offer stipends to these developing journalists/authors, so that’s why we’re asking for your donations now.

We’re honored to have a monetary donation of any size, and you’ll be a “Vice President of Promotion” – with the certificate to prove it – for ArtsNash when you give at least $5. Everyone who contributes that or more will also be listed on our website.

Want to give more? For at least $50 we’ll send you a coffee mug emblazoned with our distinctive logo or an ArtsNash T-Shirt (we have up to size XX Large) if you so choose; for $100 or more you can accompany one of our reviewers to a show or concert listed on this page – check back during the campaign because we may add more – for free if you decide that’s what you want to do (first come, first served – when someone has picked a particular event we’ll note on this page that it’s no longer available; limit one per donation). Yes, you can give those amounts or more without picking an incentive, but we want to offer them since we greatly appreciate your faith in us.

When you give, you’re not just helping develop young arts writers – you’re helping to expand the coverage of the exciting and eclectic Nashville arts scene we all love. We are all partners in this endeavor because the arts do more than entertain, as worthy as that is; today’s arts fire the imagination that fuels society’s progress tomorrow. Please help by donating today.

Thank you,

John and Evans

PS If you have any questions about our educational efforts, please write us at education@artsnash.com.

“Go with the Critic” For $100 or More Donations List (first come, first served; one per donation; subject to change)

Thursday, March 28

Giancarlo Guerrero leads the Nashville Symphony in Wagner/Maazel’s “Ring Without Words” and Ravel’s “Concerto for the Left Hand” (with pianist Louis Lortie).

Wednesday, April 10

The Final Dress/Preview of Nashville Opera’s production of Mozart’s The Magic Flute at TPAC’s Jackson Hall.

Friday, April 19

Boiler Room Theatre presents the acclaimed Floyd Collins musical at its historic site in Franklin.

Saturday, April 20

Tennessee Repertory Theatre presents the regional premiere of David Auburn’s The Columnist at TPAC’s Johnson Theater.

story:
A Little Bit of Information

A life-long love of reading turned me (Allison Merritt) into an indie author who writes historical, paranormal and fantasy romances, often combining the sub-genres. I live in a small town in the Ozark Mountains with my husband and dogs. When I'm not making character miserable or reading, I hike in national parks and conservation areas.

I graduated from College of the Ozarks in Point Lookout, Missouri with a B.A. in mass communications that's gathering dust after it was determined that I'm better at writing fluff than hard news.

I serve as the newsletter editor during the 2012-2013 year for Ozarks Romance Authors in Springfield, Missouri and have been a member since 2009. I blog 2-3 times a week and stay active on social networks trying to support and help my fellow authors.

My goal is to get to Kansas City for ths year's Romantic Times convention May 1-5. Because of where I'm from a rural part of Missouri, there aren't a lot of opportunities to get to conventions. This would be a dream come true so I could help spread the word about my writing and network with other writers.

Next year it's a lot farther away and I hate to miss an opportunity for something so great.

What I Need & What You Get

The registration fee for a published author is $474. In addition to the registration fee, I need money for a place to stay, gas, and a hot meal or two--fuel for the author's soul.

If you help support me here's what you'll get:

* A personalized 'Thank You' on my blog.

* A personalized 'Thank You' card in the mail.

* A free e-copies of The Treasure Hunter's Lady, The Sky Pirate's Wife, and The Turncoat's Temptress.

* Special autographed artwork from all three books.

* Mention on the Dedication page of the next book.

If I don't reach my goal of $1000, that's okay. I'll donate half the funds to the Ozarks Literacy Council and use the other half for advertising/upgrading my computer system.

The Impact

I've been writing since I was young, but I had a five year gap of severe writer's block after my dad died in 2003. In 2008, I finally came up with an idea that got me back on track. I joined a writer's group, a couple of online groups, dedicated myself to learning and applying what I know.

There are certain items on the RT agenda I would love to attend to help my knowledge grow including classes on craft, genre, marketing, publishing, and some specialty things like the talks about steampunk and fantasy books.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, but you'd like to help me reach my goal, please spread the word. Every click and reshare helps.

story:
Rich in talent, color, flavor and history, New England is home to some of our most popular authors, as well as the setting and inspiration for some of our most beloved, compelling and controversial books—from Junger’s The Perfect Storm to Picoult’s Perfect Match, Alcott’s Little Women to Perrotta’s Little Children, and so many, MANY more.

Funds raised in this campaign will help the Literary New England Radio Show continue to air ad free.Funds will also be used to complete the Literary New England Travel Guide. Please scroll down for details on both of these unique and exciting products!

Amazing, once-in-a-lifetime literary experiences are among the perks for giving, including the chance to have lunch and brunch with some of today's most popular and New York Times best-selling authors, and books personally inscribed by the author to you!

Please check back often for UNIQUE NEW PERKS to be added throughout the campaign!

 

Who's behind all this?

Both the radio show and travel guide are the creations of award-winning journalist Cindy Wolfe Boynton, a long-time freelancer for The New York Times, Boston Globe and other publications. A lifelong New Englander and Connecticut resident, Cindy is also a playwright, award-winning poet and former editor of Better Health magazine, as well as an adjunct college English and journalism professor.

As Literary New England Radio Show listeners hear each week, Cindy is a huge reader who passionately believes in the transformative power that books and stories can have on reader and writer alike—and loves to share the interviews, information and stories she gathers with others!

 

About the Literary New England Radio Show

Founded in December 2011, the Literary New England Radio Show airs on Mondays at 8 p.m. on BlogTalk Radio, featuring author interviews, book giveaways, event spots and celebrations of all things literary New England. Listenership has skyrocketed from six listeners to our very first episode, to as many as 10,000 per episode now— and we're consistently growing! Equally exciting is these listeners' diverse geographic locations, which include not just New England and throughout the U.S., but Japan, the United Kingdom and other countries.

The show features both established and emerging authors and writers. Guests have includedMargaret Atwood, Joe McGinniss, Richard Russo, Jodi Picoult, Jenna Blum, Tara Conklin, Aria Beth Sloss, Will Schwalbe, Sebastian Junger, Amy Brill, Nathaniel Philbrick, Alice Hoffman, Owen King, Nathaniel Hawthorne’s great-great-granddaughter Alison Hawthorne Deming, Anita Diamant, Alan Lightman, Geraldine Brooks and more. All past guests and episodes can be heard in the Literary New England Radio Show archives.

Enhancing the show is the Literary New England website, which in addition to keeping listeners updated on upcoming episodes provides audio extras (such as authors reading excerpts of their works) and photos and listings of visitable literary New England sites. Twice a month, Cindy and @LitNewEngland also host Twitter Q&As with authors. Please visit Literary New England for details.

Funding from this campaign will, among other things, allow the show to produce more on-site spots at bookstores and cover more author events, such as we did when Joyce Carol Oates spoke at RJ Julia in Madison, CT, in March.

 

About the Literary New England Travel Guide

Scheduled for release in September 2013, this unique travel guide will take actual and armchair travelers to more than 500 New England locations featured in contemporary and classic books and related to popular authors, as well as provide a list of the best NE bookstores, book fests, writing workshops, retreats, and more! Visit Literary New England for details and a small sampling.

Produced in both print and e-form, the guide will also include maps, suggested itineraries and author interviews. One of the best parts: The guide's September release will make it available right in time for the holidays!

 

Other ways you can help

This is Cindy Wolfe Boynton, and I'd like to end by saying that we involved with Literary New England would be most grateful for any and all support—even if it's just help spreading the word about what we do! Please tell friends, family and everyone you know about the weekly Literary New England Radio Show, as well as the fall 2013 release of the Literary New England Travel Guide.

Responses to both the radio show and travel guide have so far been amazing, exceeding all our expectations. Our pledge is that if you support this campaign, we'll do everything possible to make sure Literary New England exceeds your expectations, too.

Thank you!

story:
The Project

Hi there. My name is Mike Bennett, and I'm the author of the free audio podcast novels, Underwood and Flinch, and One Among the Sleepless. I'm also the author of the podcast short story collections, Hall of Mirrors: Tales of Horror and The Grotesque, Volumes One and Two.

I've set up this Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to help me bring my latest work, Underwood and Flinch from podcast to print. I want to make the novel available in all formats - ebook, a paperback, and a hardback.

I wrote Underwood and Flinch over a three year period. Once a chapter was finished, I podcast it to an ever-growing global audience of listeners who were always hungry for their latest fix of the story.

Now that it's finally completed, I want to publish the novel as a print and paper book, and I'm humbly asking for your help to cover the necessary production costs. Anything you can afford will be greatly appreciated, and to show my gratitude, I'm offering perks at every level of funding - but the really great thing is, the finest perk I could offer you is already available for to everyone - for free - and that is Underwood and Flinch, the audio novel. It's complete and ready for immediate download in 45 episodes from iTunes, UnderwoodAndFlinch.com, and Podiobooks.com.

So, what is Underwood and Flinch all about?

All David Flinch ever wanted was a normal life.

But when you're a member of the Flinch family, normal has never been easy.

For hundreds of years, the eldest born male Flinch has been servant and guardian to the Lord Underwood. While the Flinches have changed through the generations, Underwood - a vampire - has been eternal. David had hoped to be spared the horror of serving his family's lord and master, but when he is summoned to the Flinch home in Spain by his dying older brother, he knows his luck has run out. Underwood must be resurrected from the grave in a ritual of human sacrifice, and David must be the man to do it. Because if he doesn't, an even greater evil than Underwood will rise: the evil that is David's sister. Underwood and Flinch is an epic horror-thriller that spans the centuries.

From the teeming slums of 18th Century London to an ex-pat community in modern-day Spain, Underwood and Flinch is an epic adventure that will grip you to the very last word.

But don't take my word for it, check out the listener reviews at your national iTunes store or at Podiobooks.com
 

A selection of episode covers from the U&F podcast.

What I Need & What You Get

Writing and podcasting Underwood and Flinch has often been a full time job for me, but it's been a labour of love, not one of earnings. Consequently, now that the time comes for me to bring the book to print, my resources are almost depleted. I need your help to fund the costs of publishing it and getting it on sale. My hope is that once it's on sale, it will begin to generate returns, and those returns will help to fund me while I write Underwood and Flinch 2. In short, you'd be helping me start up as an independent novelist who can publish his own work and hopefully make a living from it. Could that happen? Well, at the time of writing this, there have been nearly two million MP3 downloads of Underwood and Flinch, so if that figure is anything to go by then yes, I believe it could.

Become A Patron of U&F

Your help would make you a patron of Underwood and Flinch, and you'd be recognised as such on a Patron's Page at the official U&F website www.UnderwoodAndFlinch.com and (with donations of $10 and over) in the book itself.

The Perks

Candle-Bearer

Everyone gets something, and at $5 you get an email of thanks from me with an attached Fundraiser Edition e-book of the U&F prequel short story, Night Crossing. This edition will have a special introduction page that states that it was given as part of the fundraiser to someone who helped make the book of U&F possible + You are listed on the Patron’s Page at UnderwoodandFlinch.com as a Candle Bearer. 

Blood Donor

At $10, you're in the book! You receive the above + a Fundraiser Edition e-book of Hall of Mirrors Volume One (featuring the stories Hair and Skin, The Grave, The Haslet Technique) with unique introduction page for this fundraiser + You are listed on the Patrons’ Page at UnderwoodAndFlinch.com and in the book, Underwood and Flinch as a Blood Donor.

Stake-Holder

At $25 you receive the above + a pre-release Fundraiser Edition e-book of Hall of Mirrors Volume 2 (Salvation, The Green Man, The Exterminators, Night Crossing) + pre-release Fundraiser Edition e-book of Hall of Mirrors Volume 3 (Trolls, Wet Velvet, Give Me a Hundred) + a signed postcard depicting the cover art of Underwood and Flinch mailed to your home + You are listed on U&F.com and in book of Underwood and Flinch as a Stake Holder.

Fang-Tastic!

At $50 you're Fang-Tastic! You receive the above + A pre-release, first edition ebook of Underwood and Flinch as soon as it's finished + A set of four signed postcards depicting the podcast covers of Underwood and Flinch, One Among the Sleepless, Hall of Mirrors Vol 1, and Vol 2. Mailed to your home + You are listed on U&F.com and in book of Underwood and Flinch as Fang-tastic!

Sect Member

Congratulations! At $100 you join Underwood's legion of servants, The Sect. You receive the above + A first edition, signed trade paperback copy of Underwood and Flinch, mailed to your home + An A4 certificate of Sect membership in your name and signed by Lord Underwood + You are listed on U&F.com and in book of Underwood and Flinch as a Sect Member.

Black Circle

At $250, you're thoroughly evil, so you get to join Lydia's gang, The Black Circle. You receive the ebooks listed above, the signed paperback of Underwood and Flinch, the four cards, the Sect certificate + A first edition, pre-release, signed hardback copy of Underwood and Flinch, mailed to your home + A short MP3 audio scene where Underwood and Flinch thank you personally and welcome you to the Sect, and Lydia welcomes you to the Black Circle + You are listed on U&F.com and in book Underwood and Flinch as Black Circle.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Finally, if you are interested in this project - or maybe have some friends whom you think may be - I'd greatly appreciate anything you might do to help raise awareness: a tweeted link, a Facebook link, a blog link, anything would be fabulous.
 
Thank you for taking the time to read this, and remember, if you want Underwood and Flinch for free as an audio podcast, it's already yours - iTunes, UnderwoodAndFlinch.com, Podiobooks.com.

story:
The Project

 

Pensierini was a project created to help all those students who want to learn how to write in Italian and those who want to learn Italian by writing. “Pensierini” in Italian means the essays and compositions that we write in school as kids; the simplicity of expression and diction of those compositions calls to mind the way adults express themselves as they learn a new language.

Italian students spread across the globe who want to practice their written Italian have the opportunity to have their work corrected and then published on our weekly blog (https://pensierini.blog/). Corrections are made only to the grammar and orthography, not altering the original voice of the author, and allowing the native syntax to shine through.

 

 

Pensierini is in fact a literary undertaking. The idea is to bring a breath of fresh air to classical literary Italian: a language, which when used by foreign students, isn’t worn out by a lifetime of use, and is therefore full of expressive potential. This fact is supported by Jhumpa Lahiri, an American author and daughter of Bengali Indian immigrants, who decided to start writing in Italian: “I don’t have many words at all to express myself. I notice a state of deprivation. Yet, at the same time, I feel light and free. I rediscover the reason that I write, the joy alongside the need. I find again the pleasure I felt as a girl: putting words into a notebook that no one will read. In Italian I write without style, primitively. I am always in doubt. I have only my intentions, together with the blind, but sincere faith, of being understood and of understanding myself.” 

 

Why the Magazine

 

This magazine collects the best stories written by students, accompanied by illustrations, grammar tips, and statistics about Italy. Other than being recognition for the work done by these authors, it represents a tool for all those readers who want to practice reading literary texts written in easy to understand Italian. Approximately 2,000,000 people around the world study Italian. We think that it is interesting to further encourage the study and diffusion of Italian by means of writing, something that is often overlooked in language schools.  

 

 

Format

 

The magazine has been laid out and illustrated in a way to create an enjoyable reading experience and support the study of Italian. There are even gaps in the magazine, where students can relax and practice their written Italian, responding to various prompts.

-48 full color pages, 17x24 cm (7x9.5 in.)
-32 stories
-2 grammar tips
-1 table with a list of typical Italian expressions
-5 writing exercises
-illustrations

 

About Us

 

Project Creator: Ugo Coppari. “I am a novelist, who has been teaching Italian to foreigners for the past 10 years. I decided to create this project to combine these two worlds and also because I was curious to know what was happening in the minds of different people across the globe and their typical daily experiences. More generally I would like to know about the ordinary lives parallel international events (political elections, governmental successes and crises, wars and immigration, warnings about climate change, problems of unemployment, developments in artificial intelligence, etc.) and how these events can influence the development of everyday lives. As if our blog could answer the question: how does life continue in spite of everything else?”.

Illustrator: Valerio Compagnone (www.instagram.com/valeriocomp/)

 


The Community

 

The 27 authors published in the blog and in this magazine come from 16 different countries: the United States, England, Russia, Finland, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Switzerland, Spain, Greece, Syria, Nigeria, Mali, Argentina, Canada, and Turkey. Some of them still live in Italy.

 

Costs and Rewards

 

The funds collected in this campaign, will serve to cover the costs of the editing, illustrations and layout of the stories from the blog, as well as the creation of several video interviews, and of course the printing and shipping costs for the magazine, which will be given as a gift for those who decide to support our project.

 

 

 

italiano

 

Il progetto

 


Pensierini è un progetto nato per aiutare tutti gli studenti che vogliono imparare a scrivere in italiano o che più in generale vogliono imparare l’italiano scrivendo. I “pensierini” sono quei testi che scriviamo a scuola da bambini, testi la cui semplicità espressiva e lessicale ricordano il modo di esprimersi degli adulti quando imparano una lingua straniera. 

Gli studenti di italiano sparsi nel mondo che vogliono esercitarsi nella scrittura in italiano hanno la possibilità di ricevere una correzione al proprio testo, che poi verrà pubblicato settimanalmente nel nostro blog (https://pensierini.blog/). Una correzione puramente grammaticale e ortografica, che non altera la voce dell’autore, ma che al contrari lascia trasparire la sintassi della lingua madre. 

Pensierini è infatti anche un progetto letterario. L’idea è quella di apportare un po’ di freschezza alla lingua letteraria italiana: una lingua, quella usata dagli studenti stranieri, non ancora logorata dall’uso che se ne fa nel corso di un’intera vita e quindi carica di potenzialità espressiva. Come sostiene Jhumpa Lahiri, autrice statunitense di origine bengalese che ha deciso di adottare l’italiano come lingua per scrivere i suoi libri: “Non ho molte parole per esprimermi, tutt’altro. Mi rendo conto di uno stato di deprivazione. Eppure, al contempo, mi sento libera, leggera. Riscopro la ragione per cui scrivo, la gioia insieme all’esigenza. Ritrovo il piacere che provo fin da ragazzina: mettere delle parole in un quaderno, che nessuno leggerà. In italiano scrivo senza stile, in modo primitivo. Sono sempre in dubbio. Ho soltanto l’intenzione, insieme a una fede cieca ma sincera, di essere capita e di capire me stessa”. 


Perché la rivista 

 

Questa rivista raccoglie i migliori racconti scritti dagli studenti, accompagnati da illustrazioni e spunti grammaticali e statistiche riguardanti l’Italia. Oltre ad essere un premio per il lavoro svolto dagli autori, rappresenta anche uno strumento per tutti quei lettori che vogliono esercitarsi nella lettura di testi scritti in un italiano facilmente comprensibile. La lingua italiana è studiata da circa 2.000.000 di persone sparse nel mondo. Pensiamo sia interessante stimolarne ulteriormente lo studio e la diffusione attraverso una pratica, quella della produzione scritta, che troppo spesso viene trascurata nelle scuole di lingua. 

 

Formato

 

La rivista è stata impaginata e illustrata per consentire una lettura piacevole e quindi agevolare lo studio della lingua italiana. Sono stati inseriti anche degli spazi dove lo studente può rilassarsi nell’esercitarsi nella scrittura in italiano, rispondendo a domande di carattere universale.  

- 48 pagine in quadricromia, 17X24 cm
- 32 racconti
- 2 spunti grammaticali
- 1 scheda con lista di espressioni tipiche
- 5 compiti di scrittura
- illustrazioni
  
 

Chi siamo

 

Ideatore: Ugo Coppari (1982). “Sono un autore di narrativa che da 10 anni si occupa di insegnamento dell’italiano a stranieri. Ho deciso di creare questo progetto per coniugare questi due mondi ma anche perché ero curioso di sapere cosa passasse nella testa della gente sparsa nel mondo e quali esperienze caratterizzavano le loro giornate. Più in generale mi sarebbe piaciuto sapere quale vita correva parallela alle vicende di respiro internazionale (elezioni politiche, accordi o crisi di governo, guerre e migrazioni, allarmi sul cambiamento climatico, questione occupazionale, sviluppi nel campo dell’intelligenza artificiale, etc.) e come queste vicende potevano influenzarne il proseguimento. Come se il nostro blog potesse rispondere alla domanda: come va avanti la nostra vita nonostante tutto il resto?”. 

Illustratore: Valerio Compagnone (www.instagram.com/valeriocomp/)

    
La comunità

 

I 27 autori dei racconti pubblicati nel blog e in questa rivista provengono da 16 diversi Paesi: Stati Uniti, Inghilterra, Russia, Finlandia, Germania, Olanda, Francia, Svizzera, Spagna, Grecia, Siria, Nigeria, Mali, Argentina, Canada, Turchia. Alcuni di loro attualmente vivono in Italia. 


Costi e ricompense

 

I fondi raccolti in questa campagna servono a coprire il servizio di correzione permanente dei testi pubblicati nel blog, il lavoro di illustrazione e impaginazione, la realizzazione delle interviste video, e ovviamente le spese di stampa e spedizione della rivista, che viene vista come un omaggio a chi decide di sostenere il nostro progetto.

story:
Meet the Creators

We are 11-year-old Sy and Cynthia, a loving son and mother living in Texas. We hope to change the world with our message, embodied by this character and contained in this book, one family at a time.

Why We Created Sy the Mighty Minder

Sy Hubby has chronic asthma and was forced to stay indoors often. As a result, to stay active, we created a YouTube channel, where Sy played a spy character; the channel has successfully garnered over 1.7 million views.

The spy character served as the inspiration for Sy the Mighty Minder, as well as Sy's belief that “Just because a kid is bad, doesn’t mean they can’t be good again."  Eventually we created an entire story and universe built around this character.

It’s like Star Wars meets Black Panther meets Elf on a Shelf!

We hope to bring love to the world and remind every child of the powers of doing good deeds, compassion, kindness and friendship.

New Traditions

We would love to bring this story into your home, not only because it's a fun rhyming book you can read with your children, but because of its ability to help your child develop a kinder and more loving outlook on the world.

Every night have your child think of something he or she could have  done differently. Whether it's ‘bless you’ when someone sneezed, excuse me, I'm sorry, thank you or please.

 

What You Get

  • Illustrated, rhyming children's book: hardcover, full color, 32 pages

  • 9-inch plush figure

  • Your child will have their very own futuristic guardian to watch over them 365 days a year!

  • Teaching good deeds, diversity, inclusiveness

 

 

 

Our Goal

Our funding goal is $16,000. It’s a big goal, but an ambitious project requires an ambitious goal. We will use the funds to:

  • Print a quality hardcover color book
  • Manufacture a small run of the plush toy design, including required testing to make sure it complies with safety regulations
  • Order lots of smaller products from a few different suppliers

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is our first Indiegogo campaign and there is a chance we might have underestimated the time and work needed to complete this project. But we have been doing our very best this far to provide you with everything we know and plan to do. We will continue to do whatever it takes to complete and clear any issues that may arise during production and shipping.

We are currently working with book printers and plush manufacturers to work out every last detail to make sure the book and plush are perfect.

We still have to finalize the printing of the book, get the plush tested, and a few other details. We'll do everything in our power to deliver the book and plush on schedule (if not early), and promise to communicate with you should anything unexpected happen.

We have gotten this far on pure motivation, having researched how to create the book and plush, and nothing can keep us from getting this to your home as soon as possible!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out!

  • Click the links at the top, next to "Back It," to SHARE this campaign with friends, family, and anyone passionate about supporting kid creators, children's books, and positive energy!

  • FOLLOW US on Facebook, Twitter & Instagram for more updates on our progress with the campaign, as well as other great content!

 

Thank you for your support!!!

-Sy and Cynthia

story:
Pentalpha by Michelle A Cervantes

My book, Pentalpha is about a girl in college with magical abilities. While trying to fit in with her magical abilities, she meets other people who are similar to her and are able to help her discover the true power behind her abilities. This novel embraces the concept of self discovery and recognition of the power within all of us. I wrote it so that readers can partake in this journey of self discovery that will resonate with them for years to come. My book will publish in February, 2020.
 

Story of My Book

My name is Michelle Cervantes and I am the author of Pentalpha. I wrote this book because I want readers to experience a world of magic merged with the college experience, particularly at UCLA. I want readers to be involved in my journey through college while also experiencing magic in this alternative universe.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that the true sense of belonging from within. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for magic and self-discovery in you. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover the journey in life will lead you to harness your true powers from within.

In this book, you'll learn the meaning behind Self-discovery, Community and Empowerment:

 

Self-discovery - Curanda takes an impromptu journey to Mexico in hopes to find herself and connect with her ancestral roots

Community - Curanda and her friends joining the group on campus called The Community

Empowerment - Curanda discovers her one true power of all lies within. 

You will love this book if you enjoy realistic paranormal fantasy combined with the college culture of 2019. Pentalpha is a fiction book that speaks to both college students and adult paranormal fantasy fanatics alike who are looking for a story involving modern magic and experiencing the college culture

 

The Book - Pentalpha

The book is written in Three Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1-3 establishing Curanda’s background and her connection with her magical abilities as well as joining The Community

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-6 that highlight the college experience by having the characters manage their classes +social life while also hiding their magical abilities. Curanda learns to balance everything out from school work to even a developing relationship while trying to discover more to her powers. She also begins to prepare for her journey to Mexico in hopes of discovering not only her powers but her self as a whole.

Part 3 contains Chapters 7-10 that involve Curanda discovering more about her powers while being faced with a dark force known as the Dark Shadows that threatens to destroy humanity. She and The Community re-unite at UCLA in hopes of fighting them off. She also discovers who she can actually trust relationship wise. This part also includes a climax and unexpected ending that readers are sure to enjoy!
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in February, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Michelle Cervantes is a Psychology Undergraduate Researcher at UCLA, Reiki Practitioner, Neo-Pagan Witch, and self-published author on Medium.com. She wrote this novel to bring magic to the masses through the form of self discovery and belonging that parallel the author’s experience in college, adding a unique twist to the college experience.

She has a long time aspiration of publishing a fictional novel and allowing readers to experience life in college, particularly at a university like UCLA. She has experience with publishing stories and keeps close ties with the New Age, Metaphysical and Pagan communities, incorporating experiences from these communities into her novel to allow readers to experience magic.Her passions revolve around healing others through reiki energy healing, learning more about everyday magic and researching intimate relationships, integrating all of these aspects into her novel.

If you wish to summon her, draw a circle on the floor with sugar, bring lots of dark chocolate, a fluffy dog, dragon’s blood incense, and her favorite book: Witches, Sluts, Feminists.

For more information you can connect with Michelle at mcervantes.michi@gmail.com and Instagram @michellecervantes17, LinkedIn, Snapchat, Facebook.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #pentalphamac and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Michelle A Cervantes

PS: Here's an overall summary for y'alls to enjoy! 

Overall Summary

Nineteen-year-old Curanda always felt like an outsider. Ever since she discovered her power of bringing plants back to life, Curanda knew she was not like most people. Until she left for college. Curanda thought making it to UCLA was hard enough; having to deal with roommates, keep up with lots of work and trying to have some social life. But it gets whole lot more complicated when she has to deal with trying to remain hidden while also trying to figure out her true powers. Along the way, Curanda finds The Community, a whole apartment building filled with people that have powers like her. But when she realizes that these folks have way better powers than her, ranging from necromancy to clairvoyance even to skilled spell casting, she wonders how to find herself amongst all these people?

Curanda decides to take an impromptu trip to Mexico to find out her true powers and to find herself. While Curanda’s away, reports of missing students start to arise at UCLA, leaving everyone in The Community on edge. No one knows this mystery killer, but UCPD gets real suspicious of The Community. When Curanda hears of the news, she returns back to UCLA to deliver a new message: A war will happen on the day of the solar eclipse. The Dark Shadows, evil begins from the underworld, will raise hell upon the earth. Will Curanda and The Community be able to stop them before it’s too late? In this tale of self discovery, love and community, Pentalpha will allow readers to enjoy this tale for years to come!

story:
Short Summary

 

We have all been torn at some point by what we were told to be, what was expected of us and what we know to be right within ourselves. We try to fit the mould dictated by others, living up to their expectations, often cutting bits of ourselves off in the process.

Philosophers have asked these questions for centuries and it seems now, more than ever, we have a need to make sense of ourselves and our humanity, as the world we live in becomes more and more "humanly senseless"...  Who are we, what are we allowed to be, where are we being led and what will it mean for us as human beings... What is the bigger picture of our creation?

The more I have opened up, the more I realise the number of people who suffer in silence, unable to articulate their turmoil and pain. Our stories are important and ought to be told. I hope through sharing my story, it will show people that it is ok to speak up and show ourselves for who we are - our pains, our joys, our fears, our thoughts, our feelings and everything in between. The wall or 'normalisation' and taboo ought to be brought down in order to shine a light on what is truly happening within ourselves.

I believe it is through our own personal truth that we can make a difference in our lives, the lives of others and in the world. It is okay to say things as they are, putting aside the politically correct and the idea of 'perfection' that has been established in our society.

My name is Laura, originally from France I now reside in London. For a number of years I suffered from bulimia which had a heavy impact on my life and affected it rather dramatically. Having recovered and made sense of my experience as well as its reasons, I now want to share my story with people, hoping it might help them map their own journey and find their way out and to themselves.

The condition slowly led to a descent into the abyss of my own being, as I searched for clues of who I was (as a person and a human being) and who I was allowed to be. The existential crisis I suffered from an early age, took me on a journey of self discovery where through self-harm, pain and despair I found not only myself but some deeper understanding about our condition as human beings. 

'Searching for me' tells my side of the story and reflects on who we are, our relationship with ourselves and our place in the world. It is an invitation into my head and heart, the thoughts and feelings that governed me at the time and how I tried to establish a dialogue between the two, becoming my own interpreter; and through this, my own person.  

As well as looking at my experience of bulimia, the book looks at the bigger picture of the problem which unfortunately isn't limited to eating disorder for we are all on the hunt for ourselves and our identity. Bulimia was a mere way my inner crisis found to express itself, for others it my be depression, anxiety, other eating disorder, silence,...

People's contribution will help bring the book to life and hopefully help bring forth a dialogue not only about mental health, but about who we are as people, what we feel, what we think and the power we have dormant within ourselves. 

In order to show you the direction the book takes, here is an extract... 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I am about to start the final draft of the book and I need your help in order to finish and publish it. Your contribution will go towards working with an editor (as it is my first book and English isn't my first language), as well as designing the book cover and getting the first round of books printed...

Raising £2500 will get us on the way to get the books into people's hands.

Should we manage to go over this amount, I will use the extra funds to print copies and give them to schools and scatter them over the city for people to find. Some books come our way out of nowhere and can make a true difference in our life... you never know...

In exchange for your help and contribution you will be able to receive

  • a copy of the ebook
  • a paperback copy
  • a signed copy
  • be invited to the book launch in London
  • get your name in the book.

In the event we don't reach our goal, the funds will still contribute to making this book come to life, it will just take longer. The more funding we receive, the quicker the book will be in your hands and hopefully make a difference in people's life. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Writing this book has been challenging as I have had to reach back into my abyss and travel back in time to lay my story on the page. Though it hasn't always been easy, the idea that what I endured might help others, has been a driving force. 

One of the reasons for this campaign is to raise funding to bring an editor on board who will be able to guide me into finishing the book. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't everything in this world and any support will be greatly appreciated. Just spreading the word and talking about it would help the project take off. You never know who's ear it might fall into. 

Feel free to reach out to offer your support and in exchange we will keep you in the loop.

story:
The Happiness Manual presale campaign was a SUCCESS!!!

With so much joy and gratitude in my heart, I'd like to announce that we have reached our final goal, and now my book will be published as a Hardcover Edition. Together, you all have helped raise $6,039, with the project 120% funded and over 150 copies pre-ordered. 

I want to thank my family, friends, and New Degree Press for coming together to support me on this endeavor. Every share, pre-order, and comment on our page has been instrumental to this campaign's success - We couldn't have done this without you!

In the meantime, if you're looking for an inspiration boost, check out some exceptional interviews on my Think Clever podcast: https://thinkclever.co/podcast/

Many guests from the podcast will be featured in The Happiness Manual. 

 

Story of My Book

My name is Stas Arsonov, and I am the author of The Happiness Manual: A Guide to Your Daily Self-Mastery. I read a lot of excellent books in the field of self-help and personal development. They were all very inspiring books, but after I finished reading them, I was unsure how to apply it all to my life. I would get motivated for a few days, then pick up the next book, and the vicious circle of searching for ways to implement the information would continue. What I was really looking for was a self-help manual - a handbook that I could come back to again and again for guidance. That's why I wrote The Happiness Manual: A Guide to Your Daily Self-Mastery.

I wrote The Happiness Manual because I realized it's not always enough to say, "I choose to be happy." There are rituals and lifestyle adjustments that you can implement to achieve that state. I made it my mission to discover those and apply them to my life. I interviewed and learned from experts in the field how they took their leap of faith and pushed beyond their comfort zone and what awaited them on the other side. On my journey through life and writing this book, I have learned that achieving happiness consists of a few essential components, and that's what you'll find in this book.

Through reading this book, you'll learn about the journey of self-discovery and self-mastery. You'll hear stories from:
 

  • Scott Schwenk - a phenomenal meditation and breathwork teacher who helps people let go of their limiting beliefs, leading them to experience more joy in their lives. His teachings help many people live in harmony and become mindful of their thoughts, words, and actions.
  • Kai Karrel - a writer, a mystic, and a spiritual teacher who has facilitated hundreds of workshops worldwide guiding people through the journey of awakening and helping people build healthier relationships.
  • Exciting individuals who inspired me on my journey. People like Dr. Joe Dispenza, Bo Eason, Tony Robbins, and David Goggins. 
  • Many of the guests who appeared on the Think Clever podcast, appear in this book as well.


In reading The Happiness Manual: A Guide to Your Daily Self-Mastery, I hope you will discover that you can generate happiness every day. My goal is to show you it's not some mystical state that you need to deserve rather it's available to you right now. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement I found for the process of self-discovery and self-mastery. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you cultivate inner peace despite all of the ups and downs of life.

You will love this book if you are ready to release the limiting beliefs that hold you back from expressing your full potential and experiencing more joy in your life. If you want to have a better relationship with yourself and the people around you, The Happiness Manual will become an excellent resource for you.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this coming Spring.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will have the opportunity to do a one-on-one coaching session with me.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Stas Arsonov is a certified integrative nutrition health coach with a background in healing body-work, nutrition, and fitness. He has spent the past decade immersing himself deeply in mind and body optimization and learning from some of the great masters in the field of ultimate well-being. 

He is the host of the Think Clever podcast, where he interviews experts from the personal development field and helps his audience take their healing to the next level, develop meaningful relationships, free themselves of limiting beliefs, and better their job satisfaction.

Stas incorporates his experiences, skills, and genuine passion for the subject, to help people take control of their health and live a happy life. He is an avid traveler and uses each opportunity to meet fascinating people and learn something new. 

For more information, you can connect with Stas at stas.arsonov@gmail.com, follow him on Instagram @stas.arsonov and visit his website: https://thinkclever.co/ 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #happinessmanual and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Stas Arsonov

story:
Who are the Toronto Wordslingers?

We are a boutique guild of young independent authors based in the Greater Toronto Area. Our vision is simple: take our passion for storytelling and transform it into a career, helping each other along the path to success every step of the way.

Co-founded by indie authors Jody Aberdeen and Lucianna LiSacchi, the Toronto Wordslingers aspire to creating sharply original, relevant, and compelling fiction across many genres.

We aspire to achieve great things doing what we love the most. And we need your help to get started, with our debut event, AN EVENING OF SEX AND ROMANCE.

Why "Sex and Romance"?

The "sex" component comes from Lucianna's debut novel "Mommy's Little Playgroup", an erotic drama where an innocent exchange between one woman and her best friend's husband grows into a deep exploration of dark desires.

The "romance" component comes from Jody's debut novel "Convergence", a time travel romance with a twist in which the way opens between two fated lovers in parallel universes, but not for the reasons they expect.

How do I get invited?

If you're in the Greater Toronto Area and would like to be invited, simply donate here and contact Jody at jaberdeen@rogers.com letting us know you're joining us. 

What We Need & What You Get

Taking place at the beautiful Arta Gallery in Toronto's Distillery District, the night will feature readings, book signings, cocktails and mingling, and a few special activities, all of which come at a cost that we need to pay in advance.

Your donations all include admission to the event in Toronto on February 1st, and will help offset our expenses for the following:

- Venue rental
- Print costs for books and promotional material. 
- Photographers
- Media

We are also offering a variety of perks in exchange for your donations (see the menu to the right).

The Impact Of Your Donations

First, we have a philanthropic component to our fundraiser. We are partnering up with the Façade Academy of the Arts. Located just north of the city in Vaughan, Façade is the official school of the 2013 Vaughan Film Festival and recently launched their brand new Professional Acting Curriculum.

In conjunction with Academy founder Mina Spremulli, if we are successful in our fundraising goal for AN EVENING OF SEX AND ROMANCE, we will donate $500 of monies raised to the academy to be used in the school's first ever Professional Acting Scholarship. By contributing to our event, you'll be helping shape the professional future of one promising young arts student.

You'll also be helping to promote local Toronto businesses in the Distillery District and beyond. We are all very lucky to work and live in Greater Toronto, and anything we can do to add to the quality of life and art here at home is worthwhile.

And, of course, you'll be helping one boutique writer's guild punch far above its weight.

AN EVENING OF SEX AND ROMANCE brings together individuals and groups from many different areas of our great community, and will be a night to celebrate for many reasons.

And let's not forget yourself! Whether you're flying solo or if you have someone special, it's a fantastic night out on the town at the start of Valentine's season. You'll get to hear our stories, learn a few new things (both in and out of the bedroom) and maybe leave with more than what you expected than when you walked in.

There are many writers out there, but none of them are doing what we are doing in the Toronto area. We invite you to be a part of something special. Donate today!

story:
The Ask

I'm looking for 500 supporters to give $1 each ($500 total) in 500 hours or less (that means by Juneteenth - June 19).  I call these supporters my "Recession-proof Boosters"!  For this $1, you will get an electronic copy of my ebook once it is released.


Rules of the Game - The Story

Rules of the Game is about the the personal campaigns we wage to become the best at what we love . . . and the collateral damage we often leave in our wake.  


Envisioned as the start of a series, the Rules of the Game novella/series prequel exposes the chinks in the armor put up by ambitious players and coaches ﬁghting to preserve their love for the game of tennis as they struggle with the rules that govern life, love and success.  


Coach Mac (late-20s, African American) a bear of a man with a heart (and knack) for grooming young players, enlists as the new head of Academy development at a prestigious country club in the modern South with the support of an upstart county commissioner.   The surprising installment of a young, Black coach as the head of Academy Development and the recruitment of star, adopted siblings Crystal Moore (17, Chinese-American) and Jelani Moore (21, African-American) disrupts the cut-throat community of Sweetwater Creek Country Club - all to the chagrin of Grady R. Hayes IV (late-30s, Anglo-American), the Southern blue blood widely expected to run the Academy.  


Think: Friday Night Lights with the spirit of West Wing for young, professional tennis players in the urban south.


About the Author

I’ve played tennis since a racket was put in my hands at the age of 6.  Combined with an MFA in creative writing from California Institute of the Arts and a JD from Northwestern University, I have the unique background to tell this story of ambition, power and politics in the world of professional tennis.  


The Need

Immediate needs include: QuarkXPress (approximately $200 for an amazing piece of software that will enable me to self-publish and better establish a web presence) and a wide-format printer ($300 for the eternal ability to self-produce future works).


Other Ways You Can Help

Pass along the request to your family, friends and colleagues.  


And be sure to check back here often for updates.  500 hours and counting!


Thank you in advance for your help!

story:
Now, Everything Changes!
A wall of possibilities rolls across the land and nothing is the same behind it.


We've brought together 18 science fiction and fantasy authors who have subjected their characters to a storm front of change. Some of our Authors are Aurora, Nebula and Hugo winners.

We are launching our Anthology at the When Words Collide Convention in Calgary, Alberta on August 14th, 2015.

We'd love to see you there at our launch party!
What we'd also love is for our party to have a little more to it than the writers and editors signing copies until their wrists hurt.

We need your help in making our book launch a real party.

So if you want to help us bring our game, we're giving you the opportunity to help and in return we're giving out e-books, the physical book or a little more...
Looking for some feedback? We got some of that too. While supplies last!

Perks in this campaign that include an e-book or physical copy will generate an equivalent amount of royalties that copies of the book sold online or in stores will.
If this campaign generates more than the goal ($500 CDN), half the additional proceeds after the cost of the perks will pay into royalties to contributors while the remainder will be put towards the next anthology our spunky group of writers produce.

On behalf of all the authors and the hard working editors:

Thank you for your support!

Justin Acton
Publisher, Analemma Books
Calgary, Alberta

story:
Short Summary

Jon Pew serves his country in the US Army with the 101st Airborne Division at Fort Campbell KY. Jon is hugely passionate about his job, but is even more so about writing. Jon is a devout Christian serving within his local community, when he is not, deployed helping others. Writing Transition Man and getting it published has been a driving force in his life over the last year.

Jon has asked Tasha Turner Coaching to market Transition Man whilst he is serving his country overseas. Help us give Jon, more than a published book, lets give him chance to kick start his writing career. 

What Jon Needs 


$1,154 Editing and formatting
$116    Blade, the Griffin specically designed by Amy Winfield for Jon
$120    10 Books for signing
$404    25 Griffin branded Kids T-shirts, for children who have had a parent die in  
            service to their county.
$250     Professionally designed and social media interactive website
$256     Misc
-----------------------------------------------------------------
$2300 

What You Get if You Become Part of the Team

Become part of Jon's team and get some fantastic items as thanks. L.A.P bookmarks, the plot bunny that needs a hug. Bookmarks for Transition Man and Blade, the Griffin. Advance copies of the E-book before release. The ultimate prize, a signed paperback by Jon and signed mounted print of Blade! Check out the Gallery to see pictures!

If we do not reach our goal, the first priority is getting the Jon's book out there. 

The book has been edited by Lee Hargroder Porche.

Griffin - Blade created by Amy Winfield.

The Impact

We would not be able to get Jon's book out in time before his deployment without this. What would be better than sending him to serve his country knowing he is making a difference on multiple fronts. He is causing a moment of joy when a kid who has lost a parent receives a T-shirt with his own Griffin on it. Being able to provide signed copies of his book to people. We at Little Acorns will help his book grow and reach a worldwide audience. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help by:

Using the Indiegogo share tools to pass the word out about this great cause to your friends!

story:
'Hats off to Brandenburg' is the second novel by Graham Thomas, author of 'TheNeverPages'

The book needs to get out there and you need to read it.


****** 


London, 1815 - The Roxy Playhouse is in trouble! 
The Roxy Playhouse Irregulars, those libertine artists and dreamers are up to their necks in debt.

"Pay up in one month, or its curtains for you all!"

Dark times lead to drastic schemes and so the Irregulars decide to reinvent themselves as 'performance thieves', infiltrate High Society and 'Robin Hood' their way through it. 

However, getting embroiled in a dark and deadly plot to destroy the Monarchy was never part of their script.

The Roxy Irregulars will have to stage the performances of their lives if they want to save the day and make it home in time for last orders.

******

Brandenburg is a fast, fun and romantic adventure with a modern, anachronistic slant - think 'Oceans 11 out drinking with the Scarlett Pimpernel' and you'll get the tone of this action packed story.

The book is written, and now funds are being sought to release the most amazing artwork from Leighton Johns, get the proof copy signed off and get that first run printed.


This campaign is designed to push the production of this book over the last hurdle, create some awareness and to start getting the ball rolling on what is sure to be a rip-roaring success. 


TheNeverPress needs:

The book as the potential to be great, we just need great patrons...and you will be rewarded.

story:
I just completed my fourth book titled “Jesus Died for This?: A Satirist Searches for Christ?” In this book, I chronicled a series of travels starting with my first trip to Israel and ending with the 2008 election. As part of my findings, I discovered that real social change was not occurring in the author/speaker conference circuit but with local community groups. Often I found that people leading these grassroots initiatives felt isolated and that part of my role was to help connect these individuals with like minded souls. When this book release in August 2010, I hope to embark on a listening tour, where I can continue to connect with other grassroots groups so I can continue making connections, as well as exploring ways to profile their stories via articles, and blog postings as well as social tools like Twitter and Facebook.

I am securing accommodations with local activists and artisans but am looking for $500.00 to defray travel costs. I plan on giving funders either an autograph bookplate or an autographed copy of my book.

story:
The World Needs More Love Letters is an organization that uses social media to drive the writing and mailing of love letters to individuals in need around the world. Since our launch in 2011, we've written and snail-mailed over 1,800 love letters.

Visit our Site...Tweet Us...Facebook Us...Pin Your Heart to Us

Our Story

(Because even love letters have a love story)



I started leaving love letters across New York City back in October 2010 as a way to try to combat my own depression. One love letter, combined with the power of social media, resulted in an overnight overflow in my email inbox. Hundreds of people asking me to write them a love letter. Dozens upon dozens of sad stories that left me wondering, who in your life should have written you this love letter a long time ago?


Realizing that I was just one person, I first freaked. Then panicked. And then I sat down to write the best darn love letters that I could. Over 400 of them.


I saw the healing power behind those first 400 love letters. I saw so much of myself-- my broken self-- in single moms in Sacramento and tattered hearts in Kansas City.  As I scripted & scripted, the truth started showing up in every point of punctuation I placed down: the world needed far more than just my own love letters.


The World Needs More Love Letters was born in September 2011, just 5 months ago. The site is a haven for anyone who needs to request a love letter, receive a love letter or just wants to whip out stationery and write a love letter to someone else in need. We're a team of 12 Letter Writers and 1,400 digital volunteers, all meet one challenge- the task of scripting love letters for strangers.


Since September, we've brought over 1,800 love letters into the world. Individuals from every crook of this world--Nebraska to Romania, Canada to China-- have joined on to write and leave love letters. We've dealt with issues of depression, loss, suicide, anxiety, self esteem, illness, and many more. And the most beautiful part? We are really just beginning...


-Hannah Katy

@hannahkatyb


The Good in 44 Cents

More Love Letters is only five months old but already we've accomplished so much... Click on the links below to see some of our proudest moments.


  • Written & mailed over 1,800 love letters in just 5 months!
  • Sent over 20 Love Letter Bundles to people in need, each packed with 30-75 love letters.
  • Delivered over 100 love letters to baristas across New York City, even catching the eye of Oprah.
  • Collected over 900 love letters during the holiday season to be mailed to 12 individuals in need of more joy around the holidays.
  • Dropping love letters all over the world, from a small campus in Pensacola, Florida to the crooks of London and North Korea
  • A Love Letter to College Students during finals gone viral. Reaching over 150,000 college students in 72 hours.
  • Working with elementary schools and middle school groups to write and bundle up love letters.



The Impact

We want to be able to send out 300 Love Letter Bundles and we are kick starting the process with 50 Love Letter Bundles in the month of February. A Love Letter Bundle is a package, ranging with anywhere from 10-100 love letters written for someone in line for a love letter. How did they get in that line? Well, a family member or close friend reached out and asked us to write a love letter for them. 


Unfortunately, without donations, we cannot continue to mail out these Bundles. They will not have the impact they were born to have without support from all involved. I am currently paying out of pocket to get these love letters mailed and I will keep doing so, even if I am penniless. Honestly, I will walk these love letters to their recipients if that is what it takes. But, instead, I pray you'll find it in your heart to help.


We're all a little nostalgic for these letters, and in an age where we rarely get anything in our mailbox beyond a cellphone bill, it is so important that we keep these Bundles of handwritten letters coming into the mailboxes of the people who need them most.




The Break Down

$2,500...


Broken down, that's 300 Love Letter Bundles shipped at a whopping $1,800.

60 books of stamps for our dedicated team of Love Letter Writers. And the leftover cash will all be put towards jazzing up the Bundles in the best way possible. We believe every Love Letter Bundle should look ready for a first date, ready to meet the hands of someone who needs a boost today.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet it. Facebook it. Shout it out on rooftops.


And then come write love letters with us. Sign up for the Love Letter Alert List and check out the site to see all the ways you can get involved. We'd be absolutely flattered to have your scribbles in our mailbox at the end of the day.
