The Book of the Great Queen: you've asked for it, and it's almost here! 
After years of research and requests from you, I'm ready to bring this 
long-awaited book to life. Together, we'll explore the mysteries of the 
Morrigan, the ancient Celtic Goddess of battle, sovereignty, prophecy, and Otherworld power. Your backing is all I need to bring this comprehensive and powerful book to publication!Bringing the Great Queen to YouMy name is Morpheus Ravenna. I write the Shieldmaiden Blog and I'm known in my community for my service as a priest of the Morrigan, the Celtic Goddess of battle, prophecy, and Otherworld power. I've been studying these traditions for almost 20 years – my entire adult life. I've combed the volumes of Irish lore, ancient history and archaeology, and modern scholarly study for insights to help modern practitioners understand and connect with the Great Queen. My research notes encompass hundreds of pages of material, some of it never presented outside academic publications. And now I'm ready to share my years of study with you.The book I'm writing combines the depth of historical perspective with the insights of a modern practicing devotional polytheist. It's a book unlike anything else that has been published to date, and I'm thrilled to be collaborating with Concrescent Press as my publisher to bring this book to you. Just like any big project, there are costs to getting it done, including publishing costs as well as the time I need to devote to writing the book. So I need you to be part of bringing The Book of the Great Queen to life. You can make this possible by backing me!What I Offer You
The heart of every alliance is reciprocity, isn't it? So here's what I have to offer you. We've created a spectacular array of rewards for our backers, including:

Autographed copies of the book, sent to you before release to members of the public

Electronic editions of the book

Exclusive, limited edition signed and numbered art prints from original devotional art ONLY for backers of this campaign

Exclusive, limited edition “SOVEREIGN” T-shirts with the Great Queen art design, ONLY for backers of this campaign

Ultra-rare hand-bound artistic editions of the book, created by fellow priest of the Morrigan and professional book artist Amelia Hogan

Inner-circle participation for my backer community including private behind-the-scenes Q&A sessions and vblog updates, early release draft material, and more. Come along with me as I pen the project of a lifetime!

Personal gratitude - your name in the book as my patron, personal thank-you letters, and hand-scripted prayers

Original, one of a kind devotional artwork available to one elite backer
and much more!

These will ONLY be offered through this campaign.Hand-etched and finished in 18 gauge copper, hung on a woven-knotwork leather cord, and blessed on my altar.The "PEACE TO THE SKY" Prophecy ArtI’m creating this new devotional artwork just for The Book of the Great Queen:
 an ornately detailed depiction of the Morrigan and Her “Peace to the 
sky” poem, hand-painted in "Book of Kells" illuminated manuscript style 
on real calfskin vellum. A limited number of high-quality signed and 
numbered art prints from this piece will be made, exclusively for 
backers of this campaign. These prints will ONLY be available through 
this campaign! And one elite backer has the opportunity to claim the 
one-of-a-kind original artwork, signed and framed for display. Current stage of the Morrigan's "PEACE TO THE SKY" Prophecy art. case-bound using waxed Irish linen thread, PvA adhesive and small 
dye-lot endpapers; hand-scraped leather spine covering 1/8" Davey 
book-board; title and spine lettering pressed in gold.Here's a preview of Amelia's exquisite craftsmanship: please note that the decorative papers and textures used in our editions may vary from this prototype.     The T-SHIRTS:Here's our original design for the "SOVEREIGN" t-shirts, which will be exclusively printed for this campaign:Here's a mockup showing the look of the t-shirts once they're printed:These
 t-shirts will be printed from a sweatshop-free screenprinter, and will

story:
My name is Lara Shpilberg.  I have a master's degree in special education and years of working experience here in Israel. Yet, I have never thought it would be necessary to put everything I know to practice with my own child.

At 2001, I gave birth to my second daughter, Margo. She was born extremely premature on the 26th week, weighed only 770 grams (1.7 Ibs). During her first months, Margo experienced nearly all the typical horrors of severely premature children: a severe hemorrhage in her brain, two whole-body inflammatory states, retinal pathology and almost a complete hearing loss. On repeated occasions she was on the verge of death. At the neonatal intensive care unit, they gently asked: Maybe you should let her go rather than make her live such a miserable life. However, Margo still struggled and we have made a decision to struggle with her.

When we signed out of the hospital three months later, she weighed 2200 grams (4850 Ibs) and her prognosis was very pessimistic.  We took home a child with serious hearing problems, cerebral paralysis, no fingers on the left hand (following a prevention of blood flow) and a variety of concerns in dozen other spheres. We almost lost any hope she would be able to: understand, talk, walk, run, read, write, jump, dance, learn and make friends… would be able to live, like everyone else.

Then I started writing- at that time I didn't know it was going to be a book.  These notes include many useful methods, funny episodes, thoughts and ideas. My native language is Russian, so I wrote in Russian, It started as an online diary of mother of a problematic child. Since then, it has been more than 10 years.

My wonderful daughter has excellent grades and will go next year to 5th grade in a regular Israeli school. She runs and jumps, dances and sings, avidly reads encyclopedias and fairy tales, speaks two languages and started learning English, tries to play the guitar- with no fingers on one of her hands(!) and is mathematically gifted.  Of course we were very lucky, but we have also put a lot of effort into it. All the family raised her, each family member contributed individually. Margo is adored by everyone in the family; she has friends in school and a hundreds of friends around the world- those who have read my notes about her for 10 years.

My experiences of being a special educator and of raising Margo gave birth to the site as2X2.com. On this site I publicly posted, what eventually turned into a book and a story of success. The entire book is published in Russian at http://as2x2.com/content/dnevniki-goshkovoda.

Many times I received requests from parents and specialist from different countries to translate this book to English. This way the book would become available for a bigger audience, including non-Russian speaking parents. Our friends in Russian community helped us to translate some excerpts of the book to English. One can read them at http://eng.as2x2.com/content/learning-playing

 

It is not easy to translate such a text; it requires professional translation including many episodes of child's speech. Fortunately a translator was found. Still, this service requires 7000 dollars, and an additional amount of 3000-4000 dollars for the final editing of English text by a native speaker. If we succeed to raise this money, the English text of the book will be published for  free online access.

story:
It appears the immigration battle has hit home. My good friend Matteo is facing deportation, no criminal charges, just the fact that he lived and worked here without citizen status. If you know him you love him. we, his friends, as well as those who support the right of all humans to exist freely.he is being held at the buffalo federal detention center,  all money raised will go directly into an account which will be used to put money on his books, pay for lawyers and to reimburse anyone who may have put up money to help with these costs. you can also send matteo money directly here http://www.ice.gov/detention-facilities/facilities/btv.htm

Please help our good friend stay in the country that is his home

story:
The Project

An American woman- traveling solo- couchsurfs her way around the world. And writes a tell-all guide on how to do it and the personalities one might encounter along the way. 
 
With the advent of email, pen pals have fallen away. However, a passion for exposure and understanding of other cultures remains a fervent desire in human nature. Instead of receiving letters from around the world at one's door, one is opening their door to the world...and offering their sofas and local expertise in order to foster friendships in the comfort of their own home. Called "couchsurfing," it has become a movement.
 
Volume One: A River in Jordan, covers one woman's travels through Israel, Palestine, Jordan, and Egypt utilizing couchsurfing. The book will cover the adventures, the mis-adventures, good decisions and really bad decisions, and all the colorful characters and situations she finds herself in. River intends to discover her world upon the sofas of others, wherever those may be...in the caves of Petra, in Bedouin hooshas on the edge of the Red Sea, and on board feluccas sailing up the Nile. 
 
This journal/guidebook will be available in Kindle format, softcover and hardcover editions. The Photobook will consist of her photographic odyssey with excerpts from the journal.*
 
"Like many people, I always had aspirations to travel around the world. Like many Americans, life circumstances and consequences blocked the way. At forty-two years of age, I am not the most seasoned of travelers, although I still possess my traveler's (untested) heart. 
 
"In deciding to couchsurf, it was disconcerting to find a lack of information about this method of travel. Also, at my age and (lack of) experience, I even had to wonder at the feasibility of it all. I hope this book will demonstrate its capabilities and potentialities;  therefore, opening up a person's potentialities for travel outside of their comfort zone in similar fashion. And for those not wishing to embark on such an adventure, it will prove to be an entertaining slice of life from another's home halfway around the world into yours.
 
"Being alone and unseasoned at traveling, having never couchsurfed before, means I am putting myself out there to make all the mistakes and be the guinea pig for others. It is a job I am particularly suited for, having no shame at all. I am also brutally honest, which means the journal will not be edited in order to save face with the readers. Let my foibles be your volley for your own journey- either upon your own couch at the end of your day, or upon some couch our your choosing in yet another corner of our Earth." 
 
- River Eirtree

* The Journal/Guidebook's publishing date is set for September 22, 2013. The Photobook will be ready for shipping on November 1, 2013.

 

Why We Need What We Need

The goal is set in order to accommodate:

- All travel expenses for one month abroad

- Production costs for the Kindle version of the book ($199 formatting plus additional Amazon distribution fees)

- Printing and binding costs for the softcover and hardcover version of the book

- Printing and binding costs for the Photobooks

- Printing costs for the archival-quality photo paper prints 

- ISBN registration and online distribution 

* Any additional funds raised beyond the initial goal of $4,500 will be applied toward travel expenses for future travel, including North Africa, Burning Man for the Middle Aged, and couchsurfing around Las Vegas. 

 

Well, What About Your Needs

You have access to the fruits of the project via a Kindle version of the journal/guidebook, or even an actual pre-21st Century style physical copy of the book (softcover or hardcover). River will also be producing a separate photographic essay of the journey, including excerpts from the journal; this will be a larger 12 x 12 format. And it can all be yours if the price is right. 

 

The Impact

This book, I hope, will serve as an incentive for others to follow. It is intended for those who, like myself, thought their savings needed to be augmented into dental work payments or whose children's school schedule and summer activities seem prohibitive to travel. This book- and couchsurfing in general- are intended to be proof that this is a small world after all. And life is too short. 

 

About The Author/Photographer

The Author...Like a Deer in Headlights

River Eirtree was born in Wyoming to Los Angeles-native parents. She was raised as a toddler in Southern California; spending every weekend at Disneyland, her mother continually took her onto the "It's A Small World" ride. Eventually, River got the message.
 
Finding herself in her developmental years living next to a circus in Baraboo, Wisconsin, River spent her time riding elephants and camels, and shoveling tiger manure. For three years, she also attended clown college and mime school, just for good measure. 
 
Attending college in Wyoming, River worked as a rodeo photographer. She majored in Music Performance (String Bass) while cultivating a love of archery and fencing. She became a classical actor for years and had her own theatre company in Manhattan before moving back to Wyoming to become a vegetarian, raise a daughter, and run an animal rescue. She also worked for two years as a highly-rated disc jockey. 
 
Back in NYC, River finally has discovered what she wants to be when she grows up (in case she ever grows up), and is a graduate student of Chinese Medicine and Acupuncture. Her goal is to travel the world providing medical care to those without through this portable, sustainable and complete medical system.
 
She has been a contributing writer to an underground campus humor magazine, and a professional copywriter. River has also had photography exhibits in New York City, and was raised in the art (and in the darkroom) by her professional photographer father. 
 
Spiritual without being religious, she has decided to full-heartedly embrace the philosophy of her late mentor, Joseph Campbell, and follow her bliss. She sees couchsurfing as a viable tool along her personal Hero's journey into the heart of Life and into a deeper understanding of the people who touch our lives and share our planet as they follow their own paths.  
 
River's photography may be viewed at river-e.com
 
(project image from the Red Couch Europe series, photographed by Horst Wackerbarth)

story:
Short Summary

Slagdrop is a collective of writers, artists, and musicians that aims to connect people with literature and art in new ways. We are going to publish a one time newsprint magazine called Slagdrop Presents America... You're Welcome! This magazine will be dedicated to all things America - the patriotic, the pinko, the wild and the weird. This magazine aims to be a smorgasbord with short fiction, art, comics, essays, poetry, photography, etc.

With your help, we can create a magazine that is fun and interactive celebrating the diversity of creativity found only in America. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1000 to do this right. Printing costs $700 and we are also paying our contributors for their work.

If we raise more than $1000, we'll be using that to fund our other projects down the pipeline which includes a print anthology of short fiction, more live events, videos, a play,  a novel, and more themed issues just like this one. 

***A NOTE ON THE PERKS FEATURING ADVERTISEMENTS: You can send us anything. If you don't have something you want to promote, send us a picture of your cat. If you do have something you want to promote (your business, your book, your website, your opinion, provided they are not racist, sexist, or illegal), then that's what we want, too. The advertisements can be fun or serious. If you don't have the skills to make a graphic for your ad, tell us what you want and we'll do it.

Perks

THE WASHINGTON- $1 donation gets you a thank you and a high five. Not just any high five, mind you, the kind of high five George Washington gave to Benjamin Franklin when he stuck it to Corwallis at Yorktown. 

THE LINCOLN- $5 donation gets you a thank you, a high five, and a digital copy of Slagdrop Presents America... You're Welcome. Even Abraham Lincoln would be jealous. 

THE HAMILTON- $10 donation gets you all of the above, plus a printed version of Slagdrop Presents America... You're Welcome!  and a Rick Perry Scary sticker. Alexander Hamilton would be proud of your contribution towards American creativity.

THE JACKSON- $20 donation gets you all of the above plus a 2.5" x 2.5" black and white advertisement on one of the pages. Yee haw! Andrew Jackson is eating a block of cheese.*

THE ZELAZNOG- $35 donation gets you a thank you, a high five worthy of Washington, a digital download, a printed magazine, a Rick Perry Scary sticker, and a 5" x 5" black and white ad. Mysterious Zelaznog will mysteriously be thankful. 

THE GRANT- $50 donations gets you a thank you, a high five worthy of Washington, a digital download, a printed magazine, a Rick Perry Scary sticker, and a caricature of you drawn by one of our many talented doodlers. This doodle will be signed and sent to you as it will also be featured somewhere in the magazine for the ultimate level of humor and prestige. All of Ulysses S. Grant's wishes will have been granted thanks to your generosity.

THE MATTIX- $75 donation gets you everything in the Grant level and also a half page ad (5" x 10"). Mattix will be well pleased. 

THE FRANKLIN- $100 donation gets you everything in the Mattix level plus we will name a page after you or your business (as long as your business is a legal one). This will be at the top of the page like so: (YOUR NAME) Presents Slagdrop Presents America... You're Welcome, Page #.

THE HOLBERT- $250 donation gets you everything in the Franklin plus Spencer Holbert, man of many talents, will make a life-altering decision on film. It will be uploaded to YouTube, disseminated through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and just about anything else and will have a producer credit in your name. That life-altering decision will be him cutting his hair into the unemployable, all-American style colloquially known as the mohawk-mullet. 

THE HILBERT- $500 donation gets you everything from the Holbert and Andrew Hilbert will write you into the History of the United States of America, never to be denied, never to be forgotten inside the pages of Slagdrop Presents America... You're Welcome! Hilbert will be happy to make you the former shadow President of this fair country.

THE ROMNEY- $1000 donation (you're a big shot, ain't ya?) gets you everything (YES, EVERY SINGLE AD SIZE IS YOURS), plus we rename the magazine: (YOUR NAME) Presents Slagdrop Presents America... You're Welcome. Romney, still drinking the tears from his most recent loss, will cry a single tear dedicated to you and look to the heavens and say, "Thank you, thank you."

THE BOLSHEVIK- $10,000 donation gets you that prize mentioned in the video. 

The Impact

We've been through a tough time, America. Recession, war, the NSA watching you reading this, and congressional gridlock just to name a few of our woes but that doesn't mean we can't celebrate our genuine American weirdness that comes in all shapes and sizes. We're not here to celebrate any political party, we're here to celebrate the creativity of the American people.

Your donation matters. This will be a magazine that is unlike any other. We're excited about it. We hope you are too.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to contribute. Please help spread the word and share this campaign with everyone you know. Every little bit helps!

story:
Printing History

For over 30 years, The Yeshe De Tibetan Text Preservation Project, named after one of the greatest translators of 8th-century Tibet, has preserved, published and freely distributed Tibetan Buddhist texts. Each year, at the Nyingma World Peace ceremony in Bodh Gaya, India, thousands of monks and laymen come to Bodh Gaya to receive these reprinted texts in an effort to preserve their heritage and the Buddhist teachings.

This year, Yeshe De is printing the Derge edition of the Tanjur texts. The Tanjur contains the commentaries of Indian and Tibetan masters through the ages and contains invaluable advice for Buddhist practitioners. Buddhist knowledge is not static and as such is constantly being explained and eludicated by living masters who have practiced the path.

By helping us print this high quality edition of these texts (consisting of 3,387 texts by 758 Indian masters and scholars,  translated into Tibetan by 373 panditas (learned masters) and translators!) you help keeping both the Tibetan heritage ánd the living transmission of the Buddhist teachings alive.

Funding and Tie-in project

The total funds we need for this project exceeds many tens of thousands of dollars.
However, groups all over the world have already committed to fund large parts of the project with their own volunteer projects and labour.

The printing process is already on motion. To sustain the printing we need to generate at least 1100 EURO in funds. This money will go towards operating costs, shipping and materials.

Ány contribution is helpful! One of the main tenets of Buddhist thought is that any positive action is significant. We invite you to view even the donation of one euro towards this goal as such and to appreciate your own spirit of sharing.

We have tied this project to our Tsa-Tsa project. A tsa-tsa is a small Buddhist clay stamped sacred symbol, in this case a small stupa. Sacred symbols in Buddhist tradition are visible manifestations of the Buddha. If you make a donation of 50 EURO you will receive one of our handmade tsa-tsa's. When you make a donation of 108 EURO or more, you will receive 3 tsa-tsa's. You can keep the tsa-tsa for yourself, or give it away to loved ones (or enemies!).

But what do these books do?

Tibetan Buddhism is popular, but is in serious danger of becoming a watered down version of what the Buddha actually taught. Buddhism is something that relies on both study ánd practice. The books we reprint will enable practitioners in the centuries to come to continue to read the words of masters who lived the knowledge and are as such capable of giving relevant instruction on the Buddhist path.

Over the years the Nyingma organisation of Tarthang Tulku Rinpoche, through the Yeshe De Text Preservation Project has reprinted and distributed over 8 million books. These books now form the basis of libraries for both monasteries and western dharma centers where students can once again study them and put them into practice.

Here you can see a short impression of the Nyingma World Peace Ceremony of 2013 where the Derge edition of the Kanjur was distributed:


Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to contribute, but lack funds, we are always in need of volunteers. You can also help us by simply sharing this fundraiser and spreading awareness of it. If you can share this campaign in your network, please do!

story:
Short Summary

I am a 25-year old independent researcher and writer based out of Montreal, Quebec. I am a self-employed writer (i.e., poor), with a focus on studying ideas, institutions, and individuals of power and resistance across a wide array of social, political, economic, and historical spheres. I have been doing research and writing for roughly six years, and have been published on CounterPunch, AlterNet, Occupy.com, Truthout, TruthDig, RoarMag, and have been a guest on CBC Radio, BBC Radio, Russia Today and RTAmerica to discuss a number of different political and economic issues.

My research aims to be at academic standards, but my writing aims to be accessible and comprehensible to all. My approach is highly critical and my conclusions are often radical, but I follow the facts and do the research to reach my own conclusions. I post my writing on my website (www.andrewgavinmarshall.com), which includes excerpts from my book, and I am also starting a research and writing project with Occupy.com (a media outgrowth from the Occupy Wall Street movement), and am also heading up the Geopolitics division of a new think tank (to be launched soon), called The Hampton Institute. I have written a great deal on the global economic crisis, the history of the American Empire, Europe's debt crisis, and social movements from Europe to the Arab Spring, the Chilean student movement and Quebec's 'Maple Spring.'

I have been crowd-funding The People's Book for over a year now just through my own website and social media. While the Project has maintained, I have limited resources and limited reach. My objective is to raise $5,000 in order to finance the completion of the first volume of the People's Book Project.

The People's Book Project

The People's Book Project aims to produce a series of books examining, in detail, the ideas, institutions, and individuals of power and resistance, through history until modern day.The objective is to provide a thorough, well-researched, radial critique of power and study of resistance, in order to arm activists with information and knowledge to change the world for the better. Revolutionary times need revolutionary ideas. In the past three years, youth have been in revolt from Tunisia, Egypt, Bahrain, and Yemen, to Greece, Spain, Italy, the UK, Portugal, Iceland, Chile, Canada, and increasingly in the United States. My aim is to help my own generation - and future generations - deal with the major issues and problems of our time (economic, political, social, environmental, and cultural), by providing a synthesis study of these issues, their root causes, the institutional and ideological structures of power, and the evolution of resistance around the world.

The First Volume, which this funding objective is for, introduces readers to the institutions of domination in the world today, and the evolution of resistance and potential for global revolution. Among the many topics covered are:

- The Concept of a 'Sociopathic Society': imagine a world in which those who run governments, corporations, banks, international organizations, and other powerful institutions were all functional sociopaths. What do you think this world would look like? My suggestion is that this is exactly the world we live in.

- An introduction to Empire: how has imperialism functioned since World War II? What are the main institutions, ideologies, and individuals who promote, operate, and profit from empire? This includes studying the military-industrial complex, foreign policy, National Security strategies, think tanks, foundations, and key strategists over the past 50 years, such as Henry Kissinger, Zbigniew Brzezinski, and Madeleine Albright.

- The Global Economic Crisis: what are the ideological and institutional causes and consequences of the global economic crisis? Focusing on the roles played by the major banks, government agencies, ideological doctrines (such as neoliberalism), and the effects of the crisis upon the poor, middle class, and those who caused the crisis (in the top 0.001%).

- The European debt crisis: What are the causes of the European debt crisis? Was it really that Greeks are lazy, or that Italians like to drink? Or was the causes embedded within the European monetary and political system itself? The response of the crisis has been to make it worse, punishing the populations of Greece, Ireland, Portugal, Italy, and Spain into abject poverty and exploitation through the implementation of "austerity" and "structural adjustment" measures. What is taking place in Southern Europe is spreading across the Western world, and reflects what the West has done to Africa, Asia, and Latin America since the 1980s debt crisis.

- The Arab Spring: It began in Tunisia, spread to Egypt, Yemen, and beyond, but also to lesser known uprisings in Bahrain, Morrocco, Algeria and Jordan. What are the conditions that caused the uprisings, and what have been the reactions been from the local dictatorships and the foreign (Western) imperial powers that fund and arm them? How has the Arab Spring evolved and adapted over the past two years? Where might it head in the future?

- Popular resistance in Europe: From the anarchists and anti-fascists in Greece, to the Indignados in Portugal and Spain, resistance is spreading like wildfire across Europe, new movements, radical actions, and often with anarchists on the front lines. If 20th century resistance largely saw socialists and communists as the main forces of resistance to the West, the 21st Century is seemingly showing anarchists on the front lines both within and outside the West itself.

- Occupy the Police State: Resistance emerged in America in the form of the Occupy Movement, which rapidly became a global phenomenon. How did the Occupy movement emerge and evolve over time, what actions and initiatives has it undertaken and what have been its failures and accomplishments? The reaction from the government has been revealing, as declassified documents showed that Federal and State-level police agencies, directed by Homeland Security, sought to undertake surveillance and ultimately destroy the Occupy Movement. Looking at the function and actions of Homeland Security, the emergence of a surveillance society and the attacks upon civil liberties, America is rapidly becoming a police state designed to protect the powerful from the people.

- Empire in the Age of Obama: Did the Obama administration bring "hope" and "change" as promised, or simply more of the same? Looking at imperialism under Obama, drone warfare, assassination programs, support for coups, the arms trade, funding and arming of dictatorships, wars and militarization, the American Empire under Obama has reached dangerous new levels which, if escalated into Iran or further into Pakistan, threaten to engulf entire regions and possibly the world into dangerous new conflicts.

- Poverty, food crisis, land grabs: With half the world's population living in abject poverty and hunger, with one billion people living in slums, the global food crisis which erupted in 2007 (and continues to today) is pushing tens of millions more into desperation while banks like Goldman Sachs and Barclays literally make a killing. The price of food has sparked a global land grab, with rich investors from America, Europe, China, India, and the Gulf dictatorships grabbing vast tracts of land in Asia, Latin America, and especially Africa, displacing rural communities, destroying biodiversity, and threatening much deeper levels of poverty and hunger.

- Environmental crisis and Indigenous resistance: what are the root causes of the global environmental and ecological crises we face? Truly, we are at a point in which humanity can potentially face extinction if we do not radically change the way in which we interact with the environment. Indigenous peoples around the world are on the front lines of envrionmental devastation, with their land and resources stolen and plundered by multinational corporations and powerful states; and they, too, are on the front lines of resistance, from Ecuador, Brazil, Sub-Sahran Africa, to Canada with the 'Idle No More' movement, Indigenous peoples are teaching the people of the world that we are all 'indigenous' to Earth, and must protect it lest we destroy ourselves.

- The College Crisis and Student Resistance: Education is in crisis, with youth "over-educated" and under-employed. Students have been on the front lines of protests in Egypt, Tunisia, Spain, Greece, and beyond. What has happened to the institutions of education, and what direction are they headed? Why are youth shackled with enormous debts before they even have a chance to begin their lives and seek autonomy? Student resistance has become a powerful new force, with massive student movements shaking Great Britain, Chile, Quebec, and Mexico. How can student movements evolve, and how should education evolve?

- Global Governance and Global Revolution: the response of power to the multiple global crises it has created (political, economic, social, environmental) is to globalize power further, to create new global institutions managing monetary, economic, financial, and political functions. Corporations are leading the way with "free trade" agreements, becoming more powerful than most governments of the world, while states integrate into regional entities (such as the EU), and we begin the process toward establishing institutions of global 'governance.' On the other hand, resistance too, is globalizing. What is the evolution of resistance in different regions of the world, and how can it find new opportunities for co-operation across borders, regions, languages, and cultures? What is the potential for a global revolution, and what could the outcomes of such a process be?

This is not an exhaustive list, but rather some of the main points of discussion and analysis which will be examined in the First Volume of The People's Book Project. Donations to this Project will allow this work to be done, to acquire the time and resources necessary in order to finish the first volume and begin the editing and publishing process.

Objectives

The $5,000 fundraising goal is to fund my research and time into writing this volume of The People's Book Project, acting as patron to my efforts, and allowing me to access the required materials and resources (such as newspaper subscriptions, journals, and other necessities) which will strengthen the research and inform the conclusions. Whether or not the entire funding goal is reached, every bit will help support my efforts in pursuing this Project.
 
The aim of The People's Book Project is to provide an easily accessible and comprehensive resource for individuals, activists, and others to empower themselves with knowledge and inform their actions. True change for the better can only come from "the People", from popular resistance and collective action and individual initiative. The People's Book Project is written for the people, to help the people in whatever way it can, and is entirely dependent upon support FROM the people in order to become a reality.
 
I want to be able to provide a meaninful and useful resource largely for my own and future generations, to be both an easy introduction to those who are newly interested in power and resistance, as well as adding useful information and new ideas to those who are already well versed in such issues.
 
I think that a necessary pre-requisite to solving any and all of the world's problems is firstly to engage in open, honest, and direct communication. This requires an honest understanding of ourselves and the world we live in, and communicating openly and directly with one another, in our individual relationships and between cultures and communities globally. This book aims to encourage an open, honest, and direct discussion and understanding of the world we live in, and what we can all do to make it a better place.

Indigenous peoples around the world are on the front lines of envrionmental devastation, with their land and resources stolen and plundered by multinational corporations and powerful states; and they, too, are on the front lines of resistance, from Ecuador, Brazil, Sub-Sahran Africa, to Canada with the 'Idle No More' movement, Indigenous peoples are teaching the people of the world that we are all 'indigenous' to Earth, and must protect it lest we destroy ourselves.
- The College Crisis and Student Resistance: Education is in crisis, with youth "over-educated" and under-employed. Students have been on the front lines of protests in Egypt, Tunisia, Spain, Greece, and beyond. What has happened to the institutions of education, and what direction are they headed? Why are youth shackled with enormous debts before they even have a chance to begin their lives and seek autonomy? Student resistance has become a powerful new force, with massive student movements shaking Great Britain, Chile, Quebec, and Mexico. How can student movements evolve, and how should education evolve? 
- Global Governance and Global Revolution: the response of power to the multiple global crises it has created (political, economic, social, environmental) is to globalize power further, to create new global institutions managing monetary, economic, financial, and political functions. Corporations are leading the way with "free trade" agreements, becoming more powerful than most governments of the world, while states integrate into regional entities (such as the EU), and we begin the process toward establishing institutions of global 'governance.' On the other hand, resistance too, is globalizing. What is the evolution of resistance in different regions of the world, and how can it find new opportunities for co-operation across borders, regions, languages, and cultures? What is the potential for a global revolution, and what could the outcomes of such a process be?
This is not an exhaustive list, but rather some of the main points of discussion and analysis which will be examined in the First Volume of The People's Book Project. Donations to this Project will allow this work to be done, to acquire the time and resources necessary in order to finish the first volume and begin the editing and publishing process. 


Objectives
The $5,000 fundraising goal is to fund my research and time into writing this volume of The People's Book Project, acting as patron to my efforts, and allowing me to access the required materials and resources (such as newspaper subscriptions, journals, and other necessities) which will strengthen the research and inform the conclusions. Whether or not the entire funding goal is reached, every bit will help support my efforts in pursuing this Project. 
 
The aim of The People's Book Project is to provide an easily accessible and comprehensive resource for individuals, activists, and others to empower themselves with knowledge and inform their actions. True change for the better can only come from "the People", from popular resistance and collective action and individual initiative. The People's Book Project is written for the people, to help the people in whatever way it can, and is entirely dependent upon support FROM the people in order to become a reality.
 
I want to be able to provide a meaninful and useful resource largely for my own and future generations, to be both an easy introduction to those who are newly interested in power and resistance, as well as adding useful information and new ideas to those who are already well versed in such issues. 
 
I think that a necessary pre-requisite to solving any and all of the world's problems is firstly to engage in open, honest, and direct communication. This requires an honest understanding of ourselves and the world we live in, and communicating openly and directly with one another, in our individual relationships and between cultures and communities globally. This book aims to encourage an open, honest, and direct discussion and understanding of the world we live in, and what we can all do to make it a better place.
